loans.name: Georgina Alcelma

texts.es: La señora C. es casada , madre de cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad  e independiente de ella,ha manejado 17 creditos con  fundacion los cuales han sido todos para capital de trabajo, ella trabaja con el apoyo de su esposo ya que ellos se dedican al cuido y mantenimiento de tumbas en el cementerio de san felipe tiene alrededor de 30 años de tener esta actividad , la cual les permitio formar a sus hijos, tambien se dedican a la elaboracion de cruces , locetas y bases las cuales ellos las comercializan . L a señora C. es una persona emprendedora que ha logrado salir adelante de su enfermedad como fue cancer en el ceno, que le ataco duarante largos diez años y a pesar de ello a logrado cumplir con su meta como era ver realizados a sus hijos como profesionales  tambien agradece el apoyo y confianza que leon 2000 le ha brindado para lograr cumpli r con esos sueños
texts.en:
Mrs. C. is married and the mother of four children who are now grown and living on their own. She has managed 17 loans with the Foundation, which have all been for working capital. She works with the help of her husband, dedicating themselves to the care and maintenance of gravesites at the San Felipe cemetery. She has been conducting these activities for approximately 30 years, and it allowed her to raise her children. They also manufacture crosses, headstones and bases to offer for sale. Mrs. C. is an enterprising woman who has managed to get ahead despite a bout with breast cancer which she fought for ten long years. Despite this, she has successfully met her goal of seeing her children become professionals. She also thanks the Leon 2000 foundation for the support and confidence they have provided her in her efforts to realize her dreams.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Kaneez Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez Fatima is the wife of M. B. and lives in an historical place named Yadgar, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the last 6 years. She is the mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her elder son is a butcher by profession. The others are free and don’t do anything. Her daughters prefer to do household work. Kaneez Fatime Baji’s husband is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Kaneez Baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy livestock (goats) for her son’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Naseem Baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (cooking oil, lentils and spices) for her food business. Imtiaz Baji and Ruqaiya Baji each wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Farzana Baji wants a loan to buy meat to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Roeung

texts.en:
Roeung C., 30, is married and has three children. The family lives in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Roeung earns income working as a tailor, typically making US$2.5 per day. Roeung has been involved in the tailoring business since 1998 after finishing a specialized school. Roeung's husband works in the fishery department, making about US$2 per day. Every month, the family spends US$50 on food, US$10 on utilities, US$5 on their children’s education, and US$10 on transportation.
At present, Roeung C. is asking for a loan of US$600 to be able to purchase a sewing machine to help in her business. In the future, she wants to open a small tailoring shop.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine for a tailoring business

loans.name: Adzovi Ahoefa

texts.fr:
Madame A. Adzoui Ahouefa vend des mèches, tissages, et défrisants pour les femmes dans son quartier de Lomé, la capitale de Togo.  Elle a 43 ans, et elle a commencé ce travail depuis 2001.  Elle est mariée avec un enseignant et ils ont 3 personnes à charge.  Avec son entreprise, qui s’appelle Coiffure « MAGNIFICATE », Madame AKAKPO peut aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permit d’acheter des mèches, tissages, et défrisants afin de mieux servir ses clients pendant les fêtes de la fin d’année.
texts.en:
Ms. Adzoui Ahouefa A. sells hair extensions, weaves, and straightener for the women in her district in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 43 years old and started this business in 2001. She is married to a teacher, and they have three children to look after. Her enterprise, which is called Coiffure « MAGNIFICATE », can assist her husband with covering family expenses. This initial loan she is requesting is going to enable her to buy hair extensions, weaves, and straightener in order to serve her customers better during the year-end holiday season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, weaves, and straightener

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị S. 38 tuổi, là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Gia đình chị có hai con đều đang tuỏi đến trường. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi và làm đậu phụ bán với thu nhập 5.000.00đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000 đ một phần chị sử dụng để đầu tư mua nguyên liệu về làm đậu phụ, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phạm Thị S., 38 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2003. She has two children who attend school. Currently, the main sources of income for her family are raising animals and tofu production. Their total monthly income is 5,000,000 VND (288 USD). In the next lending cycle, Mrs. S. hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD) to invest chiefly in buying ingredients for making tofu, and also in part to raise animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tofu production

loans.name: Orfelinda

texts.es:
Orfelinda es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Orfelinda es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Orfelinda vende ropa que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son al crédito, la ropa lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Orfelinda prepara tortas que reparte de acuerdo a pedidos.
Orfelinda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de uniformes para la campaña escolar.
Orfelinda sueña con tener una pastelería en un local estable.
texts.en:
Orfelinda is a partner of the Communal Bank called "Amor Divino". Orfelinda is a live-in partner, she is 42 years old and she has 3 children. Orfelinda sells clothes that she offers to her friends and relatives. She makes her sales on credit. She buys all the clothing in the city of Lima. Orfelinda also makes cakes that she delivers according to the orders. Orfelinda needs a loan of 900 soles ($300), and the money will be invested to buy school uniforms for the school season. Orfelinda dreams of having a bakery in a stable premises.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school uniforms for the school season.

loans.name: Hulda

texts.en:
Hulda has sold maize in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 16 years.  She belongs to the Ujamaa group loan (group code 2063).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $350 from her business.  Every day, she works from 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more maize for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, she can increase her profit and grow her business.  

Hulda is 48 years old, married, and has eight children: ages 30, 28, 24, 22, 18, 16, 15 and 9.

loans.use: To buy more maize to expand her business.

loans.name: Bèdjè (Le Commun) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bèdjè comprend sept  femmes mariées vivant dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 44 ans et 6 enfants  dans le quartier Rails Ko de   Markala (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens  d’amitié et de voisinage et font les activités d’achat et de vente de  condiments alimentaires, du charbon de bois,  du bois de chauffe et du poisson séché, fumé etc. Elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt de groupe après avoir correctement remboursés les trois prêts précédents.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt  pour acheter 10 sacs d’oignons frais dont une partie est séchée et torréfiée, 2 paniers de choux pommés, 1 sac de graines d’arachide qui sera transformées en pâte, 3 sacs de sel de cuisine, 50 kg de fonio et 2 cartons de pommes de terre. 
Elles se ravitaillent   à la foire  hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou auprès des forains venant de Niono et des jardiniers de la place. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes, à domicile, en ambulant et au marché. 
Elles envisagent  réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de   22500FCA qui sera utilisé  pour  le remboursement du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Bèdjè is comprised of seven married women living in monogamous families in the Rails Ko district of Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali). They average 44 years of age and 6 children each, and they know one another through ties of friendship and community. Their work involves buying and selling condiments, charcoal, firewood, dried fish, smoked fish, etc. The women are on their fourth group loan after having correctly repaid the three preceding ones.

The group members intend to use this loan to buy 10 sacks of fresh onions (part of which will be dried and roasted), 2 baskets of cabbage, 1 sack of peanuts (to be processed into a paste), 3 sacks of salt, 50 kg of fonio (a kind of millet), and 2 boxes of potatoes. Supplies are gotten at the weekly fair in Diamarabougou from vendors from Niono and from local gardeners. Sales are made at the house, door-to-door, and at the marketplace, cash or credit accepted from customers composed of men and women.

The group members envision realizing an average monthly profit of 22,500 francs CFA that will be used to make loan payments and to help cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments, peanuts, fonio, and potatoes

loans.name: Mery Marina

texts.es:
Mery es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Mery es casada, tiene 25 años y 3 hijos, Mery vende comida y gelatinas sus ventas los realiza en un terminal de buses de transporte urbano, actividad que realiza todos los días con el apoyo de su mama.
Mery necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Mery son construir su casa y tener un carro para que su esposo trabaje.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of Banco Comunal Azucenas. She 25 years old, is married and has 3 children. Mery sells food and jello snacks. She sells her food at an urban transportation bus terminal. She is able to do this with her mother's help. Mery needs a loan of 800 soles. She will use the money to purchase rice and sugar. Mery hopes to build a house and have a car so that her husband can work.

Translated from Spanish by SANDY JUAREZ, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar.

loans.name: Abdu's Group

texts.en: K. Abdu is the leader of Bugolo group. He has a retail shop that has been operational for over 10 years. He sells essential items that are needed by the locals in his area and he says that although there are many shops next to his, he has many customers that he has managed to win because of the good care he offers them as well as having sufficient stocks of goods. This is also possible because of the loans he gets from Pearl microfinance that enable him to stock more bags of sugar, salt, maize flour, and others from Jinja town.

loans.use: Restocking retail shop with more products.

loans.name: Gaia Group

texts.es: El banco comunal " Gaia" esta conformado por  un grupo D. socias que cuenta con experiencia D. trabajo en grupos solidarios ya que cumplieron con responsabilidad y puntualidad con sus anteriores financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital. Los 12 miembros del grupo eligieron como su representante a la señora Lotty quien al igual que el resto del grupo se dedica a la comercialización D. productos como venta D. barrotes en tiendas D. barrios, venta D. comida, ropa, zapatos y el resto D. los miembros del grupo se dedican a actividades como a la elaboración D. muebles D. madera, al servicio D. transporte público y a cortes D. cabello en peluquerías. Dentro del rubro comercial existe gran demanda y oferta D. productos por lo que los socios deben esforzarse el doble para poder llevar el pan D. cada día a sus hogares, es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento ya que coadyuvara al crecimiento D. sus pequeños negocios para que estos con mayor mercadería y con herramientas en buen estado generaran mayor ingreso pudiendo así brindar una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Gaia" communal bank is maD. up of a group of members who have prior experience working in support groups and have complied responsibly and on time with previous loans in institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. The 12 members of the group have chosen Lotty as their representative. Lotty and most of the group sell products such as groceries in neighborhood stores, food, clothing and shoes and the rest of the group work at different activities such as making wood furniture, public transportation and cutting hair in beauty shops. There is a lot of competition in the marketplace and the members have to try doubly hard to earn money for their households. For this reason they need financing which will help them grow their small businesses so that with more merchandise and working tools in good condition they can generate more income, thus providing a better standard of living for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rahimahon

texts.ru: Маллаева Рахимахон- женщина 51 лет. Рахимахон занимается откормом крупно рогатого скота. Рахимахон на полученный займ хочет купит бычка откармливать и когда вырастить перепродать по выгодной цене. Рахимахон также является членом фермерского хозяйства от туда она  собирает сена  поэтому еда для скота ей не проблема. Также Рахимахон занимается переработкой пряжи. Муж Рахимахона работает трактористом и мало получает деньги. Рахимахон надеется что, получив займ она   улучшить условия жизни.
texts.en:
Rahimahon Mallaeve is 51 years old. She makes her living raising and feeding cattle. Rahimahon would like to take out this loan in order to buy a calf for fattening and subsequent sale at a higher price. Rahimahon is also a member of a farmer's co-op where she gets the hey for her animals, so she will have no problems feeding the calf. Additionally Rahimahon also prepares and spins wool. Rahimahon's husband works as a tractor driver and earns only a small salary. Mrs. M. is hoping that this loan will allow her to significantly improve their living conditions.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Munuka Group

texts.en:
Rukia R., 33, is married with two children ages, 13  and 1.  She has a salon business at a place called Mazambalauni, some few kilometers from the city centre. She started this business about 10 years ago.  She works from 8am to 7pm daily. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $191.

This will be Rukia’s 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the business, bought a fridge for keeping juice for selling at a nearby school and paid college fees for her your sister and has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants to use the new loan to increase on capital and to save half in the bank..

Rukia  will share this loan with her group  Munuka, which totals 16 members; The members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Rukia is 1st on the right.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora María Magdalena tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, en el departamento de la Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió primaria completa, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la venta de carne y cerveza, este negocio lo tenía desde que inició en Manuela Ramos, pero no contaba con mucha mercadería, poco a poco su negocio fue incrementando y ahora distribuye sus productos por el distrito de Moche y en Trujillo, sus clientes ya son estables (conformados por familiares y amigos), además del negocio mencionado también se dedica a la preparación de menú (solo para familiares).
Sus productos como la carne, lo trae de Virú; y la cerveza la adquiere mediante tiendas distribuidoras.
Con el primer crédito de 300 S. que recibió de su Banco Comunal Virgen de Fátima, lo invirtió en la compra de carne.
Con este crédito de 1700 S., lo invertirá en la compra de carne y cerveza.
María tiene como sueño tener su propia bodega para ofrecer sus productos que actualmente vende.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Magdalena is 49 years old and lives in the Moche district in the province of Trujillo, department of la Libertad, Peru. She completed her primary studies and has now two children who depend on her economically. Maria works selling meat and beer, a business she has had since she joined Manuela Ramos. She began without much merchandise, but little by little her business has grown, and she now distributes her products in the Moche district and in Trujillo. She has a stable clientele (made up of relatives and friends), and besides the aforementioned business she also prepares food (for family members only). Her meat is supplied from Virú and the beer is bought from wholesale stores. She re-invested the first loan of 300 S. that she recieved from her Village Bank "Comunals Virgen de Fatima" to purchase more meat. The 1,700 S. she is now requesting will be used to buy both meat and beer. Maria's dream is to have her own shop, from which she can offer the products she currently sells.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat and beer for her business

loans.name: Shola

texts.en:
Shola is 40 years old and she is married with a child. She sells sarongs and jewelry.

Shola hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs and jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Kasokoso Central 2 West Kagoya Mariam Group

texts.en: K. Mariam, a 40-year-old widow with five children, three of whom are in school, buys and sells car oil. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional stocks of oil to meet customer demand. Her future plan is to enlarge her shop to earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase more car oil to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Julia Nancy

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Julia es soltera, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Julia vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, también vende calzados a pedido, además Julia administra la lavandería de su mama.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de detergentes.
Los sueños de Julia son tener una sucursal de la lavandería y surtir con mas productos sus negocios.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank, "amaquella" meaning "don't be lazy" in Quechua. Julia is 45 years old, single with 2 children. She sells cosmetics through catalogs to friends and family members. She also sells footwear by request. In addition to this she also manages her mother's laundromat. Julia needs a loan of 1200 soles which will be used to purchase detergents. Julia's dreams are to open an additional location of the laundromat and to offer a better variety of products at her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica McBride, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase detergent

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Monsieur Kodjo n’est pas menuisier, mais il s’est spécialisé dans la vente de meubles, à savoir des fauteuils, des armoires, des lits, des tables et autres accessoires. Ce commerce lui permet d’assurer parfaitement tous les besoins essentiels de sa femme et de ses 07 enfants. Il reçoit tellement de demandes de ses clients, qu’il est obligé de se rendre plus d’une fois au Ghana, le pays voisin, dans le mois pour s’approvisionner. Tous ses meubles sont faits en tecks, qui est un bois de qualité supérieure dans la confection de ces objets. Il a débuté ce commerce en 2001  et son étalage se situe dans le quartier d’Anfamé à Lomé. C’est pour lancer une nouvelle commande qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour répondre aux attentes de ses clients. Il n’a aucune inquiétude pour rembourser son prêt.
texts.en:
Kodjo is not a carpenter but he has specialised his business into a furniture business, especially armchairs, armoirs, beds, tables and accessories. His business lets him provide for all of the essential needs of his wife and their 7 children. He receives so many requests from his clients that he is forced to go to Ghana more once per month to restock his supplies. All of his funiture is made of teak, a superior quality wood typically used in furniture manufacturing. He started his business in 2001 and his store is located in the Anfame quarter in the city of Lome. He has requested a loan from Wages (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase a new order, and so that he could meet his clients' demands. He is very confident about being able to repay his loan.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase household furnishings.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia S. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children.

Cynthia owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cynthia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married and has one child. She sells women's clothing at the central market in Kherson. She has been in this business for 3 years. During this time, she has learned that there is a large and constant demand for the items she sells. She also learned that, to be successful in sales, one needs to have large variety and good client service. She feels this is something she can do well. 

Natalya, her husband Andrei, and their 11 year old son, Daniel, live in a small apartment. Both son and husband support Natalya in her business. Natalya would like to borrow 8,780 UAH to increase the assortment of goods that she sells. She hopes to make additional profit and spend it on current family needs.

loans.use: To buy more and different goods to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: This is Rufina S., 46 years old, a preacher's wife from Silang, Cavite. All their four children are in different school levels. Rufina started her scrap metal buying business three years ago. She began small. She bought all kinds of used metals and even glass bottles and sold them to bigger buyers who in turn sold them to foundries. She makes P36,000 a month. Rufina thanks God for finding the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. With the loans she received, her business grew steadily. She is now in need of a P10,000 loan as additional capital for her junk shop business. She prays for God's provision so she can handle her children's education. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
To help her husband meet their needs, Marieta indulged herself in taking care of their piggery. Her sow recently gave birth to ten little piglets. Marieta is feeding her hogs with feed, and now they are consuming more. She hopes to avail of a loan of at least 4,000 PHP for additional capital to buy supplies of feed for her hogs and sow. Aside from feed, she also needs to buy medicines for their protection and healthy growth. She hopes that her loan will be provided because it will be very helpful to her business as well as to her family.

Marieta is a married businesswoman who lives in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. Her husband is working on their farm as another source of income for them. They have no children yet, but they have lots of hopes and dreams for their future. They hope that their business will continue to be progressive for their future family’s welfare.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy supplies of feed

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 46 and married with five children. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with eight people. Teopista takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.

Teopista doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her home from delivery trucks which get charcoal from villages. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Teopista works seven days a week. She receives an average of 40 customers a day and sells to all categories of people both wholesale and retail. She doesn’t pay monthly rent as she works from her home.

Teopista‘s monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. Her major business challenges are the rainy season and transportation. She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for twelve years. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange M. is 22 years old and is married with one child who is two-and-a-half years old. Solange lives in Southern Province, Rwanda, where her shop is located.

Solange sells different kind of product such as shoes, bags, clothes, etc., and has been in business for eight years. Solange’s husband has a monthly income of approximately 20,000 RWF and her own monthly profit is 100,000 RWF before requesting this loan.

Solange is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to purchase more inventory, which will help her to earn more profit. With the extra profit, she hopes to expand her business through purchasing more bags, shoes, clothes, etc. This expansion will allow her to serve more customers.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.en:
Tolibjon is 41 years old. He was a driver and, six years ago, he started to process and sell dried apricots at the market on the weekends. Gradually, he gained more and more customers and the demand for his products increased. So Tolibjon decided to dedicate himself full-time to his food business. Now Tolibjon is requesting a loan of $1500 USD to purchase dried apricots to continue improving his business. He wants to grow his business and you can help him. Your support is very important to Tolibjon.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more dried apricots

loans.name: Sara Vda De

texts.es: Sara en una señora que tiene 64 años de edad, Sara es viuda y vive en domicilio en alquiler en una localidad de Cochabamba. Sara es rentista por viudez de parte de su esposo, además cuenta con ingresos que le paga su hijo por cuidar a sus nietos ya que el mismo esta en el exterior del país. Cuenta también con ingresos adicionales por trabajar en una salteñeria los fines de semana como cocinera. Sara no tiene competencia al ser rentista y los ingresos adicionales que recibe de parte de sus hijos por cuidar de sus nietos es directa. Sandra solicitó el crédito para realizar compras de fin de año para su hogar. Sandra demostró tener un muy buen comportamiento de pagos en las varias secuencias de crédito solicitadas en nuestra institución así como en otra entidad financiera donde también cuenta con crédito.
texts.en:
Sara is 64 years old. She is a widow and lives in a rented home in Cochabamba. Sara supports herself by means of a widow's pension and money her son sends her. He lives outside of Bolivia and she uses the money to care for her grandchildren. She also depends on the additional income she earns cooking on the weekends at a salteñeria. Sara does not have the skills to invest her income and she spends the money her children give her to care for her grandchildren. Sara is requesting a loan to make end of the year purchases for her home. Sara has proven to be reliable in making repayments on past credit sequences with Fundación AgroCapital and an additional financial entity.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items for her home

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet N. is 54 years old and she lives in Barangay Manghanoy in the town of Moises Padilla. This is a village located near the base of Mount Kanla-on, an active volcano on Negros Island.  Her home is surrounded by the expansive rice fields that support the region. Juliet is married and has one son who has graduated from college already and is working in town. She has several businesses which have helped improve her quality of life.

Juliet makes her own native delicacies. In her basement, three sacks of peanuts rest against the wall. She boils and salts the peanuts and sells them in small bags. She also makes peanut butter which she sells in the market of Moises Padilla and other areas. She also makes baye-baye, a treat made from young coconut and young rice. It is originally from the town of Dumaguete in Negros Oriental but it is popular all over Negros Island.

She is going to use her loan of 20,000 pesos to buy some of the ingredients for making her native delicacies. A sack of flour costs Php 2,200, a sack of rice costs Php 1,750 and the sacks of peanuts are Php 875 apiece. She also has a piggery and pays Php 1,800 for a piglet. She has to purchase feed for fattening the piglet for sale in the market. From all of these businesses, she has an average monthly income of Php 20,000.

Juliet is also going to use her loan to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her rice farm. She has a small farm of about 1 hectare with expenses of 25,000 pesos every four months. Every harvest period, she gets 110 sacks of palay, or unmilled rice, which she can sell for 66,000 pesos.  

Juliet is a member of good standing. She is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making delicacies, and fertilizer and insecticides for growing rice

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en: Bayarjargal is 22 years old and lives with her mother and child in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Recently, Bayarjargal's mother has been taking care of her grandchild in their home. Sometimes her mother cooks food and sells it to the salespeople who work at the market. In April 2009, Bayarjargal attended a beauty course in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. During the day, she operates a beauty service business in her own province. Previously, Bayarjargal had spent four years cooking food with her mother and selling it to the salespeople who work at the market. Bayarjargal is a hardworking and open person. She says, “I would like to expand my beauty services business into a  salon.” She is requesting a 280,000 Tugrug (~ 197 USD) loan to increase her working capital and to purchase equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for beauty salon.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: La Sra. Concepción R. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, habita en el barrio cerro de hule donde tiene ubicado su negocio el que consiste en una pequeña pulpería bien surtida de productos básicos para el hogar, la cual tiene ocho años de tenerla. Tiene tres años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado cuatro créditos los cuales los ha invertido siempre en su negocio. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, pan, etc. con el objetivo de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y así poder obtener mayores ingresos para brindarles un mejor nivel de vida a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Concepción R. is from El Sauce and lives in the Cerro de Hule neighborhood where she has her small grocery store. She has had her store for 8 years and she stocks it with all the usual basic household items. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for 3 years and has had 4 loans that she has always invested back into her business. The loan requested now will be used to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, bread, etc. in order to meet customer demand, have higher income and provide a better standard of living for her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, bread, cooking oil, snacks.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a photography business. She lives in Brgy. Tapi Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her husband, Israel, who is a photographer and their two children. The children are 20 & 23 years old and still go to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and photography business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 28,000.

Alicia is now borrowing PHP 17,000 so that she can sustain her general store. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Alicia aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorng Yoen, 55, and her husband, Mr. Bunthon Hem, 61, (pictured together), live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1971 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home.

Thorng and her husband have been operating a business selling jasmine flowers and bananas for 15 years. They buy them under contract from the nearby district and transport them to sell in the Phnom Penh market.
  
Thorng does not have enough capital to purchase jasmine flowers and bananas for resale. So, she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase jasmine flowers and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia M., 57, is married to Ricardo M., a farmer. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life by managing her own fruit stand.

Virginia has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s Cooperative. She uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her fruit business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan to replenish and maintain her fruit inventory. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a happy and comfortable life for her family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: restocking her fruit inventory

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
H. Mohira grew up in a home where the principal work was, and is, agriculture. She acquired skills in this field when she was very young from working with her parents. Agriculture has become her principal source of income and she dedicates most of her time to the attention and care of her agricultural products. Through her daily work, she looks to give her family security and economic stability. However, due to unexpected difficulties, she cannot cover all of her expenses, and she needs a loan to improve her products and increase her sales. Her objective is to construct a house on land that she acquired a little while ago. All of this can be possible with your help. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history.  It was the site of a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after it gained its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History 

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily B., 44, is making sure to provide her family's daily needs. Married to Rogelio B., a fishball vendor, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own fabric business for quite some time now.

Emily has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by allowing her to buy more of her current products to replenish her inventory and thus expand her business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more of her current products to replenish her inventory and thus expand her business

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a 29-year-old vendor who works hard at the business of selling bread and cakes in his retail shop. He has been in this business for eight years, and also sells fruits and vegetables to supplement his income. He is married, has three children, and joined Faulu Kenya as a way to increase his income and meet their needs.  He makes good use of his membership to share business ideas, save money and secure loans. His membership has also allowed him to learn how to keep business records.  He has applied for a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy more bread and cakes to sell to his customers. In the future, he hopes to build houses he can rent out to tenants.

loans.use: To buy bread and cakes to sell to his customers

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina J. is currently in the business of selling beer in a bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Edina is 41 years old and is married to a policeman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a salon shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. 

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma D. S. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 46 years old. Gemma is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora U. is from the village of Olingan. She is 57 years old. Teodora separated and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Teodora owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetic products such as shampoo, soap, perfumes, and lotion from Avon in the local community. Teodora is just starting this business.

In 2006, Teodora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teodora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teodora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Teodora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Julia Albertina

texts.es:
Julia es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el distrito agrícola de Oyotún, una zona agrícola con abundante recurso hídrico que presenta una geografía accidentada debido a su cercanía a la sierra norte del país. Se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mas de  veinte años, ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde siembra arroz. Debido a la abundancia de recurso hídrico en la zona, en Oyotún se suele sembrar arroz hasta dos veces por año, a diferencia del resto de zonas agrícolas de la región, en donde solo se le siembra una vez por año.

Julia utiliza los ingresos que percibe producto de esta actividad ayudando a su esposo, que también es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economia familiar. Gracias a esta actividad han podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, los cuales ya están independizados. Actualmente Julia desea adquirir diversos productos agrícolas como pesticidas y fertilizantes que le permitan asegurarse una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Julia es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su dias transcurren entre ocuparse de las labores de su hogar y cuidar de su cultivo. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Julia is a 53-year-old mother who lives with her husband in the agricultural district of Oyotún, an agricultural area with abundant water resources and uneven terrain because it is close to the country's northern mountain range. It is located approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has been a farmer for more than twenty years. She has a small field where she grows rice. Owing to the abundance of water in the area, in Oyotún rice is sown twice a year. In the region's other agricultural areas, rice is only sown once a year. Julia uses her income from this work to help her husband, who is also a farmer, with supporting the family. Thanks to this work they have been able to provide for their children, who are now adults. Now Julia wants to acquire various agricultural products like pesticides and fertilizers that allow her to guarantee a good harvest. To reach her goal, she has found it necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles. Julia is hardworking and dedicated to her family. She spends her days on household chores and taking care of her field. She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa before and has been punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizers and pesticides for rice field

loans.name: Mrs. Yorn Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people make up this village bank loan and they live in Sam Raong village in Takeo province. Mrs. Yorn K. is the village bank president selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Yorn K., 39 years old, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice which she sells to support her family. She is a widow with a child who is studying in school. Mrs. Yorn K. sells rice and chicken in the local market where she is able to earn a large profit. Since her current business is going well, she wants to expand it. With this goal, Mrs. Yorn K. is seeking a loan to buy more rice and chicken to sell.

loans.use: To buy more rice and chicken to sell

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María de 62 años, vende artículos de plásticos en su casa o en ocasiones recorriendo las calles, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Inicio vendiendo los artículos plásticos a conocidos poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar mas mercadería, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los días vendiendo platos, lavacaras, baldes a un bajo costo. 

Con el préstamo quiere continuar vendiendo mercadería por eso quiere comprar lavadoras, baldes y otros artículos plásticos. En el futuro quiere tener un puesto en el mercado para tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria, 62, sells plastic articles from her house or sometimes on the street. She lives in an urban area named Guasmo, notable for the majority of its inhabitants running informal businesses. She began selling plastic articles to people she new, and little by little with work she was able to buy more merchandise, and now works from 8:00am until 1:00pm every day selling dishes, washbasins, and buckets at a low price. With the loan she wants to continue selling merchandise, so will buy washbasins, buckets, and other plastic articles. In the future she wants to have a stall in the market in order to have a larger income.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Platos, valdes

loans.name: Ricardo José

texts.es: El Señor Ricardo José L. C. se dedica al comercio su actividad a fin es venta de CD, DVD y Artesanías  su localización es el centro de la ciudad de Estelí, teniendo gran demanda en dicha actividad lleva un control especifico en cuadernos ordinarios de sus ventas y compras, obtiene altas ganancias ya que sus compras son a C$6.00 p/unidad y sus ventas a C$15.00 por unidad. Sus compras por mayor las realiza en Managua lo que le permite comprar a un bajo precio y este le da mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo José L. C. is a merchant.  He sells CDs, DVDs and crafts.  His locale is in downtown Estelí.  

He has a lot of demand for his products and he keeps meticulous records of his purchases and sales in ordinary notebooks.

He earns high profits because he buys CDs at C$6.00 each and sells them at C$15.00 each.  He buys his stock at wholesale in Managua which allows him to buy at a low price and thereby earn higher profits.

loans.use: To buy 4000 CDs and 300 crafts.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza T. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 42 years old. Eliza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Eliza owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Eliza has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eliza is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Eliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: David Njoki

texts.en:
David Njoki W. is 43 years old, married to Rahab Wambui who is a business lady, and this is a source of additional income for the family. They have four school-going children aged 15, 12, seven, and four years old respectively, Their residential place is in Eldoret-Kenya. He sells electrical supplies and has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly profit of Ksh.60,000.


David learnt about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in his area and so he is applying for his first loan of Kshs. 80,000 from KADET LTD, with which he intends to buy  dozens of bulbs, switches, wire, and screws,. The anticipated profits he plans to use to expand his electrical business.


In future David wishes to live a better life. His deepest desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy  dozens of bulbs, switches, wire, and screws

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 54-year-old lady who is married to a gentleman called Kamuya. They have four children. Though one is married, the other three fully depend on them. She has been farming for four years with an income of 1,000 (local dollars) per month.  

Telesia is taking her second loan with KADET after successfully repaying the previous loan. She intends to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the farm. She hopes to have better returns from her farm in order to buy land to build on.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is married with five children, aged between 2 and 14.  He is a motorbike taxi driver in the town of Musanze and works long hours, from 5am until 7pm.   

With the loan he has requested from Kiva through Vision Finance Company, he will purchase spare parts for his motorbike.  With the profits he makes from his work as a taxi driver he hopes to reinvest in his business and eventually buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: Spare parts for motorbike taxi

loans.name: Bubuajar's Group

texts.en:
Bubuajar D. is a leader of this group. At her 63, she is unlucky to be a widow. The elder four of her six children are married and live separately, but two of her sons live with her. 
Bubuajar is a pensioner; additionally she gets some money out of cattle breeding and their reselling. Her sons have undertaken everything concerning feeding and pasturing the cattle. Out of profits, they have managed to start house building.
In order to arrange for her sons’ weddings the mother wants to earn more money by increasing cattle stock and so she is planning to purchase cattle. For this plan to be realized successfully, the family hopes to get a loan.  

	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nasana just outside Kampala She is married and has 2 children.  None of her children is currently in school.  Florence has a business of selling food, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food  for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Florence hopes to own a sewing machine.  Florence is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard and getting new friends

loans.use: To purchase food for resale

loans.name: Toribio

texts.es: Toribio, de 42 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a sus tres pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Con mucho esfuerzo ha  logrado sacar adelante sus cultivos, ya que con la ayuda de sus hijos a trabajado muy duro y ha logrado que sus productos tengan una muy buena calidad, por este motivo cuando lleva a vender su café a la ciudad de Pichanaki los compradores no dudan en ofrecerle muy buenos precios, por sus productos de calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus plantaciones, ya  lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, pero para el futuro desea comprarse un auto, para transportar él mismo sus cultivos.Este es el segundo préstamo de Toribio con MFP, y manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y respetuoso.Toribio tiene planeado invertir  los quinientos soles solicitados en la compra de  abono, para plantar plátano, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Toribio is 42 years old.  He is a very modest and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his three young children for whom he would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through a lot of hard work, Toribio has managed to make progress with his crops since, with the help of his children, he has worked very hard and managed to produce very good-quality products.  For this reason, when he takes his coffee to sell in Pichanaki, his buyers don't hesitate in offering him very good prices for his good-quality products.  What Toribio most likes about his work is caring for his plantations.  He has been in this business for 5 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his products.  However, in the future, he would like to buy a car so that he can transport his crops himself.

This is Toribio's second loan with MFP and he says that the money from his loan will help him a lot in making progress in his work.  Toribio is a very responsible and respectful member of his community bank.  He plans to invest the 500 Peruvian soles he has requested in buying manure for his banana crop.  In this way, he hopes to improve his profits.

loans.use: To buy manure to improve his plantations

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua B. cooks food for sale: she fries plantains and cooks beans. The combination of fried ripe plantains and beans is what we popularly call 'red-red'. It is very delicious and loved by every Ghanaian. 

Efua has four children. She has been in this business for 5 years. She is responsible for the well-being of her household. Her loan will be used to buy more plantains, fish, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of food for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a canteen. In this picture, Efua is taking some of the fried plantains out of the oil.

loans.use: buy more plantains, fish, beans and other ingredients

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI sont toutes mariés à N’TDJILLA  avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans et en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à N’TDJILLA un des villages de la commune rurale de NIENA sous préfecture de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les deux prêts passés ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. 
DJENEBA D., qui est un membre de ce groupe, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150kg de riz  et des condiments pour faire de  la restauration. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de N’TDJILLA. Elle fait la restauration à N’TDJILLA les jours de foire hebdomadaire à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes  généralement au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000FCFA  qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille .
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi solidarity group are all married women who average 40 years of age and five children each. They mostly live in polygamous families in N'TDJILLA, one of the villages of the rural community of Niena, a sub-prefecture of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).
This is their third collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. Both previous loans have been repaid in full.

Djeneba D., a member of the group, intends to use her loan to buy 150 kg of rice and some condiments for her restaurant activity. She buys her supplies at the N'TDJILLA market. She prepares and serves food at the weekly fair of N'TDJILLA to a clientele composed of both men and women, usually for cash.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA to be used for the daily expenses of the family.

loans.use: To buy rice and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to bake more meat pies for sale

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es: Jakeline, de 20 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de sus hermanos menores; y a pesar de su juventud ella se esfuerza a diario para salir adelante. Desde hace un año, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca; dice que empezó porque su madre vendía y así la animó a ofrecer a sus amigas y conocidas. Le esta yendo muy bien pues obtiene ganancias mensuales que le permiten pagar sus estudios de diseño de modas y también se dedica a diseñar ropa, y por esta razón necesita un capital que le permita invertir en tela y los implementos necesarios para empezar a fabricar modelos para  cambio de estación. Aunque ya empezó con el negocio de confección de ropa, quiere aumentarlo pues tiene muchos contactos, y así espera aumentar sus ganancias. Como es una joven muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de venta de ropa, pero ella quiere crear su propio estilo y moda. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Jakeline tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de tela para empezar a confeccionar pantalones de polar y también comprará algunos productos de belleza, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jakeline is 20 years and lives with her parents and younger siblings.  Despite her young age she has worked hard every day to get ahead.  For a year now she has been selling a well-known brand of beauty products.  She started this activity at the suggestion of her mother who was already selling the products and thought her daughter could sell to her friends and aquaintances.

Business is going well and she is able to obtain enough monthly income to cover the cost of her fashion design course.  She also designs cloths and needs capital to purchase fabric and necessary items to begin making clothes for the upcoming season.

Although she has already begun her dressmaking business she wants to expand and increase her customer base and earnings.  As a young entrepreneur she plans to open a clothing store and sell her own styles and fashions.  This is her first loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time since she would not want to disappoint the lenders who are helping her to develop and improve her lifestyle.  Jakeline plans to use the loan to purchase fabric to make polar trousers and to buy beauty products so she can increase earnings.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and beauty products

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan lives with his wife, his disabled mother, and his sister, who is a student.  He is an engineer by trade, but the family's main source of income comes from his construction materials shop in the market.  Vardan would like to enlarge his business and increase sales, so he has applied for a loan to make this happen along with the purchase of new inventory for the shop. He hopes that these additions will bring more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase new construction materials to be sold in his shop

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a 33-year-old single mother of two.  For seven years, she has been operating a salon.  She also runs a grocery store for extra income.  In the past, she has operated a retail shop.  

Naomi has experienced a lot of change since she joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because she used her previous loans to boost her business.  Naomi has requested for 58,000 KES to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos.  Julia tiene grado de instrucción primaria. 
Hace un año que viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 200.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta por menor de prendas de vestir.  Julia nos cuenta que ella compra sus prendas en Desaguadero para luego venderlas en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 400.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos docenas de chompas, faldas, mantas, blusas, aguayos y prendas surtidas en general.
Su sueño es mejorar y engrandar el negocio.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el plazo de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the community bank "Las Retamas" which is located in the Puno district in the province and department of Puno. She is 45 years old, is widowed and has two children. Julia's level of education is elementary school. 

She has been working with field partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year. Her initial loan was for 200 nuevos soles (PEN) which she used in her business selling clothes. Julia buys her clothes in Desaguadero so that she can sell them at the different markets in the city. 

With this new loan of 400 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy two dozen sweaters, skirts, blankets, shirts, aguayos (multicolored wool cloth used for adornment or as carrying bags) and a general assortment of clothes. 

Julia's dream is to improve and expand her business. What she likes about her community bank is the terms of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase two dozen sweaters, skirts, blankets, shirts, aguayos, etc.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
Maria Margarita nació en la ciudad del Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Ella tiene 56 años edad y tiene cinco hijos. Ella vivía en la ciudad D. Taray pero por el desastre  que ocurrió se traslado y actualmente ella vive en la ciudad Pisaq. (Pisaq se encuentra a 50 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco y se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola).

Maria Margarita es profesora y trabaja en el colegio nacional D. “Señor D. Huanca” D. la ciudad D. San Salvador, ya son 20 años que se enseña en el colegio y le va muy bien. Maria Margarita nos cuenta con mucha pena que en el mes D. febrero del año 2010 la ciudad D. Taray sufrió un desastre natural pues el rio se desbordo y los pobladores perdieron sus negocios y se cayeron sus casas. 

Maria Margarita tenía una tienda D. abarrotes en la ciudad D. Taray y lo perdió todo por culpa del desastre, ahora ella abrió el negocio en la ciudad D. Pisaq. En esta oportunidad Maria Margarita requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. 
     
Maria Margarita pertenece al banco comunal “Señor D. la Agonía D. Taray” D. la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el cuarto y medio D. año D. funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita was born in the city of Paucartambo, in Cusco department, Peru.  She is 56 years old and has five children.  She used to live in the city of Taray but, as a result of the natural disaster that happened there, she moved and currently lives in the city of Pisaq (Pisaq is located 50 minutes from the city of Cusco and is noted for its beautiful landscapes and for the fact that its residents work in tourism, livestock raising and agriculture).

Maria Margarita is a teacher and works in “Señor D. Huanca” high school, in the city of San Salvador.  She has been teaching in the school for 20 years and is doing very well. Maria Margarita tells us tells us with a lot of sorrow that in February 2010, the city of Taray suffered a natural disaster since a river burst its banks, the residents lost their businesses and their houses collapsed.

Maria Margarita had a grocery store in the city of Taray and she lost everything as a result of the disaster.  She re-opened her business in the city of Pisaq.  On this occasion, Maria Margarita needs a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles and many other products.

Maria Margarita is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Señor D. la Agonía D. Taray” community bank which has been going for four and a half years and is doing very well.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles and many other products

loans.name: Progressive Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Progressive” group. They are small scale business people based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Lassana. Lassana is 35 years old; he was born in Blama. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has two children who are attending primary schools. Lassana sells used clothes and has been managing this business for many years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.name: Adela Maribel

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Mapasingue  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas de San Lorenzo.

La señora Adela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos y no piden tantos requisitos. Tiene  32 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 12 años de edad el mismo que  estudian en  colegio. Vive sola con su hijo.

Ella es una gran madre que por su hijo está dispuesta a sacrificarse y a trabajar duro con tal de que a él nunca le falte nada, para esto hace tres años decidió poner en su casa un mini bazar con lo cual además de ganarse para el sustento diario también está al tanto de las necesidades de su querido hijo. Trabaja todos los días en su local, allí los clientes pueden encontrar variedad de  productos como ropa, juguetes, bisutería entre otras cosas, nos cuenta que su negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito y que poco a poco lo ha ido aumentando.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar ropa, juguetes, cosméticos, bisutería, etc. para surtir aun más su negocio.

Sus sueños son tener un gran local y que su hijo  sea profesional.
texts.en:
In the locality with the name of Mapasingue in Portoviejo's Colon Parish, known for its hard working people dedicated to farming and cattle raising, the “Damas de San Lorenzo” communal bank meets every two weeks.

Adela is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the ease in getting loans and because they don’t ask for so many requirements.  She is 32 years old and a single mother of a 12-year-old son who is in school.  She lives alone with her son.

She is a great mother who is willing to sacrifice and work hard for her son so that he will never lack anything.  For this, she set up a small store in her house three years ago so that, besides earning daily sustenance, she can also be watching over her beloved son’s needs.  She works every day in her store.  Customers can find there a wide variety of goods like clothes, toys and costume jewelry, among other things.  She tells us that she started the business with her first loan and gradually has been enlarging it.

She will use this loan to buy clothes, toys, cosmetics, costume jewelry, etc. to better stock her store.  Her dreams are to have a great store and that he son becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothes, toys, cosmetics, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него 2 детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Чамшед занимается строительными работами по найму. В этой области он более 10 лет. Кроме того на сегодняшний день Чамшед занимается растениеводством. При доме у него имеется участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и бобовые культуры. Кредит берет для повторного посева кукурузы и тыквы. То есть он хочет купить семена и минеральные удобрения.
texts.en: Jamshed lives in the Rudaki region. He's twenty-eight years old, married and has two children. His wife takes care of their household and Jamshed contracts out as a construction worker.
