He's worked in this field for the past ten years. Additionally, he grows vegetables and legume cultures on a plot of land adjacent to his home. He's asking for a loan to get assistance in planting a second round of corn and pumpkins. He needs to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to sow corn and pumpkins

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, a 54-year-old married mother of three children, resides in Lopez Jaena where she has a shop that sells a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap. In this business for four years and a member of PMPC for eight years, Anita is requesting a loan of 10,000 to purchase more stocks of products for her general store.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of products for her general store.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif, age 48, sells fruits and vegetables in the central local market. He has been in this business for three years. Fresh fruits, vegetables, and greens are very popular in Azerbaijan as they are staple items in everyday meals. Considering the constant demand for this kind of item, Asif 's business is quite successful and brings a stable income for the family. years old. Asif and his wife have one son.

Today, Asif is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to purchase more seasonal fruits and vegetables to offer for sale, with the purpose of increasing the variety of goods he sells. Asif would like to thank everyone for their support and assures his lenders that the loan will be properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase more seasonal fruits and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Maréme

texts.fr: L’emprunteuse a démarré ses activités de location de chaises et de bâche pour les manifestations sociales sur un premier prêt de l’IMCEC. Ce prêt de 100000F a servi à l’achat de 25 chaises dont les produits de la location lui ont permis de solliciter plus tard deux autres prêts de 150000F chacun.Aujourd’hui, elle dispose de 3 bâches et de 100 chaises et a construit un magasin de stockage dans son domicile.Elle possède également une machine à coudre qui lui permet de varier ses sources de revenus et de mieux prendre en charge ses cinq enfants dont les trois fréquentent l’école.Elle sollicite actuellement un autre prêt pour terminer son magasin et augmenter son stock de chaises. Elle ambitionne de construire plus tard sa propre maison.
texts.en: This borrower got started with her business renting out chairs and tarps for social gatherings using her first loan from IMCEC. That loan of 100,000 F allowed her to buy 25 chairs and renting those out enabled her to ask for two further loans of 150,000 F each. Today she owns three tarps and 100 chairs and has built a storeroom in her domicile. She also owns a sewing machine which allows her to vary her income sources so that she can better support her five children, three of whom are enrolled in school. She is now asking for another loan to finish off her storeroom and add to her stock of chairs. She hopes later on to build her own house.

loans.use: finish her storeroom and add to her stock of chairs.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena has three children and is married to a gardener. She has received junior high education. Abena sells fish and local medicine. She has on her lap the local medicine. She moves around with it in the vicinity of Abura. 

Abena assists her husband to take care of the home. She will use the loan to obtain more local medicines to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to obtain more local medicines to sell.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa is a 56-year-old woman who is engaged in farming. She has more than 15 years of experience in this field. She raises fruits and vegetables and sells them in the central bazaar. This is only one financial income in her family. She applied for 500 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Santiago Antonio

texts.es:
Santiago, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, vive con su esposa, sus hijos y un hermano, todos trabajan en la familia, el inicio el negocio con la ayuda de su madre, actualmente su esposa le ayuda a atender a los clientes y su horario es de 6:00am a 6:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de una refrigeradora, ya que en su negocio vende refrescos, gaseosas y jugos, la inversión le ayudara para tener el equipo necesario para la tienda.
Su propósito es tener el negocio bien establecido, ser un microempresario de éxito y atender a su familia en todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Santiago sells basic supplies. He lives with his wife, children and a brother.  Everyone in the family works. He began the business with the help of his mother. At present, his wife helps wait on customers and their hours are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m.

He is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator, since in his business he sells beverages: soft drinks and juices. The investment would help him have the equipment necessary for the store.

His goal is to have a well-established store: to be a successful small businessman and to provide his family with all the necessities.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for his business.

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran is a very supportive person by nature. She runs a sewing business at her home to supplement the income of her family. 
Her husband works in a livestock business. He has some buffaloes. He gets milk from them which he sells to his community clients and, thus, generates income for the family. 
Her husband started this business some time ago and it is working well for him. He has a good number of clients who purchase milk from him regularly. 
Ameeran is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well. She has given birth to 2 sons and 3 daughters. Her sons are studying while her daughters remain at home and do household work with Ameeran. 
Ameeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits.
She is confident that her husband’s business will improve as a result of the loan investment and that her household income will increase.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk selling business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, necesita el préstamo para comprar concentrado, maicillo, granza y vitaminas, de esa forma atendera las gallinas para que estén bien y en buenas condiciones para que le sigan produciendo y obtener huevos, la decicion de tomar nuevamente el prestamo, es porque le parecio bien el trabajo, atencion que recibio y el tramite que fue rapido, ella necesita de estos aportes para mejorar cada dia el negocio.
texts.en: Miriam needs to loan to buy feed, millet, sorghum and vitamins to tend to her chickens so they are well and living in good condition, and continue producing, and to obtain eggs.  She made the decision to take a new loan because her work is going well, the attention she received and the transaction was quick.  She needs the contribution to improve her business on a daily basis.

loans.use: To purchase feed, millet, sorghum and vitamins to tend to her chickens well.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz tiene 23 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de tres años; vive con su familia en Salcedo que se encuentra ubicado a 20 minutos de Latacunga en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador. Luz se considera una persona buena, tranquila, sociable y amable.

Trabaja con su esposo en la crianza de cerdos. Es la primera vez que solicita crédito a Fodemi, este crédito invertirá en la compra de balanceado para la alimentación de sus cerdos lo que ayudará a que crezcan sanos y gordos para que esten de buena calidad al momento de la venta, ya que obtendrán buenos ingresos.

Su sueño es que su hijo crezca sano y necesita tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Luz is 23 years old, married, and has a 3-year-old son.  She lives with her family in Salcedo, 20 minutes from Latacunga, in Sierra Centro region, in Ecuador.  Luz considers herself to be a good, calm, sociable and kind person.

Luz works with her husband, raising pigs.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from Fodemi.  She will invest this loan in buying nutritionally-balanced feed for her pigs.  This will help them to grow healthy and fat so that they are good quality when she comes to sell them.  This will make her good income.

Luz's dream is for her son to grow up healthy and to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her pigs

loans.name: Tinh's Group

texts.en:
Tinh is 56 years old with 3 children. She is living in An ninh village. She is running a small shop that sell fruits. This kinds of business creates stabL. income for her to manage her family life. She wants to a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy more fruits to sell.

Than is 54 years olds. She is a farmer who focuses on growing rice and raising pigs. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale

loans.name: Ernestina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ernestina, es madre soltera, vive con tres hijos de 11,9 y 1 año de edad, ella se dedica a crecer cerdos y venderlos, en su casa tiene la granja el cual atiende todos los días, no tiene un horario establecido.
Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar dos cerdos pequeños y poder crecerlos y luego venderlos a buen precio y así obtener mejores resultados en sus ganancias.
El sueño de Ernestina es siempre tener el negocio estable y darle una mejor vida a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Ernestina is the single mother of three children aged 11, 9, and 1. She earns her living raising and selling pigs. Her farm is next to her house and she works there every day but not to any established timetable.

Ernestina needs a loan so she can buy two young pigs, then raise and sell them for a good price, and earn good money from the process. Her dream is to have a stable well-established business so that she can provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy two young pigs

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling accessories and home products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more accessories and home products to sell in her stall.

Margie has been in this business for 7 years. Margie earns a significant portion of her income from buying and selling scrap gold.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more accessories and home products to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani, 45, is a talented lady. She is involved in two businesses: sewing and selling fertilizer and seeds. She manages her two businesses with a great sense of responsibility.  

Rani sews clothes for her neighboring clients and earns income by fulfilling her orders on time. She also sells fertilizer and seeds to the farmers and to different shops in the markets to increase her income. She does this work to support her husband financially.  

Rani's husband is a mason by profession. His income is not permanent because he sometimes gets work and sometimes not. Rani is the mother of five sons who are 13, 11, 9, 7, and 5 years old.   

With this loan, Rani will purchase fertilizer and seeds in larger quantity in order to increase her sales and earn better profits. She is hopeful that the loan investment will expand her business and improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for selling.

loans.name: Clara Alicia

texts.es: La señora Clara Alicia a sus 48 años es propietaria de una pequeña tienda que inició con sus propios ahorros hace menos de un año cuando vio la necesidad de prestar este servicio a los vecinos de su barrio quienes necesitaban tener una tienda cerca de sus hogares. La señora Clara Alicia requiere de la compra de surtido para su tienda tal como aceite, panela, arroz, café, gaseosas y snacks, que le permitan suplir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un mejor servicio. Lo anterior, le podrá generar a la señora Clara Alicia mayores ventas y aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora Clara Alicia es llegar a tener un negocio líder en el sector y  poder prestar un excelente servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Clara Alicia is 28 years old and has a small store that she started with her own savings less than a year ago, after seeing the need to provide this service to her neighbors who needed a store close to their homes.  Clara Alicia needs to buy an assortment, such as cooking oil, brown sugar, rice, coffee, soft drinks, and snacks for her store, so that she can meet her customer demand and offer them better service.  This will also allow her to increase her sales and income, and improve her family’s quality of life.  Clara Alicia’s dream is to have a leading business in the sector and be able to provide excellent customer service.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio is a patient and hardworking man. He is a farmer who grows rice in his one-hectare field. Upon maturity of his crops, he sells to traders and this allows him to earn at least PHP 20,000 each harvest season (April and November). He has five children that attend school. Dionisio is proud that through the income from his farming activities he is able to provide for their school needs.

The profits from the last crop were used for the family's expenses and that is why Dionisio lacks funds to sustain his crop growing. He is now asking for loan of PHP 25,000 to buy three bags of rice seeds and seven bags of UREA (fertilizers) for his farming. He hopes that Kiva lenders will entrust him with a loan and he also promises to utilize it well for the improvements of their lives too.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice seeds and seven bags of UREA (fertilizers) for his farm

loans.name: Kimly

texts.en:
Kimly, 26, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a garment worker. Her husband refills gas into small cans that he sells to his clients for use with gas stoves. Additionally, he rents sound equipment for the villagers in his village. 

Kimly is requesting a loan of USD 600 to expand her husband's business by purchasing more gas to refill the cans in order to sell. 

In the future, she plans to add delivery service in her husband's business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more gas to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a married woman who has four children. She is 40 years old. She lives in Bocator, Tangub City, Philippines.

Raquel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2011, Raquel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Raquel hopes to expand and improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Duo El Manzanillo Group

texts.es: Duo el Manzanillo.don Lorenzo de 54 años de edad el se dedica a la venta de verduras y a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad desde hace varios años mos comenta que conocer esta intitucion es un regalo de Dios por el apoyo que le puedan dar, el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de verduras y compra de productos comestibles y asi de esa manera seguir con su negocio y desde ya agradese la ayuda brindada.

loans.use: Compra de verduras y productos comestibles.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 45 year old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan who helps support 5 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy fabric for making traditional Arabic seating cushions. She would like to expand her current project so that she can open a shop to sell the projects. She also has future aspirations to open an electronics shop. Siham hopes that this will help improve her family's economic conditions.

loans.use: to pay for fabric to make traditional Arabic seating cushions

loans.name: Yohanna Datmen

texts.es:
Yohanna  tiene 32 años de edad, es madre y padre para sus dos hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la costura y también al diseño y elaboración de ropa de vestir. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo tela, hilos, agujas  y otras cosas más. 

Se encuentra contenta por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Yohanna is thirty-two years old, and acts as both the mother and father for two children.  Her main work is sewing, but also in design and in making clothing.  She has been in this business for several years and it is going well thanks to the determination she brings to her work.

In this opportunity, she requires a loan in order to buy work materials, like fabric, thread, needles, and other items.

She finds herself happy for the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.  She is thankful for the help offered to her.

loans.use: to buy work materials like fabric, thread, needles, and other items.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a smallholder farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya who is deep into dairy farming. Kapsowar's landscape is green and hilly and farmers make use of slopes by turning them into farmland. The problem is that these slopes are very steep and unfenced. 

Samuel is seeking a loan to fence his farmland. A fence would be a very important part of Samuel's land for it sets boundaries, protects property and most important, controls animal movement. On such contours, his animals could easily lose their footing and get injured or even fall to death. 

The fence will also improve feed management on his farm, which will lead to higher milk production.

loans.use: to fence his farm

loans.name: Ejoheza Group

texts.en: Adeline is a group leader; aged 48 years.She is married with 4 children aged between 10 and 2 years. The group is called EJOHEZA means “TOMORROW IS GOOD” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.Adeline owns a mini market  and has been running in a business for 4 years. With the loan, Adeline likes to buy more items such as cakes, breads and chocolates for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more items such as cakes, breads and chocolates for sale.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Mrs. Sandra O. a young woman of 25 years old. A dynamic client of LAPO who specializes in cooking delicious food for people in her environment. She bent on improving her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
A 62 year old woman, Mrs. Bernadette H. is married and has a family; today, she has six people in her care. Living in Agbanakin in the prefecture of Lacs, she has run for the past 18 years a general food store, which allows her to meet her expenses. Given that the income is used directly to pay the household expenses, she is unable to refurbish her display and satisfy market demand.

The tontine (investment) and credit system to which she subscribes keeps her better organized. Currently, she is asking for a sum of $600 to stock up on merchandise and increase her income. This will allow her to reasonably meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Femme de 62 ans, Mme H. Bernadette est mariée et mère de famille ; aujourd’hui, elle a en charge six personnes. Domiciliée à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs, elle a installé depuis maintenant 18 ans une boutique d’alimentation générale qui lui permet de supporter ses charges. Etant donné que les recettes faites sont directement utilisés pour les dépenses familiales, elle n’arrive pas à ravitailler régulièrement son étalage et satisfaire les demandes du marché.

Le système de tontine et de crédit auquel elle a souscrit l’aide à mieux s’organiser. Actuellement, elle sollicite une somme de $600 pour s’approvisionner en marchandises et accroître ses revenus. Cela lui permettra de subvenir valablement aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock up on various goods

loans.name: Erika Fabiola

texts.en:
Fabiola is 23 years old, she is very hard-working and honest and has a small daughter aged 2. She was unemployed for a while, and found it difficult to find work. In order to cover the expenses of her mother and daughter, because she isn’t supported by her partner, she started to sell cosmetics. She then found a job in a law office and continued with her business because she needs the extra income she gets from selling. Also she already has a customer base and her products are of good quality and easy to sell.

At this time, Fabiola needs a loan of $375 dollars with which she will increase the variety of products she offers, in order to provide a better service to her customers and ensure they remain loyal. It’s not easy for her to have sole responsibility for her daughter and mother, but the love she feels for her family provides daily motivation. You can help her to move forward with her family: they need your help and care.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

Fabiola tiene 23 años de edad, es muy trabajadora y honesta y tiene una pequeña hija de 2 años. Ella estuvo desempleada por algún tiempo y se le dificultaba encontrar trabajo, para poder cubrir los gastos de su madre y de su hija, porque no cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, ella inició con la venta de cosméticos, ahora encontró un empleo en un despacho jurídico y continua con su negocio porque necesita de este ingreso extra que obtiene de las ventas, además ella ya tiene sus clientes y sus productos son de buena calidad y fácil de vender.

En estos momentos, Fabiola necesita de un crédito por $ 375 dólares con los que incrementará la variedad de sus productos para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y conservar su preferencia, no es fácil para ella tener la responsabilidad de su hija y de su madre ella sola, pero el amor hacia su familia la motivan día a día. Tú puedes ayudarla a salir adelante con su familia, ellas necesitan de tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his dried fish selling business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. is a widow and the mother of seven children. She is 54 years old and sell provisions, drinks and ground tomatoes for a living.  She hopes to buy more drinks, provisions and a machine for grinding tomatoes with a US $250 loan.  She has been in this business since 2002.  She has been with LAPO for 4 years and she depends on the profit from her business to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, provisions and an additional machine for grinding tomatoes

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga Dure, 46 years old, is married with two children, ages 18 and 20. She lives with her husband in Mariano Roque Alonso. One of her daughters is studying to be a kindergarten teacher and the other is still in high school. In the past, Olga worked as a secretary for a local high school called “Fe y Alegria” (Faith and Happiness). After many years, the school was forced to let her go. However, Olga was lucky enough to receive some severance pay. With this money Olga decided to open her “librería”, a shop selling school supplies, notebooks, pens, pencils and other office necessities. She began by selling these items out of her house, but after one year of business felt she was able to build a shop across from her house.

Her dream is that people will regard her store as the best of its kind, always well-stocked with whatever they need, so they can get what they want when they want. She has already established many clients in her community, mostly from the three high schools in her zone. The loan she has requested would allow her to keep her business healthy and growing.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies, notebooks, pens, pencils and other office necessities.

loans.name: Halimakhon

texts.ru:
Halimakhon J. has been trading at the market for ten years. She is married. Her husband earns money, but it isn't enough to support their family. Her son left to work in Russia, and Halimakhon has to work at the market in order to feed her family. Her children are grown and Halimakhon dreams of helping them out, but the income from her business is not enough. She learned about the micro-credit program at MicroInvest Tajikistan and would like to increase the assortment of goods she sells, in hope of increasing her income. Due to the coming cold weather, she plans to widen the range of goods offered.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Жураева Халимахон в течение 10 лет торгует на рынке. Замужем. Муж зарабатывает, немного для того чтоб прокормит семью. Сын клиентки уехал на заработки в Россию. Клиентка вынуждена зарабатывать на рынке, чтобы прокормит семью. Дети взрослые, мечтает, их обустроит. Доход, получаемый от бизнеса не достаточен. Она узнала о программе микрокредитования Микроинвест и хочет увеличить товар посредством чего хочет увеличить свой доход. В связи с наступлением холодов она намерена расширить свой ассортимент.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam!  This is 39 year-old Hadija M..  She is married with four children aged 5,12,14, and 16.  In 2001, Hadija established a shop selling food items and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.  She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Titin

texts.en: Titin, 46, is married to S. and has 3 children. To support her family's needs, she sells spices and puts them for sale at the shop nearby, earning about $5 a day. She also sells clothing on credit and can earn as much as $30 a week from this business. To add to her business capital, she is asking for a loan of $125 and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Joyce's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 5 and 2 years old. Joyce owns a small shop that she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 5am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.

Joyce now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Helena and Mwaya, who have businesses dealing in pharmaceuticals and food vending.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is the mother of seven children, two of whom are still in school. The other five children are finished and now working. Georgina has been selling jewelry since she was in the fifth grade and she has expanded her business over more than 20 years to include jewelry, rubber products, and plastic containers. She now wants to start selling cough medicines and other non-prescription drugs to her community. The loan will be used to buy these items in bulk. She wants to use the profits from her business to continue with the construction of a family house.

Georgina is a member of the trust group Nyame Nsa Wom (God’s Hands is in It). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays her share of the loan. Her photo was taken at a group meeting in the village of Akom.

loans.use: To purchase over-the-counter medicines

loans.name: Eveling Del Carmen

texts.es:
Eveling is a 33 year old single mother who lives in the “Laureles Sur” neighborhood. Her three children are fourteen, ten and two. Eveling works as a cashier in the large store La Curacao.

Eveling is requesting this loan in order to complete repairs on her home. She needs to replace a door, complete a wall and replace her roof (which is in serious need of repair).

Eveling's current dreams are to complete the construction of her home, educate her children and have a beautiful future.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Dávila es soltera con 33 años de edad, habita en el barrios los Laureles Sur, tiene tres hijos de 2, 10 , 14 años de edad. Ella trabaja de Cajera en la empresa La Curacao, y esta solicitando su crédito para cambiar una puerta, terminar una pared y cambiar el techo que esta en mal estado. En el futuro doña Eveling es terminar su casa donde vive educar a sus hijos y tener un buen porvenir.

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Mrs. Elsa G. is married and has three children. Her husband is a blacksmith and works for a private company as well as making custom orders. At her 58 years of age she still has a strong spirit and desire to succeed and is always thinking long-term, which is why she continuously saves and invests. Both of them are sacrificing and hardworking people. According to Elsa, the house where they were living was the result of marriage savings because they come from a family of scarce resources.

The small grocery store is approximately 4 years old. Taking advantage of the fact that house in which they live has spare rooms, which they rent, providing a third of their income. Mrs. Elsa attends to both businesses.

At this time the loan is needed to complete a bathroom in one room of the house and to close it off to create a separate room to rent. As the rent is very accessible there is a constant demand by workers and/or students in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elsa G. se encuentra casada y tiene 3 hijos. Su marido es herrero y trabaja en una empresa privada y también de forma particular. Ella con sus 58 años de edad aún tiene un espíritu vigoroso y ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta pensando a largo plazo es por eso que ahorra e invierte constantemente. Los dos son personas muy sacrificadas y trabajadoras. Según Elsa, la casa donde están viviendo es fruto del ahorro matrimonial, ya que provienen de una familia de escasos recursos.

La pequeña despensa tiene aproximadamente 4 años de antigüedad. Aprovechando que en la casa donde viven sobran cuartos, la pareja los alquila para así tener acceso a una tercera fuente de ingresos. Es la Sra. Elsa quien atiende ambos negocios.

En este momento necesita el préstamo para terminar un baño en otra pieza de su casa y cerrarla para así dejar una pieza independiente y alquilarla. Como el precio del alquiler es muy accesible tiene demanda constante ya sea de trabajadores y/o estudiantes de la zona.

loans.use: Refurbishment of Bedrooms

loans.name: Betty Santusa

texts.es:
Betty sells coca leaves in markets. The purchasers use the coca to make tea with medicinal properties, such as headache relief. Construction workers chew the coca leaves for more stamina while working.

Betty is married, her husband is a salaried driver. Because he does not own his own car and works for an employer, he does not have the earnings of an independent driver.

The couple lives in the Irpavi II district of La Paz, in a place where the rent is high. This is the third time Betty has requested a loan, and the second time she has needed support from Kiva. Her history of efficient payment of her installments qualifies her as a #1 client.

The loan would be for the purchase of a larger quantity of merchandise. (She has proven that she is not involved in any illicit activity related to narcotics trafficking.)

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Betty se dedica a la venta de hojas de coca, las cuales son vendidas en mercados (los compradores usan la coca para hacer té, con propósitos medicinales –combatir el dolor de cabeza por ejemplo-) y en las construcciones (los albañiles mascan las hojas de cocan para tener mayor resistencia en el trabajo).

Betty es casada, su esposo es chofer asalariado por lo que no cuenta con un automóvil propio, por lo tanto, tiene un patrón y no gana lo que un chofer independiente.

La pareja vive en la zona Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, en un lugar donde pagan un alquiler caro.

Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial la califica como cliente 1, es decir que cumple eficientemente con el pago de sus cuotas.

El crédito será destinado para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería (por si acaso, se ha comprobado que no esta involucrada en actividades ilícitas relacionadas con el narco tráfico).

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory

loans.name: Asunción María

texts.es:
Asunción is a happy and hardworking mother of 3 children, since a young age Asunción developed great cooking skills. It has been four years since she began selling food. Before this, Asunción used to sell bread, but this was not enough and did not meet her expectations. Asunción currently sells lunches on the go at the busiest avenues of the city of Juliaca, where she serves delicious and various dishes to her customers. Her desires are to acquire wholesale supplies such as rice, noodles, oil, etc... Asunción believes that with such investment she will improve her earnings and she will be able to offer her dishes at lower prices.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Asunción es una alegre y laboriosa madre de 3 hijos, desde pequeña tuvo cualidades para la cocina, y hace más de 4 años, con mucha expectativa, inició su negocio de venta de comida en forma ambulatoria.Antes de ello, vendía pan, pero esta actividad, no cubría sus expectativas, actualmente vende almuerzos en una de las avenidas más concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde atiende a sus asiduos comensales quienes quedan complacidos con sus deliciosos y variados platos. El deseo de esta dedicada mujer es adquirir insumos (arroz, fideos, aceite, etc.) al por mayor, considera que con tal inversión mejorará sus ingresos y ofrecerá su platillos a precios sumamente cómodos.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Dame D. Edoh est née le 31 décembre 1970 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs, ville située à 45km de la ville de Lomé. C’est une ville où la pêche est bien développée. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur AKOUETE Koffi qui est un agent de sécurité et a deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente des légumes et des produits de premières nécessités. 
Compte tenu de l’approche des rentrées scolaires, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 10 cartons de cahiers et quelques fournitures scolaires. Avec l’achat de ces articles, elle pourra satisfaire les parents d’élèves de son quartier.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edoh D. was born on December 31, 1970 in Aného in the Prefecture of the Lakes, a town situated 45 km from the city of Lomé. This is a town where fishing plays a major role. Edoh is married to Mr. Koffi Akouete who is a security guard and they have 2 children. Her business is selling vegetables and grocery staples.

Since children will be going back to school soon, she is asking for this loan to purchase 10 cases of notebooks and some other school supplies for re-sale. With the purchase of those articles, she will be able to satisfy the needs of the parents of school children in her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El señor Esteban tiene 53 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos ,el se dedica a la actividad de venta y plantación de flores para jardín, esta en el oficio hace mas de 27 años , Actualmente tiene mucho trabajo porque estamos en el mes de la primavera y tanto las flores como las demás plantas requieren de una mejor atención porque estamos en la estación dónde las flores están en su etapa de florencimiento.

Gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo invertir en la compra de más semillas, plantas y abonos ya que durante éste verano y parte del invierno la ciudad de Caacupé recibio gran cantidad de visitantes lo que le posibilito tener buen movimiento de ventas.

Tiene pensado invertir en la ampliación del negocio y para el efecto tiene pensado utilizar una propiedad que posee en una de las compañias vecina aquí en Caacupé, la atención del vivero estaria a cargo de uno de sus hijos que ya fue preparado para asumir ese compromiso.
texts.en:
Esteban is 53 years old, is married and has two children. He is dedicated to selling and planting garden flowers, a job which he has filled for 27 years. Currently, he has a lot of work because it is springtime and both flowers and plants require more attention because we are in the season when flowers are blooming.

Thanks to the loans that the Fundacion Paraguaya has granted, he has been able to invest in the purchase of seeds, plants and fertilizers since, during the summer and part of the winter, the city of Caacupé received a great quantity of visitors which allowed him to have good sales turnover.

He is thinking of investing in business expansion and, to that end, is thinking of using a property owned by one of the neighboring companies here in Caacupé. The care of the nursery would be in the hands of one of his sons who is already prepared to take on this commitment.


Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds, plantss, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom R., 34, is a rice farmer who also raises pigs for a living. She is widowed with two children, both of whom are in secondary school, and lives in Veal Commune, Pursat Province. To increase her family’s income, she would like to request a $350 loan to buy more piglets to raise and feed for them.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and feed for them

loans.name: Zokir

texts.en: Zokir M. is a hard-working man who strives every day to provide for his entire family, which consists of his wife and three children.  He manages a grocery store where he sells many staples, such as bread, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods.  Having started this business only three years ago with less than $100, Zokir has attracted a strong base of customers who are impressed by his efforts to travel to neighboring cities to purchase especially valuable items. In order to purchase additional foodstuffs and increase his inventory, Zokir is requesting a loan of $750.

loans.use: To purchase a wider range of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa P. is forty-five years old. She is a wife and the mother of five children who are currently in school. She is a food vendor and sells “waakye”. "Waakye" is cooked rice and beans enjoyed with stew, macaroni, and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. It is very tasty and satisfying and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy "waakye".

Adwoa wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans, macaroni, etc. to prepare good "waakye" for her customers. She believes this will provide her with increased income to send her first son to the university and she is certain that when she has access to the loan, that dream would be fulfilled, come next year. She belongs to the community group called Revelation Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans, macaroni, etc. to prepare good "waakye" for her customers

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Bẩy  34 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996. Hiện tại hàng ngày ngoài chăn nuôi, chồng chị đi lấy hoa quả từ các chợ kinh doanh hoa quả về cho chị bán lẻ tại chợ. Đây cũng là  công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia dình chị  với thu  nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng.Vòng vốn tới chị Bảy mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh hoa quả của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị Bẩy, 34 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 1996. In addition to raising animals, she and her husband have a fruit-selling business. Each day, her husband goes and purchases fruit at the large wholesale markets and brings it back to her. Then she sells the fruit in retail quantities at the neighborhood food market. This business is their main source of income, earning them about 5,000,000 VND (288 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Bẩy hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD) to invest in her fruit sales enterprise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit sales

loans.name: Sara Esmirna

texts.es:
La señora Sara S. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería atendido en su casa de habitación donde labora arduamente con el propósito de mantener su hogar brindando buenas condiciones a su familia. 

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería. Es por esta razón que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con dicho crédito y así dar lugar al mejoramiento de su negocio satisfaciendo a sus clientes que tanto requieren de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Sara Sanchez is dedicated to the grocery store she runs from her home, where she works very hard with the goal of maintaining her household and providing her family with proper living conditions.

The reason for engaging Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) is that she requires a loan to purchase grocery store products. For this reason she has engaged Ceprodel to be benefitted by a loan and in this manner bring improvements to her business, to satisfay her clients that require so much of her support.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products.

loans.name: Frenelinda

texts.en:
Frenelinda is already 53 years old and happily married to Cirilo B., who is a farmer. They live in Barangay Sto. Tomas, Alicia, Isabela. They were blessed with four children who are: Loren, 31 years old; followed by Lea Amor, 25 years old, married; next to her Rosalie, 21 years old, a college undergraduate; and the youngest. Merriam Mae, 17 years old, a special child due to her physical and mental disability (cerebral palsy). Frenelinda and her husband work together for the progress of their family. They consider their special child as a motivating factor to achieve their goals for their family.  

One source of their family income is the village store aside from farming. Frenelinda maintains the business while her husband maintains their farm with the help of their sons-in-law. She was a rolling store vendor in the past, but after a few years, she shifted into managing a store in order to take good care of her special child at home while doing the business at the same time. Frenelinda hopes to improve the business. Thus she wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP8,000 to purchase more inventory, thereby minimizing transportation expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Mme Fatou N. est une femme mariée qui vende des produits divers comme l’Omo (savon en poudre), le savon, l’huile de palme et la patte d’arachide. Ayant une grande expérience sur ce commerce ce prêt lui permet de renforcer son activité. Elle habite au quartier cite Lamy à Thiès et mère de famille ses revenues lui permettent de soutenir son mari sur les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mrs Fatou N. is a married woman who sells diverse products such as Omo (powder soap), soap, palm oil and peanut butter. Given her great experience in this business, this loan enables her to reinforce her activity. She lives in the Lamy neighborhood in Thiès and is a mother and her revenue enables her to support her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy A. is sixty-five years old. She is a divorced mother of seven grown children. Nancy says all of them are out of school and living independently. She lives with some of her children and grandchildren in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Nancy is a baker. She bakes and supplies bread to food vendors (mostly beverage sellers) and retailers in her community. She procures the raw materials such as bags of flour, margarine, and sugar from wholesalers in nearby towns. Nancy also trades in palm oil and other items. She has been in this business since she was very young. She wants a loan to procure the raw materials in bulk, so she can make a bigger profit.

loans.use: Procure wholesale ingredients

loans.name: Sinignessigui (Préparer L’Avenir) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sinignessigui est composé de six femmes du village de Kimparana (préfecture de San région de Ségou) qui ont en moyenne 39 ans, 6 enfants et vivent dans des foyers polygames. 
Les femmes du groupe Sinignessigui sont toutes des restauratrices. Vu la situation géographique de leur village qui est un carrefour très peuplé,  elles vendent sur place dans des gargotes du riz, haricot, viande, fonio etc.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 200.000 FCFA pour le sixième prêt solidaire. Tous les autres prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des sacs de riz, des seaux de pâte d’arachide et  autres ingrédients pour la restauration.
 Ainsi avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 230 000 FCFA. de bénéfice chacune au cours du cycle.
 En plus du remboursement des prêts elles comptent faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Ces femmes ont des gargotes ou des hagards pour la restauration. Elles comptent avoir dans l’avenir des restaurants et diversifier leurs marchandises en y ajoutant des boissons glacées.
texts.en:
The group Sinignessigui is composed of six women from the village of Kimparana (San prefecture, Ségou region) who average 39 years of age and six children each. They live in polygamous households. The women of this group are all restauranteurs. Given their village's location, at a highly populated crossroads, they sell rice, beans, meat, fonio (a kind of millet), etc. locally in eateries.

To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. The loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 200,000 francs for the sixth solidarity loan. All the other loans have been correctly repaid.

The current loan will be used to buy sacks of rice, buckets of peanut butter, and other ingredients for catering. Thus, with this new loan, they each plan to realize an average profit of 230,000 francs in the course of this cycle. In addition to the loan payments, they intend to address common family expenses. These women have eateries or stalls as restaurants. They intend have restaurants in the future and to diversify their offerings by including cold drinks.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for catering

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen D. Cocharcas.
Eugenia es casada, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos, Eugenia tiene un puesto en el mercado Mariscal Cáceres en donD. venD. cereales, abarrotes en general, sus productos son adquiridos en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cereales, arroz, azúcar.
Eugenia espera seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Virgen D. Cocharcas Communal Bank. She is 60 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has a stand in the Mariscal Cáceres market where she sells cereals and general groceries. She purchases her products in the city’s wholesale food market. Eugenia needs a loan of 900 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of cereals, rice, and sugar. Eugenia hopes to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cereals, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr: nogaye D. est une femme mariée née en 1961 à thies .elle vit avec sa famille à la cité sofraco de thiès;elle fait du commerce depuis les années 1980.elles vend des produits cosmétiques,des habits et des chaussures.avec ce pret ,elle envisage de compléter son fonds pour dédouaner sa marchandise qui est au port.
texts.en:
Nogaye D. is a married woman who was born in 1961 in Thies. She lives with her family in the Cité Sofraco neighborhood of Thiès. She has been in business since the 1980s. She sells cosmetics, clothing, and shoes. With this loan, she expects to have enough funds to get her merchandise out of customs at the port.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: paying customs duties for her merchandise

loans.name: Mungu Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Elvina N., age 34, is married with two children, ages 17 and 13.  She has a grocery business which she has run since 1996.   She works daily from 4 pm until 10 pm and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $62. 

This will be Elvina's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her business and has paid back her loans successfully.  She would like a new loan to increase stock in her grocery.
 	
Elvina will share this loan with her loan group Mungu Tubariki, which totals 17 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Elvina is the 1st on the left.

loans.use: To increase her grocery stock.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys I. is a married mother of three, living in Geneku, Cameroon. She has been a member of GHAPE since 2006 and has borrowed from the organization twice before. Through these loans, she has been able to establish for herself a restaurant and bar.

Through her first two loans, Gladys has seen her home life improve, has been able to pay school fees, provide for her family, and has been able to give them better food. In addition to that, Gladys is now able to ensure that her family will have access to quality medical care.

Following her first and second loans, Gladys has requested another loan from GHAPE. This time around, she is requesting 150,000 Fcfa from the organization. With this next loan, Gladys hopes to be able to expand her restaurant and include a provisions store where beer will also be sold.

By expanding her business, not only will Gladys be making more money and be helping her family, but she will also be providing a valuable service to different members of the community. As it stands right now, some members of the community need to travel long distances just to be able to get something to eat. By expanding her business, Gladys will be able to shorten the distance that many people have to travel in order to eat, and thus will be improving the quality of life of those folks.

Gladys’s business is sure to succeed with these new developments, simply on account of the fact that there are a couple of primary and secondary schools nearby where teachers, students and families often pass by. Beyond this, she has been experiencing an increase in business lately as more customers are patronizing her restaurant. With more services to offer, she is almost sure of further growth and success.

Gladys chooses to work with GHAPE empowerment credits not only because of the favorable terms of the loans, such as the low interest rates and lack of requisite collateral, but also because of the ability for borrowers to make payments over time, thus relieving the financial burden on individual borrowers, and freeing them from a potential debt trap or cycle.


About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant and include a provisions store where beer will be sold

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 53 years old and is married with eight children. She is a fashion designer and she also sells sarongs.

Rose hopes for the loan of N60,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria K. sells clothing at the village market. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is a very kind person. Maria enjoys being in sales and has many repeat clients. 

Maria would like to borrow 1,700 UAH to increase the assortment of clothes she offers for sale.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Vanessa Lizeth

texts.es:
Vanessa tiene 22 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de dos años de edad en el caserío La Zaranda, distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero y, debido a que los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para mantener a toda la familia ella empezó hace un año a vender comida en el colegio de la zona.

Todos los días se levanta temprano para preparar los platos que vende: algunos son dulces típicos, otros platos de comida y al momento del receso se sitúa en una área del patio de la escuela y vende sus productos a los escolares los que esperan con mucha expectativa su llegada.

Ella desea terminar de construir su casa y a la vez comprarse una computadora para realizar trabajos de investigación y ayudar a los estudiantes, sabe que debe seguir trabajando en su negocio para lograr sus metas, por lo que ha solicitado por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de golosinas para vender a los estudiantes de la zona.

Vanessa es muy conocida en su comunidad y es considerada una mujer responsable, por este motivo las autoridades del colegio de la zona le han confiado la venta de alimentos para los alumnos de dicha institución.
texts.en:
Vanessa is 22 years old and lives with her husband and two year old son in the village of La Zaranda in the district of Pitipo, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Her husband currently works as a laborer, but his income is not enough to support their entire family. She started selling food a year ago at the local high school.

Every day, Vanessa wakes up early to prepare the food she sells – traditional sweets and other snack items. During recess, she sets up her vending post in the schoolyard patio. Students wait with great expectation for her to arrive and start selling her products.

She wants to finish the construction of her house. One time, she bought a computer for the students to help them with their research. Vanessa knows that she has to keep working at her business in order to achieve her goals. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from our Institution in the amount of 700 soles so that she can buy candy to sell to the students.

Vanessa is well known in the community and is considered to be a responsible woman. Therefore, the local school authorities have entrusted her with selling food to the students.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy for resale

loans.name: Yvonne Andréa Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus le commerce d’alimentation générale ; elle exerce cette activité depuis 2001 dans son domicile dans le quartier de Bè-kpota à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet d’aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins scolaires de leurs 02 enfants. Actuellement elle a fait une étude de son marché et elle a noté qu’elle pourra aussi se lancer dans le commerce pagnes et de bijoux. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 25 pagnes de qualité Wax Hollandais, 20 pagnes Hitarget, 15 pagnes Soso, mais aussi des bijoux de bonne marque. Elle compte sur son expérience et sur la demande de ses clients pour faire fructifier ce prêt.
texts.en:
This woman sells groceries to earn a living. She has been in this business since 2001, in her house in the Bè-kpota district in Lomé. This business allows her to help her husband pay the school fees for their two children. Presently, she has studied her market and feels that she can go into selling African "waxcloth" and costume jewelry as well. For that reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 25 lengths of "waxcloth" (Hollandais brand), 20 lengths (Hitarget brand), and 15 lengths of Soso brand, as well as some good quality costume jewelry. She is counting on her experience and the demand of her clientele to make this loan pay off.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "waxcloth" and costume jewelry for resale

loans.name: Janyl's Group

texts.en:
Janyl is the leader of this group. Her divorce has made her a stronger woman and a better mother. She is doing her best to provide for her only son, a school student. As a divorced woman she receives child compensation in amount of four and half dollars a month from the government. So Janyl cannot depend on or ask help from anybody. Now she has to rely on herself.

Even though she is forty-three years old, her age has not prevented her from making a major change in her life. About two months ago a friend of hers went to trade in another market and left her stall to Janyl. Janyl, who had never done trading before, gave up her former occupation and decided to take a risk. She invested all her money, $700, in women’s clothing and started selling. Very soon the sales started to go well, and she has been able to increase her turnover up to $535. Now she is making $200 a month.

Her son also helps her run the stall after school. Janyl is teaching him some basic lessons of survival, giving him a chance to earn his own pocket money. Janyl has applied for this loan to purchase more goods, mainly women's seasonal clothes. She is eager to work hard and increase the turnover. She wants to buy a more profitable spot for the stall. These are Janyl’s partners: Aftandil, Jumabubu and Jyrgalbubu. Aftandil, 31, has two daughters. Aftandil’s relative has suggested that she set up in business. This relative trades in bedclothes. So Aftandil has decided to obtain this loan and purchase bedclothes for resale. Jumabubu, 48, is divorced and has one son. Her husband is temporarily unemployed, so Jumabubu supports her family by selling foodstuffs. She needs a loan to purchase goods, mainly foodstuffs. Jyrgalbubu, 45, is a widow and has one thirteen-year-old daughter. Jyrgalbubu is engaged in sewing. She makes traditional articles and takes them in to some shops. She needs a loan to purchase fabric at “Madina” market, since fabric is cheaper there. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy clothing for the fall trade

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca S. is from the village of Colonia, Valencia City. She is 53 years old. Rebecca is married and has 7 adult children. Rebecca owns & operates a business making & selling food products in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Rebecca is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products that she sells. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rebecca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Basilia Justa

texts.es: Doña Basilia B. tiene 65 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su esposo  e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 15 años de elaborar  Cortes Típicos en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chuisacmalja, del Cantón Xolsacmalja del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Basilia B., 65, is married. She works as a weaver making typical skirts for women. She has a shop with two looms. She lives with her husband and children. She and her husband do the same work, and they have two employees to help with the work. For 15 years she has been making typical skirts in her home, which is in the Paraje Chuisacmalja in the Cantón Xolsacmalja, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand has grown, but the economic conditions in which she finds herself are not sufficient to increase her capital. That is why she came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will buy raw materials to be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to get her family ahead so they can have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials for making typical skirts

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios D. is from the village of Lopez Jaena. She is 43 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Remedios owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Remedios joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Landy

texts.en:
Landy started his rice farming business in 2008 and tills his land very well to make a good harvest.

Landy needs additional capital to finance his business and that's why he joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He has requested a loan of 15,000 Php which will be enough to buy farm supplies necessary for his rice field.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 34 years old and is married with four children and two dependents. The children and dependents are aged between 10 and 24. Eugenie and her family live in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Eugenie is a self-employed businesswoman owning a shop selling Irish potatoes. This is her tenth successful year in this business. The hours of her business require that she work from early in morning until late in the evening. 

Eugenie is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of Irish potatoes so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers. With this loan, Eugenie hopes to earn more profit than before.

Eugenie will reinvest a portion of her profit in the business so that she can be financially stable and save some for the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes for sale

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Mrs. Manju K. has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 3 and her son is just 4 months old. Her husband, Mr. Suresh K., is an electrician.

Manju already owns a cow and she has been selling milk in the area. In Nepal pure, fresh cows’ milk is highly valued for its nutrition. She lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. She carries her milk containers and sells door-to-door daily in the morning and evening.

Because of the rising demand, Manju wants to buy another cow to increase her production, so she seeks an Rs 20,000 loan. She plans to purchase a Jersey cow which produces more milk than other breeds.

loans.use: To buy a young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Dinamicas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Dinámicas"  esta representado por la señora Maritza y conformada 10 miembros los cuales van cursando ya un segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y ganas D. salir adelante. La gran mayoría D. las socias se dedican a las actividades comerciales como la venta D. empanadas y pan casero, venta D. asados, cosméticos, comida, tarjetas, ropa y la atención en licorerías. En cuanto a la competencia del mercado podemos mencionar que es alta pero las socias siempre saben como salir adelante ya que tienen experiencia en sus rubros. El destino del financiamiento   es para la compra material D. trabajo y comprar D. insumos en mayor cantidad, incrementando sus ganancias y así poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.  En cuanto a las expectativas D. las socias todas desean poder tener su casa propia por lo que su esfuerzo es para ello ya que desean darles un techo estable a sus hijos y un mejor futuro para cada uno D. ellos.
texts.en:
The Dinámicas Communal Bank is represented by Maritza and comprised of ten members. They are in their second cycle, and they demonstrate punctuality and the desire to get ahead. Most of the members work in commercial activities like selling empanadas and homemaD. bread, selling roasted meats, cosmetics, food, cards, clothes, and operating liquor stores. As far as the competition in the market goes, it is high. But, the members always know how to get ahead because they have experience in their fields. The loan is to buy work materials and supplies in greater quantities. This will increase their earnings and allow them to give their families a better quality of live. As far as the members’ expectations go, they wish to be able to have their own homes. That is why they put forth so much effort. They want to give their children a stable roof over their heads and give each one of them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Lương's Group

texts.en:
Lương Thị N. (ID 010103110006) was born in 1964. Currently, she lives in Thac Qua village with her husband and two adult children, all of whom are employed. For many years, Lương has been raising poultry for a living. She has an income of about 2,000,000 VND a month. Since 2007, she has participated in SEDA activities and has always been very punctual in making her loan repayments. She is now requesting her fifth loan of 5,450,000 VND to further invest in raising poultry, with the hope of increasing her income.

About the other members in her group
Hoa Thị N. (ID 010103110007) is 36 years old. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in selling fish in the market.
Sêu Thị N. (ID 010103110008) is 52 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise poultry.
Bé Thị Lưu (ID 010103110009) is a 51-year-old female. She would like a loan of 5,014,000 VND to improve her small grocery store.
Nhung Thị Trần (ID 010103110010) is 25 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to open a grocery store and raise chickens.
Thử Thị N. (ID 010103110011) is 34 years old. She is requesting a loan of 5,014,000 VND to raise pigs and sell wrought iron products.

loans.use: To further invest in her poultry business

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mrs. Leng A. is a 53-year-old married woman who lives in Svay Sar village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sochea Meun, are farmers. Aside from farming she also breeds ducks for duck eggs.

In order to support her duck breeding, Mrs. Leng A. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks. With this loan she hopes to increase her income to improve her family living.

Mrs. Leng A. is the mother of four children, three of whom are students in the local school while the other one is supporting the parents’ farming. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Ana Yohelsy

texts.es:
La joven Ana Yohelsy G. H. es empleada en una fábrica de elaboración de puros en este municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel el que utilizara para el pago de un par de lentes que ella necesita para corregir su vista y la compra de un medicamento para mejorar su salud personal.

Ella empezó a trabajar en esta fábrica en la elaboración de puro  después de salir de la secundaria y desde entonces se dedica a esas labores y así obtener un ingreso mensual fijo, ella trabaja del día lunes hasta el día viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Ella espera mejorar su vista y salud con el financiamiento que solicita en Ceprodel para así poder seguir trabajando y rendir en sus labores diarias y sacar adelante su familia ya que la salud personal esta primero que todo.

Ana yohelsy G. en una joven soltera y con dos hijas una de ella en edad estudiantil y a la que le costea los gastos escolares.

Este es el crédito numero doce que Ana Yohelsy solita en Ceprodel en un periodo de nueve años, ella dice que estos financiamiento le has ayudado positivamente a mejorar sus condiciones familiares ya que a podido comprar sus electrodomésticos, así como muebles y resolver los gastos escolares de si hija, por lo que se muestra agradecida.
texts.en:
Ana Yohelsy G. H. is employed at a cigar factory in Condega. She is asking Ceprodel for funds to buy a pair of glasses that she needs to correct her vision and to buy medicine that she needs to improve her health. She started to work in the cigar factory when she got out of middle school; since then she has worked at this job and earns a fixed monthly income. She works Monday through Friday from 7am until 5pm. She hopes to improve her vision and health with this loan that she is asking from Ceprodel so that she can continue to work and be productive in her daily tasks in order to move her family ahead; health is the most important thing. Ana Yohelsy G. is a single woman with two daughters, one of whom is school age and for whom she pays all school expenses. This is her 12th loan with Ceprodel in 9 years. She states that the loans have been of much benefit to her because she has been able to improve her family situation buying appliances and furniture and paying for her daughter's schooling; for this she is grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her glasses and medicines.

loans.name: El

texts.en:
El S. is married and resides with his wife (shown in the photo) in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He has three children.

S. operates his motorbike as a driver everywhere in the city, earning an income of 3 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife sells fruits and fried bananas at home, earning an income of 3 USD per day. She has been with this business since 2005. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses.

S. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to buy more fruit to stock his wife’s store. This is his fifth loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for his wife to sell

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana raises hogs to earn a living. She is 56 years old with three children. She and her husband separated but it didn’t stop her from continuing with her life. Her youngest child is taking up Electronics and Communications Engineering at a university in her town. She works hard to have him graduate this year.

Cayetana also sought the help of CEVI, an MFI (micro-finance institute), to support her business. She says that its program is a big help to her hog-raising business. She is now applying for a loan of Php 14,000, which she will use to buy additional piglets and feeds. She is hopeful to earn more so she is able to pay for her son’s university fees.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en: Munhtsetseg D. is twenty-seven years old. She is single and lives with her mother in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent), in Arhangai, Mongolia. Munhtsetseg operates a mobile product-trading business in her town. She started her business with her brother in 2004; she purchases a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border town, and sells them to the herder families. Munhtsetseg sells her products in Burd, Orhon bags (a local small administrative unit) in Tsenher Soum. In the beginning, she purchased 80,000 MNT worth of products for her business. However, with a lot of hard work and determination, today her working capital is 3,500,000 MNT. With her earnings, Munhtsetseg purchased her own plot of land with a house and yard for her family in 2006. In addition, she purchased a new car with her business profit. She is a very hardworking person and her dream is one day to create her own shop. Munhtsetseg is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border town, at wholesales prices and to resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase variety of products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, oil and meat.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann M., 31, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Jessie, a factory worker, they are blessed with two children. She helps her husband earn income so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Mary Ann has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 13,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying groceries needed to replenish her current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries needed to replenish her current product inventory

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is a middle-aged woman whose husband appears in the photo here. K. currently has a school-aged child, who is dependent on her. She raises pigs and rice crops to earn a living, while her husband buys chopped wood in bulk and retails it to make a profit. 

K.’s husband is concerned that he always has to hire the neighbor’s cart at a high price to deliver the firewood from the forest. He plans to own a cart to use without paying a fee, but he doesn’t have enough money to make that possible.
