Therefore, Mrs. K. is applying for a loan to be used to purchase a new cart for her husband to harness to a buffalo to pick up the chopped wood.

loans.use: To purchase a new cart

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 4 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is the coordinator of her group, L. Nueva Esperanza 4 (New Hope 4), and her story is representative of her group and generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity is a free trading zone and a cement factory, but both running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and her four children.

Ramona is excited to be taking out her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear and shoes in a Fantasia, which is a variety store that caters to women. She will use the profits to change her house from wood to concrete block to give her family a safer home, and expand her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy underwear and shoes to sell

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy K., 44, is married and lives with her husband (in the photograph) and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is employed at a local garment factory for an income of USD 2.6 per day. Her husband raises cows and is a construction foreman, earning an income of USD 6 per day. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. She would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad C. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Felicidad owns a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Felicidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Felicidad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es: Irma es soltera y trabaja como maestra de educación primaría, ayuda a su papá y mama. Ella trabaja luego de venir de la Escuela de dar clases, en vender pollo por libra y vender leña por Rodaja.  Trabaja lunes a viernes como Maestra y de lunes a domingo en vender pollo y leña.  A parte de eso se dedica a la crianza de marranos.  Solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos, leña, y pollos.  Agradece a FAPE por brindarle ayuda. Su sueño es tenere una polleria y una marranería para seguir luchando y en el futuro estar bien economicamente y seguir ayudando a sus padres.
texts.en:
Irma is a single elementary school teacher. She also helps her mother and father. After coming home from teaching at the school she goes to work selling chicken by the pound and bundled firewood. She works from Monday to Friday as a teacher and Monday to Sunday she sells chicken and firewood. Aside from all of that she raises pigs. She requests the loan for the purchase of pigs, firewood, and chickens. She is thankful for FAPE offering her help. Her dream is to have a chicken and pig stand to continue working hard and in the future be economically stable and continue helping her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of pigs, chicken, and firewood.

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Madame DJENEBA C. est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est née le 19 Mai 1970 à KADIOLO, une  préfecture de la 3eme région administrative du Mali.  Elle vit avec son mari avec leurs enfants à KADIOLO, quartier Tagouasso.
Depuis 2 ans, elle fait essentiellement  l’achat vente de chaussures et de pagnes wax, bazins) et possède un hangars au marché de KADIOLO où elle vend. 
Elle  vend aussi de façon ambulante.
Elle est à son premier prêt  avec Soro Yiriwaso et compte l’utiliser pour acheter,  1dizaine de paires de chaussures, 20 pièces de pagnes wax et 20 complets de bazins. Elle s’approvisionne Bamako (capitale du Mali) et  vend au comptant  et à crédit (sur commande et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  utilisé pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et  fera l’objet d’épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. DJENEBA C. is married and the mother of seven children. She was born May 19, 1970 in KADIOLO, a prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of Mali. She lives with her husband and children in KADIOLO, in the Tagouasso neighborhood. For the past two years, she has principally bought and sold shoes, wax pagnes (a colorful cloth) and damask. She has a covered stall at the KADIOLO market where she sells. She also works as an itinerant vendor. This is her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso and she plans to use it to buy around 10 pairs of shoes, 20 pieces of wax pagne and 20 bazin suits. She gets her supplies in Bamako (capital of Mali) and sells by cash and credit (on order and retail) to a clientele composed of men and women. She anticipates making a average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA which will be used to bolster her working capital and add to her savings.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El sr. Leonardo F. es de la ciudad de la compañía 2da Linea Ybupora, es casado, tiene 3 hijos. El señor se dedica a hacer flete mediante un camion que posee, inicio su trabajo en una pequeña camionetita ahora ya compro uno mas grande para poder realizar su viaje con mas tranquilidad y para ofrecer un servicios a sus clientes. Posee buenas referencias es una persona responsable honesta y muy trabajdor.
Su objetivo es comprar cubiertas nuevas a su camion para evitar problemas en cada viaje que realiza al mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Leonardo Fernández is from the city of Compañía 2da Linea Ybupora. He’s married and has three children. He works hauling cargo with a truck he owns. He started working with a small truck but he has now purchased a larger one to do the trips more calmly and to offer better customer service. He has good personal references. He is a responsible, honest, hard working man. His objective is to buy new covers for the truck to avoid problems on the trips he makes to market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tarp covers for the truck

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 51 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el caserío La Zaranda, una zona rural que tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, el lugar pertenece al distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe y se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace mas de veinte años. Actualmente ha sembrado maíz en un terreno de cultivo ubicado cerca a su vivienda. El depende de esta actividad para solventar sus gastos y salir adelante, por ello siempre da lo mejor de si para cuidar su cultivo de modo que se asegure un buena producción.

Marcial desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona muy conocedora de su negocio, siempre trabaja con empeño y responsabilidad. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en: Marcial is 51years old, single and lives in the hamlet of La Zaranda, a rural agricultural area in the district of Pítipo, province of Ferreñafe, and located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has made a living in agriculture for more than 20 years. Currently he has planted corn on a plot of land near his home. He depends on this activity to cover household expenses and make headway, so he always gives his best to take care of his crops and ensure a good production. Marcial wants to acquire some fertilizers and pesticides to better care for his crops, and to achieve that objective he is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. He is a very savvy businessman who always works hard and responsibly. He has previously received loans from Edpyme Alternativa and has show himself to be responsible with his payments.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his corn crops

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im M. is a 44-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. She is married to Mr. Sok, age 51, who is a local chef. Im M.’s husband is always hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and their other ceremonies. 

This couple has four children, one of whom is married and the other three are single. Im M. has a son who is not yet working. She wants to encourage her son to have a job, but she has no cash to make that possible. So, she is requesting a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for her son to provide transportation for a fee.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle for her son to provide transportation for a fee.

loans.name: Marsu Group

texts.en:
Marsu V., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called the Marsu Group.  She is 38 years old, married, and has five children who are between the ages of 9 and 20 years. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For 6 years, she has been operating a mini restaurant in the Redlight Community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more rice, fish, meat, seasonings, pepper, salt and other ingredients. 

She describes herself as a hard-working woman whose goals are to improve her business and the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To buy rice, fish, meat, seasonings, pepper, salt and other ingredients.

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab lives in Mian Channu, a small city in Pakistan. She came here after her marriage 12 years ago. Since then, she has lived in a two-room brick house with her family.
 
She is 39 years old and married to M. S., who is involved in a vegetable-selling business. He sells vegetables in different streets of the city by putting them on a four-wheeled cart. He has been doing this business for over eight years, and people prefer buying from him due to his good behavior and the freshness of his vegetables.
 
Zainab herself is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of household responsibilities. She takes her responsibilities very seriously and tries to give comfort to her family with her efforts. She has two sons and a daughter. All of them are illiterate. Both her sons do labor for daily wages.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy some fresh seasonal vegetables to sell. Zainab hopes that after this investment her husband’s business will be in a more profitable position, making him more income than before.
 
She is one of Asasah's regular loan users, and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she built a good credit record and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for the vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Catine Alberto

texts.pt:
Catine Alberto N. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de 1 filho de 1 ano de idade. Fez 10ª classe não continuou devido as dificuldades financeiras pelos pais. Vive na casa dispensada pelos familiares com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu da Província de Maputo, apenas tem viajado para os países vizinhos para a compra da sua mercadoria. Tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos diversos ha mais de 3 anos, não possui empregados e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum em sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através do secretario do bairro que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (farinha, sardinhas em lata, pilhas, cerveja, refrescos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para ampliar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Catine Alberto N. was born in the District of Boane in Maputo Province, located in southern Mozambique.  He is married and is the father of 1 child who is 1 year old.  He completed 10th grade but did not continue due to his parents' financial difficulties.  With his family, he lives in alternative housing for families with low incomes does not support anyone else.

He has never left Maputo Province though he has traveled to neighboring countries to buy merchandise for his store.  For more than 3 years, Catine has had his own business selling a variety of products; he does not have any employees.  He earns about 8,000 MZN each month, which he uses to pay for household expenses.  He even manages to save some in his bank account.

Catine has never had loans through other banks.  He found out about Hluvuku from the district secretary, who is also a client of the institution.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku.  He is requesting 10,500 MZN, which he plans to use to buy products (flour, canned sardines, batteries, beer, soda, etc.) to increase his inventory.

He promises to pay back the loan on time in order to have access to others in the future.  He plans to request new loans to help him expand his business.

loans.use: To buy products (flour, canned sardines, batteries, beer, soda, etc.)

loans.name: John Karanja

texts.en:
John has been practicing farming in Naivasha town for the last nine years. He is 40 years old married to Leah Nduta. They have two child going to school.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend who is also a member of KADET. This will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of KES 10,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount for land preparation and buying seedlings for planting.

In the future, John hopes to increase farm production by practicing large-scale farming.

loans.use: For land preparation and buying seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Anthony Topos

texts.en: Anthony Topos M. is 34 years old and married to Maximiller Emase, who is a house wife. They have three school-going children aged 18, 14 and eight. The family resides in Lodwar, Kenya. Anthony operates a motorcycle service and has been in this business for the past four years. He earns a monthly profit of KES17,000. Anthony learnt about KADET LTD through a credit officer and is now applying for a second loan of KES75,000 from KADET, which he intends to use to buy another motorbike. The anticipated profits will be used to expand his motorbike service business. In the future Anthony wishes to be the leading local investor in the area.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina L. is from the village of Mangga. She is 49 years old. Florentina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Florentina owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Florentina has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2010, Florentina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 21000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Florentina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more candles, palm oil, matches, etc.

loans.name: Kolaban Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Kolaban sont toutes  mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans  et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULABA un des villages de la sous préfecture de NIENA région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et les deux prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de poissons à travers AWA D.. 
AWA D. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  8 Kg de poissons. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de NIENA. Les poissons sont revendus au  marché de BOUGOULABA et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Kolaban group are all married women, averaging 40 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in BOUGOULABA, a village in the NIENA sous-prefecture in Sikasso Region, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their third loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Both previous loans were repaid without problems. This group of women sells fish through AWA D..

AWA D. intends to use her loan to buy 8 kg of fish. She gets her supplies at the grand market in NIENA. She resells the fish for cash, at her home and at the BOUGOULABA market, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 40), to be used to pay for the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To clear farmland and buy chickens

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina tiene 45 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de Chinchero del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Cristina nos cuenta que la ciudad de chinchero es visitado por miles de turistas durante todos el año porque ahí se encuentra una de las ciudades arqueológicas más importantes del Imperio Incaico. Cristina también nos cuenta que desde muy joven se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía y vende en la  Asociación de Artesanos de “Haya Wasi Tocapo” de Chinchero  Cristina tiene un historial crediticio muy bueno y por eso pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva victoria” donde tiene crédito. Cristina en esta oportunidad requiere el microcrédito para comprar más materiales para la elaboración de artesanía.
texts.en: Cristina, 45, is from Chinchero, a city in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  She tells us that Chinchero is a popular tourist destination, visited by thousands of tourists every year, because it's an important archaeological site.  During the time of the Inca Empire, Chinchero was one of the most important Incan cities.  She tells us, too, that she has earned a living making and selling crafts since she was very young.  She belongs to the Haya Wasi Tocapo artesan association and sells her crafts at its store in Chinchero.  She is also a member of the Nueva Victoria community bank where she has a strong history of repaying past loans.  Cristina will use this loan to buy the supplies she needs to make the products she sells.

loans.use: to buy supplies for crafts business

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Хочаева Мохира проживает в районе Варзоб. Ей 28 лет. Она разведена. Живет вместе с родителями. Детей не имеет. У нее высшее образование, преподаватель. По профессии работает более 5 лет. Кроме того она в свободное от работы время занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Она в основном откармливает и продает крупнорогатый скот. В этой области уже 3 года. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en: Mohira K. lives in the Varzob region. She is 28 years old. She is divorced and lives with her parents. She does not have children. She has higher education and is a teacher by profession. Mohira has worked as a teacher for more than five years. Besides that in her free time from work she does animal husbandry. She breeds large horned cattle at home. She mainly feeds and sells large horned cattle and has been in this business for three years. She is taking out the loan to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Magbel

texts.en:
Magbel is 37 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is married and her husband works in a paint store. Magbel has three children: 21, 15 and 3. Two live with her and the other lives with her brother; the two oldest attend school. 

For four years, Magbel has been selling food: she cooks fufu (starchy dumplings), rice, and soup. Somedays the business is good, other days it's not. She learned how to cook from her mother and the best part of her work is that she likes cooking. 

Magbel has requested a loan to purchase bags of rice, fufu, and a large can of oil. In the future, Magbel would like to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase rice, fufu, and oil

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucia; es casada; la socia tiene 53 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos, la socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, ella produce maíz, papa, y también se dedica al engorde del ganado, la socia tiene vacas y toros, la socia lleva sus ganados a vender a la tablada, ella constantemente está comprando ganados y los engorda reproduce y los vende. En esta ocasión la socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y sales minerales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimento para los ganados.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia is a member of the Communal Bank “Ollantay de Wayrapuncu” which is in Urubamba Province in the Department of Cusco.

She is 53 years old, married, and has two children. Her main business activity is farming. She produces corn and potatoes. Lucia also fattens cattle, both bulls and cows. She brings her cattle to market to sell and is constantly buying animals for fattening and breeding. On this occasion, Lucia needs a loan to invest in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to invest for this purpose.

Lucia is extremely grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Waliqui Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WALIQUI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Cristina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesanías, venta de focos, venta de comida, mercadería de artesanías, productos de belleza, venta de tripitas.

La señora Cristina,  indica que este es el segundo ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de promoción puerta a puerta. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de focos, que inicio hace quince años aprendiendo de sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para mercadería (compra de focos), que consiguieran por mayor del Desaguadero (frontera Bolivia, Perú) y los venderán todos los días en la zona anexo 8 de enero y en las ferias de la 16 de Julio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud.
texts.en:
The Waliqui Communal Bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. This group has eight members and is led by its Board of Directors headed by Sra. Cristina. The members of the Communal Bank engages in various business activities in order to get ahead such as making and selling handicrafts, selling light bulbs, selling food, selling beauty products, and selling tripe tacos.

Sra. Cristina says that she is participating in her second loan cycle with Pro Mujer. She was invited to join as a result of a door-to-door campaign. At the moment, she has a business selling light bulbs which she started 15 years ago. She learned this trade from her parents.

Cristina will use her current loan to buy light bulbs to add to her inventory. She acquires her merchandise in bulk at “El Desaguadero” (the region along the border between Bolivia and Peru). Cristina sells her products every day at the January 8th Annex and at the July 16th Fair. Working in this manner allows her to generate income to support her family. Cristina is in a common law marriage and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Cristina said that she enjoys the health seminars.

loans.use: to purchase light bulbs.

loans.name: Johanna Oswalda

texts.es: Johana Oswalda tiene 37 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este negocio. no es la primera experiencia que obtiene con los financiamientos, ella distribuye sus productos por encargos pues es así que obtiene más clientes. Ya que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles porque no tenía el capital suficiente. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de calzado, perfumes y ropa en general, bolsos, body, tratamientos y sabanas.
texts.en: Johana Oswalda is 37 years old and has made a living selling general merchandise for the past four years. This is not her first experience with loans. She distributes her products via orders, which is how she picks up more customers. Starting the business was very difficult because she didn't have sufficient capital. She is requesting the loan to purchase footwear, perfumes, general clothing, handbags, body treatments and sheets.

loans.use: to purchase footwear, perfumes, general clothing, handbags, body treatments and sheets.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona S. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Chona is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns & operates a business operating motor transport services. Chona has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Chona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Chona is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Chona from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 52 years old. She has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru Town for the last twelve years. She also has a clothes shop in Ndunyu Njeru Town where she sells used clothing to boost her income.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of KES 10,000 well and on time. She plans to use this loan to buy more used clothes to sell in her clothes shop in Ndunyu Njeru Town.

In the future, Dorcas hopes to expand her clothes shop and open a big boutique.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Han is a driver. When he is free, he also assists his wife in her farming business. They have been married since 1990, and they have five daughters. They live along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Han is asking for his second loan of $1,000 to dig a well and build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To dig a well and build a restroom for family use.

loans.name: Bunchan

texts.en:
Bunchan, 29 year old, is state teacher in one of the primary schools in his village with $4 per day for his income. He lives with one younger sister. 

Every month, he has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity and $10 for other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for traveling to teach in the school and for his extra class that he is taking to get more knowledge to apply in his career. 

In the future, he plans to support his sister to study until she is able to be a teacher like him.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work and classes.

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
Doña Salvadora una humilde comerciante de 64 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Estelí,es viuda, tiene 5 hijos. Ella se dedica a elaborar tortillas y es costurera al mismo tiempo. Inicio en el negocio de elaboración de tortillas hace 40 años , también se dedico a aprender costura de esta manera ha sobrevivido ella y sus hijos  durante todo este tiempo , su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación , ella misma las vende y elabora pero ya no sale a vender pues por su edad no puede recorrer grandes distancias como antes ,vender sus tortillas a los clientes que habitan alrededor de su vecindario . 
Ella requiere el préstamo para poder comprar maíz  y leña al por mayor y comprar dos puertas para su casa ya que con la lluvias se le introduce agua en su cocina que es donde tiene su venta de tortillas. Con esta inversión podrá adquirir mas fácilmente materia prima para  trabajar, mejorar sus ingresos y hacerles mejoras a la infraestructura de su hogar y negocio. Desea invertir para su negocio de costura y mantener el negocio de ventas de tortillas y seguir trabajando hasta donde Dios Le permita.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salvadora is a humble seller who is 65 years old, lives in Estelí city, widowed, and has 5 children. She makes tortillas and is a seamstress at the same time. She started her tortilla making business 40 years ago. She also learned how to sew and was able to help herself and her children survive all of this time with these jobs. She has her business in her home. She her products and sells them but no longer goes out to sell them since she can no longer walk long distances like before. She sells them to clients who live around her neighborhood. 
She is requesting the loan to buy maiz and wholesale firewood. She also wishes to buy two doors for her home since rainwater gets into her kitchen where she makes her tortillas. With the loan she will be able to buy essential materials for her job, increase profits, and improve her home and business's infrastructure. She wishes to invest in her sewing and tortilla businesses and continue working where God will permit her.

loans.use: buy maiz, wholesale firewood, and two doors for her home.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi sells several varieties of vegetables as shown in the photograph above. These vegetables are "konkomirre" (African spinach), fresh tomatoes, green beans, cucumber and others. Esi lives in Abura and has received junior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. 

Esi has been selling these foodstuffs for 25 years. She assists her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy varieties of vegetables to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy varieties of vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a 27-year-old man. He is married with two children, aged 5 years and 1 year, to whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. He operates a motorcycle transport business and serves the local people at Maondo in Kakamega. He has been running this business for two years now. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is the high cost of fuel. However, he works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy another motorcycle to grow his business and serve more people. He hopes to buy two more motorcycles to expand his business, and in the future, purchase a matatu (minibus). He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosa Marleny

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a una pupuseria, vive con su esposo y dos hijos quienes dependen D. sus ingresos, ella inicio como empleada D. pupuseria, cuando aprendió a elaborarlas decidió tener su propio negocio desD. hace 12 años, su horario es D. 6:00am a 2:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, tomates, con la idea D. mantener en el negocio todo lo necesario para la producción D. pupusas, aumentándola para tener mejores ventas.
La intención D. Rosa es trabajar con préstamos para mejorar el negocio, creando un buen historial D. pago que le permita continuar con este servicio, además D. mejorar  la condición D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa works making pupusas (stuffed tortillas).  She lives with her husband and two children, who are dependent on her income.  She started off as an employee at a pupusa business; once she had learned how to prepare them, she decided to start her own business.  This was 12 years ago.  Her schedule is from 6 a.m. to 2 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to invest in cheese, meat, oil, and tomatoes, with the thought of keeping everything stocked in her business for making pupusas, and expanding through increased sales.

Rosa's intention is to work with loans to improve her business.  She believes that her good payment history will allow her to continue with this service, and additionally to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cheese, meat, oil, and tomatoes for her business making pupusas (stuffed tortillas)

loans.name: Lindaflor

texts.en:
Lindaflor is 47 years old. She is engaged in selling vegetables. She has a small plot of land where she plants vegetables, such as eggplants, and sells them at harvesting season. 

Lindaflor earns money to cover the expenses for the education of her three children. She is thankful that they are helping her in cultivating and planting. But the problem is that she doesn’t have enough working capital to buy the necessities for planting. For this reason, she is asking for a loan amount of PHP5,000 from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. to buy seeds (beans, eggplant and squash), plastic mulching and organic fertilizer. This will be a big help in expanding and upgrading her business. She hopes to improve her business in order to earn a higher income and save for the educational purposes of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds (beans, eggplant and squash), plastic mulching and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro tiene 45 años, convive con Roberta de 32 años, con quien tiene 04 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de San Cristóbal, Pichari. Él es agricultor, actividad a la que se ha dedicado desde muy joven, ya que sus padres le enseñaron como cuidar y labrar la tierra. El sabe que el trabajo agrícola requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico y dedicación, pero a la edad que tiene no le permite cumplir con todas sus obligaciones, es por ello que emprende otro negocio, que es la venta de abarrotes. Es así que su actividad agraria se encarga de una persona que contrata, mientras que él solo se dedicaría administrar su tienda. Se siente feliz con la labor que realiza porque gracias a ello percibe un ingreso económico estable, asimismo se siente agradecido con su esposa quien la ayudan también en este trabajo. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles, comprará sacos de abonos para fertilizar su campo agrícola y no dejar de producir.
texts.en: Pedro is 45 years old and lives with his partner Roberta with whom he has 4 children. Together they live in their own house in San Cristobel, Pichari. He works as a farmer, something he has done since he was very young as his parents taught him how to care for and work the land. He knows that farming requires a great deal of hard physical labour and dedication but at his age he is not able to meet all his work obligations. This is why he is undertaking another business selling groceries. In this way he can employ someone to do his farming work while he manages his grocery store. He is happy with the work he does as thanks to this work he receives a stable income. He is also grateful to his partner who helps him with the work. This will be his first loan with MFP and he agrees to make his repayments punctually. With the 3,000 soles (PEN) he will buy bags of manure for his fields to ensure not-stop production.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Alejandrina Rosa

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” del distrito de Ilave, en el departamento Puno.  Tiene 45 años, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos entre 10 y 22 años.
Estudió enfermería y trabaja todo el día en un hospital. Además tiene un negocio de venta de productos de belleza que lleva desde hace unos cuatro años y que estableció copn el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos. 
Inició con un capital de S./ 500,00 y gracias a su clientela fija y puntual su negocio está bien establecido. Cuenta que tiene algunos productos en stock, así que cuando alguien tiene la necesidad de un desodorante por ejemplo ella puede atenderlo de inmediato. Con éste préstamo de S./ 2,500 comprará nuevos perfumes y joyas. 
Dos de sus cuatro hijos ya están estudiando una carera en la universidad y su sueño es que todos sus hijos sean profesionales. Además tiene la meta de tener una tienda propia. Lo que le gusta de Manuela Ramos son las reuniones donde una se relaja y se olvide de los problemas.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Communal Bank San Miguel in the district de Ilave in the department of Puno. She is 45 years old, living together with a partner, and has 4 children between 10 and 22 years old. 

She studied to be a nurse and works all day in a hospital. Also, she has had a business of selling beauty products for some four years and had her first loan through the communal bank of Manuela Ramos.

She began with the amount of 500 soles and thanks to her customers she was able to make her payments on time and so when someone had the need for deodorant, for example, she could immediately assist them. With this loan of 2,500 soles she will buy new perfume and jewelry.

Two of her four children are studying for a career at the university and her dream is that all her children become professionals. She also has a goal of having her own store. What she likes about Manuela Ramos is the meetings where she can relax and forget her problems.

loans.use: to buy perfume and jewelry for resale

loans.name: Delia Andrea

texts.es:
Delia tiene 33 años y vive con sus cuatro hijos en Otavalo que esta en L. Provincia D. Imbabura. Delia se considera una persona muy alegre que le gusta su trabajo y es muy solidaria con las demás personas.

Delia trabaja en el terminal terrestre D. Otavalo en un puesto D. comidas por un tiempo D. tres años. Solicita créditos a Fodemi por tres años, el crédito actual es para L. compraD. una cocina industrial ya que L. que está utilizando es prestada y tiene que devolver, también utilizará el dinero para L. compra D. víveres para cocinar en su puesto, esta inversión le va a ayudar porque su puesto va a estar más presentable con L. cocina nueva y aumentando su negocio, sus ingresos van a ser buenos y podrá ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien.

Su sueño es tener un local propio para aumentar su clienteL. y vender más ya que necesita tener mayores ingresos porque al momento no le alcanza para mantener a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Delia, 33, lives with her four children in Otavalo which is in Imbabura Province.  Delia considers herself to be a very cheerful person who enjoys her work and is very supportive of others.

She has had a food stand at the Otavalo land terminal for three years.  She has asked for Fodemi loans for three years.  The current loan is to buy an industrial stove because the one she’s using now is borrowed and she has to give it back.  She will also use the money to buy foodstuffs to cook in her stand.  

This investment will help her because her stand will be more presentable with the new stove and business will increase; her income will be good and she’ll be able to help her children to go to school.  Her dream is to have a locale of her own to increase clientele and sell more because she needs to earn higher income because it’s currently not enough to support her children.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove and to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Patricia Carolina

texts.es: Patricia, se decidió a tener otro crédito, porque quiere comprar semilla de marañón, ya que ahorita se pone a mejor precio y así lograra tener disponible para  mantener su negocio. Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron porque incrementaron sus ganancias, esto le permitió lograr mejor estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en: Patricia decided to take out another loan because she wants to buy cashews because their price is better now and she’ll be able to have on-hand supply to stay in business.  The previous loans helped her because she increased profits which led to better economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy cashews.

loans.name: Azen

texts.en: Azen lives with his wife in ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. He started his garment retailing business in 2007 by renting a counter in a market. Now he runs a whole shop and his business is expanding rapidly. He is well known for his eye for fashion. Now that winter is approaching, he needs money to buy warm clothes. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I started this business from scratch; now that I'm here, I believe that someday I can build my own store". He is requesting 3,700,000 MNT to purchase winter clothes.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Estelita has a shop that sells coconuts for copra. She has had this business for 13 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15000 to buy coconuts.

Estelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Estelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for copra.

loans.name: Enita Estrella

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Junio.

La señora Enita es socia fundadora del Banco comunal,  es la secretaria y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, la mayor de ellos aun vive con ella y estudia en universidad. Su esposo ya no trabaja por enfermedad. Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia en Portoviejo.

Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su casa para que les realice sus obras. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, su hija le ayuda cuando está desocupada. Lleva más de 20 años dedicada a esta actividad.

Ella está  repitiendo el crédito ya que con los que ha recibido ha podido mejorar su negocio, con lo que le ha quedado de ganancia ella ha comprado otra máquina para realizar bordados y con esto ha tenido más trabajo y más clientes complacidos.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura ya que en esta época del año aumenta su trabajo. 

Su sueño es tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
The members of 5 de Julio Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, known since colonial times as Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos [City of the Royal Tamarinds, a type of tree]. 

Enita is a founding member of the communal bank as well as the secretary, and she likes the bank because of the help they give with loans.  She is 52  years old and married, and has five children from this relationship, all of whom are grown. The oldest daughter still lives with her and studies at the university. Her husband no longer works due to illness. Several years ago she learned clothing cutting and assembling at an academy in Portoviejo.

She has a small sewing workshop in her house where for many years she has been sewing clothing.  She works on order from private individuals who come to her house so she can make their clothes. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m., and sometimes until later when she has orders to complete. Her daughter helps her when she is free. She has been doing this work for more than 20 years. 

She is repeating the loan because she has been able to improve her business with what she has received.  With the profit she has bought another machine to do embroidery, and with this she has had more work and more happy customers.

She is going to use this new loan to purchase cloth, thread, buttons, and other sewing supplies because at this time of year her work increases.

Her dream is to have a larger workshop.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, buttons, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men is 31-years-old with 2 children who are at school age.  Her main business activity is making pork paste and sell. This business has been run for 5 years and creates good revenue. Participating in our credit program in 2007, she has received 5  loans and invested effectively in her business. For a new  loan cycle, she wants to have 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy more pork as material for production.

loans.use: to buy more pork as material for production.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 55, is married, and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (the ancient temples Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey, etc.). 

She produces trunks which are made of palm leaves to sell. Her husband is a carpenter. All of her children are employed; one is a room maker, another a chef, and the third a dancer. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Lim requests a loan to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she plans to raise pigs at home and build new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Sagrado

texts.en:
Sagrado is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children.
 
Sagrado has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines and milk fish. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy fish to sell.

Sagrado has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Sagrado hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa es una persona muy emprendedora  dedicada 100% a su negocio, que es  alquiler  de  apartamentos,  Ella vive con su hija. En Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 15 años de tener este tipo  de negocio.
Doña Rosa el  préstamo  lo invertirá en  la  compra  de cemento, arena, ladrillos y mano de  obra para construir una cisterna para almacenamiento de agua. Para poder  atender mejor a sus clientes.
Doña Rosa con las mejoras de los apartamentos espera tener  mejores  ingresos  ya que cobrara mas y así agenciarse de mejores ingresos. Sus sueños  es  poder    darle a su  hija una buena educación  y mandarla a la  universidad
Choluteca  Honduras   23 de  abril   del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos y mano de  obra para mejorar su negocio

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Mary Wanjiku from Muranga. Like many residents of Muranga who farm and export coffee, Mary has been doing this work for three years. She owns a pump and mosquito net, but does not own any cows, pigs, poultry, bicycles, motorcycles, or automobiles. Mary has running water, but does not have electricity, solar power, a sewing machine, DVD, or other modern devices.

To make ends meet, she also engages in crop farming, fish farming and personal business. Mary says that even though initial farming preparations are challenging, harvesting gives her great joy. Having said that, she also explained that her highest monthly expense goes to farming costs. She is therefore applying for this loan so that she can get funding to expand her fish farming project as it will boost her income and improve her livelihood. 

Mary was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied it was because unlike other MFI's, Juhudi gives agricultural loans. When asked about her key learnings from Juhudi's microfinance training sessions, she said she learned about how to develop a culture of saving.

loans.use: To do fish farming.

loans.name: Joel Elias

texts.es:
Joel, tuvo efectos positivos con el préstamo anterior, pues conto con los recursos económicos para equipar bien su negocio con materiales básicos para elaborar los diferentes trabajos de estructuras metálicas que tenía pendientes de entregar, su cosecha de maíz fue muy buena, las nuevas ganancias le ayudaron a cumplir con los diferentes compromisos económicos que tiene.
En esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo financiamiento para comprar electrodos, laminas, hierro y algunos repuestos para su soldador, con lo que su trabajo no se descontinuara y podrá brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Joel had positive results with his previous loan. He was able to rely on the financial resources to equip his business with basic materials for completing different steel structure jobs he had pending. His corn crop was very good, and the new earnings helped him meet various financial obligations he had.

This time he is requesting a new loan to buy electrodes, plates, iron, and some spare parts for his welder so that he can continue his work and provide better service.

loans.use: to buy electrodes, plates, iron, and some spare parts for soldering iron.

loans.name: El Buen Beneficio Group

texts.en:
San Bartolomé Jocotenango is a small town where nearly all of the population is indigenous K’iche Maya. The population holds fast to their traditions of language and colorful dress. Little girls are traditionally not given the same opportunities as boys. The result is that about 70% of women have had no formal education and 30% were only able to study until the 4th or 6th grades.

Ten women have joined together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “El Buen Beneficio” and are so pleased to be able to access loans and sustain and expand their small animal husbandry businesses. The ladies raise animals like bulls, cows, pigs, turkeys and chickens. They sell their animals in a local market and in the nearby large market in Quiche. 

The President of the group is 53 year old Isabel, who is the mother of nine children who range in age from 10-28. She has been able to afford to give all of them a primary school education. Isabel raises animals including cows, pigs, turkeys and chickens. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals as well as feed to fatten them up and then sell them. With her anticipated income, she will keep supporting the needs and education of her children and in addition, buy fertilizer for her corn and bean fields. 

The women realize that having access to education is of great importance to success in the future. Since the vast majority of them have had no education at all, they understand this and are motivated to see their children stay in school as long as possible. The ladies feel fortunate to participate in educational trainings in their monthly meetings with a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge. 

With capital and education, the women are taking steps to create a more prosperous future for themselves and their families. Thank you!

loans.use: To buy more animals as well as feed to fatten them up

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita L. has been in the bread business for 11 years. Her husband also worked in a bread factory for 11 years. When the two got married, they decided to open a small bakery and make fresh bread so that everyone could try their recipe. Felicita operated the business end of things and only a year ago left her job at the factory to start her own venture. However, the Lainezes lack capital to step up production. Running a bakery is perhaps one the most time-consuming businesses because you have to prepare bread for the next day the night before. Felicita and her husband open their doors at 6am every day, but their day starts well before that. This husband and wife team usually sells out by 10am, which is when they take their first break. Then, they start their second shift at 1pm selling bread to the afternoon crowd. By the time they sell out, clean the shop, prepare the dough for the next day, and leave the shop it is 10pm. Felicita does this every day with her partner. Ms. L. needs this loan so she can buy certain raw materials like flour, butter, cooking oil, yeast, raisins, nuts, and jelly for the sweet pastries. Felicita is already financing a refrigerator which she uses to keep milk and juices cold. 

This 26 year-old entrepreneur is married with 2 small children. Together with her husband she has worked hard to grow the business into a profitable enterprise. They currently rent an apartment in Guayaquil and hope that one day they can purchase their own home. The L. family dreams big, and they want to own the most successful bakery in town.

loans.use: Ms. Lainez needs this loan so she can buy certain raw materials like flour, butter, cooking oil, yeast, raisins, nuts, and jelly for the sweet pastries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Consolata would like to buy one high-breed dairy cow.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Mr. Armando is married and has nine children. Eight of them are grown up and married, only the youngest lives with him and is 8 years old.

In order to make the money his family needs, Armando started selling corn, ice cream and fruits in a street stand in Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo Leon, where he is from.

Before that he worked for a transportation company, but due to downsizing he was laid-off. With help from a friend, he learned to make ice cream and borrowed a car to be able to sell it in the streets.

At the moment, Armando needs to borrow $275 which he will use to purchase the raw materials required to make ice cream. Because of his experience he knows that the demand for his product will increase this season and wants to be prepared to satisfy his clients. He has committed to pay back the loan in 3 to 6 months.

You can improve the life of this family, make your mind and support Armando.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


El señor Armando es casado y tiene 9 hijos, 8 de ellos son mayores de edad y están casados, solo el menor, de 8 años de edad, vive con él. Para obtener los recursos que necesita su familia, Armando inició con la venta ambulante de elotes, nieve y fruta en la localidad de Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo León, de donde es originario. Antes laboraba en una empresa de transportes y por recorte de personal quedó desempleado, con ayuda de un amigo aprendió a elaborar nieve y consiguió prestado un vehículo para poder vender por las calles.

En estos momentos, Armando necesita de un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que requiere en la elaboración de la nieve, por su experiencia sabe que en esta temporada se incrementa la demanda por este producto y quiere estar preparado para satisfacer a sus clientes, él se compromete a devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, decídete a apoyar a Armando.

loans.use: Purchasing Merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Business Description

Carmen began her business nine years ago with a little bit of capital that she obtained from selling products such as gifts, paper and craft supplies, and games. Carmen made use of this money and invested it in the preparation of encebollados (a typical food in Ecuador made with albacore fish), which yielded a better income for her. Her business is taking care of her clients daily from 6 a.m. to 12 p.m. She also sell sodas and juices.

Loan Use

Carmen needs a loan in order to increase her sales by buying fish, yucca, tomatoes, onions, and lemons in advance preparation for the weeks to come. Carmen tells us that by making this investment, her costs for shipping will go down, because she would like to make her purchases only twice a month. Also, her profits will improve her work site so that it will attract more clients.

Personal Information

Carmen is 43 years old and has three kids who are studying. Carmen is single; her spouse abandoned her four years ago, and since then she has carried on and continued taking care of her children and home. Carmen indicated to us that the reason that she is taking a loan is that she knows her buisness and that money makes more money. With this extra income, she plans to continue improving her home and increasing security for her family, because the area where she lives is dangerous but they have to survive.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Carmen inicio su negocio hace 9 años con un pequeño capital que logro obtener productos de la ventas de artículos como regalos, papelería, juguetes. Carmen dispuso de este dinero y lo invirtió en la elaboración de encebollados (comida tipica de Ecuador hecha con el pescado albacora) que le producen mayores ingresos. Sus ventas son diarias atiende a sus clientes desde las 6: AM a 12: PM además vende colas, jugos

Uso del Préstamo

Carmen necesita de un crédito para poder incrementar sus ventas comprar pescado, yuca, tomates, cebollas y limón para las quincenas. Carmen nos dice que realizando esta inversión sus costos por transporte bajarían porque sus compras las harías 2 veces por mes y pasando 3 días. Además con sus ganancias mejoraría su local para dar mejor atención a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Carmen 43 años y 3 hijos que están estudian. Carmen esta sola su esposo la abandono hace 4 años y desde ahí ella ha sacado adelante sus hijos y hogar. Carmen nos indica que es el motivo que hace recurrir a un préstamo, ella sabe hacer negocio y dice que la plata hace la plata. Con esto Carmen piensa seguir adecuando su casa y dar mayor seguridad a su familia porque sector por donde vive es peligroso pero tenemos que sobrevivir indica.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for preparing her client's meals

loans.name: Josephine Friday

texts.en: "I am proud to be a LAPO member for 7 years," explained by Mrs. Josephine Friday A.. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells yams in the market and hopes to improve her turnover & profit with the loan amount of $400. She has been in this business since 1994.

loans.use: To buy more yam

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi sells Hubble Bubbles, otherwise known as 'narguileh' Lebanon. Fadi is a 37 year old bachelor who lives in Nabatieh, in the South of Lebanon.  Fadi has built a network of clients who frequently visit him . This will be the 7th time Fadi has taken a loan from Al Majmoua, meaning he has a long and solid history with the association.  Fadi is known to be a hardworking person, who has never been late in his payments. Fadi is an ambitious entrepreneur who wishes to vary his source of income.  He is determined to invest in the car sales business. His business plan is very clear and he wishes to go on in investing in flourishing businesses.

loans.use: To invest in a sales car business

loans.name: Parvin

texts.en:
Parvin (his sister is pictured) was born in 1985 and lives in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region.

Parvin, who is single, has four years of experience in this business. Now, he needs a loan of $1,200 to buy baling presses for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy baling presses

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mr. P. Phat, 46, and his wife, Mrs. Kong Somaly, 33, have been married since 1992. Phat and his wife have a farm not too far from their home. He grows a few kinds of spinach to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. He started his business in 2000.

They have three children—two sons and one daughter. One of his children is working in a garment factory, and the other two children are studying in the local school. He and his family live along National Road number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phat requests this loan for $600; it is his third loan from MAXIMA. He will use this money to buy a water pumping machine and for supplies for growing vegetables.

loans.use: Buy a water pumping machine and supplies for growing vegetables

loans.name: Yati

texts.en: Yati, 34, is the mother of 3 children who plants and sells flowers and pots. She makes $20 a day. Her husband, A., sells them door-to-door around the villages and earns $10 a day. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of $100 to expand her business so she can increase her income to pay for her children's education. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Banda B3B A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Annet N.. She is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to open a vegetable stall in another location. Annet is 29 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 4 to 7 and her children go to school. Each week, Annet makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece pf land. Annet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 700000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Annet is joined in her small group by Zaituni N., Sulaniah B., Betty W., and Mary M.. Zaituni N. has a business in stone quarrying and wants to start up a retail shop. Sulaniah B. is currently operating a business in stone quarrying and wants a loan to add to her business. Betty W. operates a business of selling matooke and wants to start a charcoal selling business. Mary M. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge and start selling juice.

loans.use: To expand vegetable business

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr:
Fama T., married with one child and responsible for four other girls, has been a member of the village bank of Diaobé for three and a half years. She would like a loan to buy rice, oil, jumbo (bouillon cubes), vegetables, and meat in order to continue her catering business that she has been managing for ten years. The income earned from her business enables her to improve her family's well-being. This loan will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Fama T., mariée, avec 01 enfants et 04 autres filles en charge est membre du banc villageois de Diaobé depuis trois ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter du riz, de l’huile, du jumbo, des légumes et de la viande pour poursuivre son activité de restauration qu’elle mène depuis dix ans. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d’améliorer le bien être familial. Ce prêt sollicité sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, jumbo, vegetables, and meat for her restaurant

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Try S. M. is 30 years old. She runs a traditional Khmer noodle shop. These are basically restaurants only open in the mornings that serve traditional Khmer breakfast noodle soups. These shops are a key facet of colloquial culture in Cambodia. Town and city folk often begin their days at the break of dawn socializing at these. She can earn 5 US$ profit daily. She has a niece who shares her business as well. Her husband is a taxi driver between Kampong Cham city and Phnom Penh. He earns about 6 US$ per day. They support two young children who have just recently entered school. Try S. M. has many investment plans she hopes to carry out. She wants to invest further in her own business; buying tables, chairs, and other needed items. She also wants to pay for her husband to get much needed maintenance done on his car so it will continue to run and be a good source of income. With the left over cash she wants to purchase a small plot of land which will be used by her relatives to plant yams.

loans.use: To invest in a restaurant and fix a car.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio, 26, is married to Carmen Alvarez, 34. Carmen earns money selling empanadas to friends, neighbors and even her husband's customers. They have a five-year old son who is just starting school.

Ignacio is a mechanic and has an established customer base. He learned his trade from his uncle with whom he worked for more than ten years. Five years ago, he opened his own garage, a business that has gone well thanks to the care he takes and the thorough job he does for his customers. He needs the loan to buy a compressor.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Ignacio tiene 26 años, está casado con Carmen Álvarez de 34 años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta de empanadas en su domicilio vendiendo a los vecinos, amigos e inclusive a los clientes de su marido. Tienen un hijo de cinco años quien está empezando el ciclo básico.

Ignacio es mecánico, tiene clientela formada, el conocimiento de la profesión lo aprendió de su tío con quien estuvo trabajando por más de diez años. Hace cinco años que abrió su propio taller lo cual le va bien por su buena atención y por el trabajo garantizado que presenta a sus clientes. Necesita el crédito para la compra de una compresora.

loans.use: Buy a compressor.

loans.name: Mayas Kakchiquel Group

texts.en:
The Women from the Maya Kakchiquel group live in San Andres, a small, rural village in the mountains above Lake Atitlan. They enjoy living in such a town because of its tranquility and low amounts of crime, according to Maria C.. They expressed contentment with their specific loan group because of the support that the women can provide each other in a friendly atmosphere.

They are mostly mothers who manage to proudly send their children to school, even while managing and investing in the needs of their micro-enterprises. Seven of the group members are dedicated to hand weaving traditional indigenous clothing, another four, to the resale of imported second hand clothing, and another three to the sale and production of food products.

Hand-made guipils traditional top blouses of the high quality that they accustom to sell, usually take one month to produce and sell for amounts between 150 to 220 USD, according to Silvia S.. The resale of clothing is managed by shopping at different used sales stores, finding valuable items, and selling them once more in their town and local, to people interested, hereby gaining a profit. The food producers focus on a series of vegetables, produce and either sell to middlemen or directly at town markets.

When asked about how their businesses were going, there was hesitation, but overall, they were content with the rate of growth and income that it had brought them. This was said, despite their recognition that the price of many things has gone up recently and sales drop for the rainy season.

Nevertheless, these mothers and businesswomen were proud to have their own business which allowed them a sense of empowerment. With the capability to reinvest their money and return higher profits, this struggle is made easier, according to Rosa M., and their work can carry on while they are “satisfied and tranquil.”

Most of the loan that they receive goes to bulk purchasing of the necessary products for their business, be it cloth, threads and dyes for the weavers, or seed, fertilizer and pesticide for the farmers. They continuously need this useful capital to allow them flexibility paying off debts, expanding their business while reinvestment, and living a comfortable life as a family.

Karla C. sells “Ostra” mushrooms in a home-made wooden house specifically to foster mushroom growth. Her mushrooms are sold in the villages at lower altitudes down by Lake Atitlan. Her business, as well as many others of her group partners, has grown, yet she could still use this loan to make it grow even further. She said she would invest the money from loans in building a large greenhouse to produce much more mushrooms at once. Ingrid D. said she would remodel her local store with loan money to attract more customers.

Their dreams with ideal loan sizes only go so far into what it is that makes them perform the way they do. Deep inside, each of these women truly wanted the best for their family (like providing our “kids with education until they have a title” a HS equivalent), to show that they were independent and could actually help out their husbands, while improving their overall living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, thread, dyes / second hand clothing / Investment in a large greenhouse and in bulk pesticides, seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: César Ángel

texts.es:
César is 33 years old, and lives with his wife and two children in a humble home, which he worked hard to purchase. César is a farmer, growing potatoes in fields that were passed down to him by his parents. He learned this trade at a young age by helping his parents, and has been in charge of the fields since he was a teenager. César enjoys working with nature, but it is difficult to keep his land successfully producing crops. He is primarily motivated by his family, because he wishes to improve their quality of life. César would like to invest money from a loan in the purchase of fertilizers that will improve his production, and with that, his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

César es un hombre de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en una humilde casa, que con mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir. Es agricultor, se dedica al sembrío de papa en sus terrenos que heredó de sus padres, esta actividad la realiza desde muy pequeño con sus padre, pero de manera independiente lo hace desde adolescente cuando sus padres le dieron los terrenos para que los trabajara él mismo. El contacto con la naturaleza es lo que le más le agrada de su trabajo, sin duda lo difícil es mantener sus tierras adecuadas y fortalecidas para seguir produciendo y cultivando sus productos agrícolas. Su esfuerzo está encarnado en su familia, porque desea mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos. Cesar tiene el deseo de invertir el dinero que solicita en préstamos, en la compra de abonos y medicamentos que le ayuden a mejorar su producción y con ello, sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers to improve his production

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata S. est une femme de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle veut ce prêt pour améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille, en renforçant son activité d’embouche  caprine. Elle achète des chèvres qu’elle élève dans le but de les revendre plus tard surtout à l’approche des fêtes. <b>Elle compte rembourser ce prêt au bout de six mois en une seule échéance <b/>.
texts.en:
Fatoumata S., 33, is married and the mother of 4 children. She wants this loan to improve the living conditions, health, and education of her family by bolstering her business fattening goats. She buys goats which she raises with the intention of selling them later on, when the feast days are approaching. She is intending to reimburse this loan at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her goat-raising business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es casada y tiene 05 hijas cuyas edades son D. 23, 18, 17, 14 y 10 años D. edad, la mayor es profesional y la segunda está estudiando en la  Universidad Nacional del Altiplano, en Puno, la tercera se encuentra estudiando en el colegio y la última estudia en la escuela. Doña Isabel estudió primaria completa y vive en el Centro Poblado D. Acari, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo.

DesD. el año 2000 pertenece al Banco “Fe y Alegría” del Centro Poblado D. Acari, Yunguyo. Con su primer crédito D. S/.300 Nuevos Soles aumentó su capital para comprar más mercadería (pantalones jeans). Isabel manifiesta que siempre le gustó hacer negocio, desD. los 09 años D. edad vendía pan, caramelos y a los 18 años tuvo su pareja y desD. entonces se dedica a la venta D. ropa (pantalones jeans y chompas). Compra en la ciudad D. Desaguadero y los comercializa en la ciudad D. Tacna, a su vez se dedica al engorD. D. ganado vacuno, para lo cual compra en la feria D. Acora y lo venD. en Yunguyo.

Con este crédito D. S/.3,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar 01 vacuno con S/.2,000 y con S/.1,000 comprará más mercadería (ropa).

Su meta es comprar una casa en la ciudad D. Lima y que sus hijos sean profesionales, también piensa comprar un carro (tipo combi) para ir D. paseo con su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is married and has five girls, ages 23, 18, 17, 14 and 10. The oldest has a professional career and the second oldest is studying at the National University of Altiplano, in Puno. Isabel's third daughter is in high school, and her youngest is in graD. school. Isabel finished graD. school and lives in the the town of Acari, in the district and province of Yunguyo. Isabel has been a member of the "Fe y Alegría" [Faith and Joy] Community Bank in the town of Acari, Yunguyo, since 2000. With her first loan of 300 soles [about US$100], she had enough capital to purchase additional merchandise (blue jeans). According to Isabel, she always has liked doing business. When she was nine years old, she sold bread and candies. By the age of 18 she was married, and, since then, has sold clothing (jeans and sweaters). She purchases these items in the city of Desaguadero and then sells them in the city of Tacna. She also makes money fattening cattle, which she buys at the Acora fair and sells in Yunguyo. With this loan of 3,000 soles [US$1,025] -- which will be paid back in 3 installments -- Isabel has in her budget to buy one cow worth 2,000 soles, as well as 1,000 soles-worth of merchandise (clothing). Isabel's goal is to buy a house in Lima. She also hopes her children obtain good jobs. In addition, she is thinking about buying a car (mini van) to take a trip with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow and clothing

loans.name: Niso

texts.ru: Амирова Нисо жительница района Гиссар.Возраст 42  года,вдова, имеет 2 детей.Образование средне-специальное,по специальности инженер.Так как заработная плата очень маленькая,поэтому клиентка  более 4 лет занимается куплей продажей растительного масла.Бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи.Муж клиентки умер.На кредит Нисо хочет увеличить денежный оборот.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Niso A. is a resident of Gissar region. She is 42 years old, a widow and has two children. She attended a technical school, where she majored in engineering. Due to the fact that her salary is so low, for four years this loan client has engaged in the buying and selling of vegetable oil. This business has been the family's only source of income since the death of her husband. With this loan Niso wants to increase her working capital, and she plans on repaying the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en: Mrs. C. lives in Bac Phu commune, Soc Son district, Ha Noi province.  She is 37 years old and she has 4 children. She has been a member of TYM since 2001.  Now her main income is from raising pigs and her husband's salary.  For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow 10 million VND ($600 US) to invest in raising pigs.

loans.use: To invest in raising pigs.

loans.name: Ardica 2 Group

texts.fr:
http://sem-fund.org/carabane.php

Nous avons déja une expérience dans le domaine de la production et la vente de volailles.
