C'est pour cela que nous venons auprès de Kiva demander un financement pour pouvoir mener à bien une activité pour laquelle nous avons déja reçu une formation. Nous somes à notre deuxième xpérience en ce qui concerne les prêts de Kiva, que notre association a réussi à rembourser à temps et que cette fois-ci nous avons décidé de faire autre chose pour fournir notre écovillage en poulet de chaire et en même temps en fournir dans les villages qui nous entoure et qui vont très loins pour en chercher.
texts.en:
We already have experience in the field of raising and selling poultry. This is why we are coming to Kiva to ask for financing for carrying out our work, on which we have already received training. This is our second experience with regard to Kiva loans that our association has succeeded in repaying on time. We decided to do something else this time to supply our eco-village with fryer chickens. Meanwhile, the surrounding villages, which go to a lot of effort to get such chickens, can also be supplied by us.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks and supplies for raising chickens

loans.name: Robinah's Group

texts.en: Robinah N. is a mother of four children and the leader of her group.  She has a retail shop selling soda, juice and mineral water in Namawojjolo's trading center.  She also sells chickens to the same customers.  Her previous loans have helped her buy more chicken, sodas, water and juice to sell, and as a result, the profits have enabled her to look after her family and pay school fees for her children.  She plans on starting a poultry business in order to reap profits as her own supplier. Robinah is in need of another loan to help restock her shop with more soda, mineral water, juice and buying more chicken for roasting.

loans.use: More chicken, soda and other cold drinks to sell

loans.name: Odeaza

texts.en:
Odeaza F. lives in the remote village of Cabisera 14-16 of Ilagan, Isabela also known as Barangay Casilagan.  She has lived there for almost 20 years with her family. She is 39 years old and is married to Wilson. They have two children: Dexson who is 18 years old and who just ended his second year of high school and Judelyn who is 19 years old, and who is now in the third year of nursing courses at college. Her husband is engaged in rice, corn and vegetable farming while Odeaza maintains their hog raising business. At the same time, she keeps their home clean and orderly. She is happy that they are able to support their simple needs at home but sad because her younger child has no interest in pursuing his high school education. 

To further sustain the feed supply for her three hogs, Odeaza is requesting a loan. It would mean a lot to her because through it, she will be able to support her nursing student and be able to buy farm supplies for their farm.  Odeaza hopes to become successful with the business through the assistance of this lending program, her hard work and patience. She expects to double her income if she can maintain her business well.

loans.use: To buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Olubunmi

texts.en: Olubunmi O. is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children. She sells foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says "thank you" to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Rossette's Group

texts.en:
Rosette O. has a dairy business and is currently branching out into pig farming. 5 years ago, Rosette had 4 local cows, but they were not producing milk that would earn a good profit. So, Rosette sold those cows and bought 2 Heifers. After some time, she took those female cows to be impregnated. She says that in Uganda, you can use in-vitro fertilization or you can just take your female to a place where there are males and leave them for some time.

Now, she has the two original cows, plus three young female ones that are not yet old enough to produce milk. The cows that are producing milk, produce between 5 and 8 liters per day. After she milks them, there is a man who comes and purchases the milk for between 400 – 500 USH per liter. Rosette wants to purchase a male cow so that she will no longer have to pay the fee associated with getting her cows pregnant. She also wants to buy a few more calves, rather than waiting for her cows to give birth again. She will use a portion of her 2 mil UGH loan to do these things.

Recently, Rosette has noticed that there is a large demand for the products of pig farming so she has decided to branch out into that. She started by purchasing two pigs, and one is now pregnant! But, she does not yet have a formal place to keep her pigs. She is planning to use a large portion of her loan to build a pig pen on her farm.

Rosette is a single mother of six children. Her children range from 9 to 18. The father of her children left her years ago, and then recently passed away. Before he passed away, he was helping her to pay school fees for the children, but now that he has passed away it is up to her alone.

She says that as her children age, it is very important to be able to meet their needs. She says that if you are unable to meet their needs, they will go looking for other ways to get what they want. As her first-born is a girl who is now 18, she is particularly worried about meeting her daughter’s needs.

loans.use: To build a place to keep pigs, to buy a bull, and to buy a calf

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza M. is 40 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. Currently all are in school in the community where they live. She lives in a community called Eguase in the central region of Ghana. Her husband is a cleaner at the University of Cape Coast.

Adiza sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and eaten with sugar, milk and bread or what we called "kose" (ground beans fried into small doughnuts). Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so, in just about 20 minutes, it is ready to be served with the porridge.

With her large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She also wants to upgrade her food business. She hopes to make a good income to support her children in school. She treks to Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her supply of goods. With the loan, she believes she can buy more from the farmers and this will prevent her from frequent traveling. Adiza belongs to a village bank called "Otease," which means "He lives."

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Wiyou

texts.fr: Mme BANAWAÏ Wiyou est née en 1971 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants avec deux (02) autres personnes en charge, elle pratique le commerce de la vente de pagnes.  Elle sollicite un financement pour s’installer, ouvrir une boutique de vente de pagnes et se ravitailler en pagnes. Les bénéfices seront mis à la disposition de la famille pour un avenir meilleur.
texts.en:
Ms. BANAWAÏ Wiyou was born in 1971 in Tsévié. She is married and the mother of three children and has two other people to support. She does commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth). She’s’ requesting financing for getting situated, for opening a shop for selling pagnes, and for resupplying her self with pagnes. The profits will be put to use for a better future for the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cloth

loans.name: Nely Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. Nely Argentina B. tiene un negocio de venta de cosmeticos, tiene mas de 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, es viuda y madre de 2 hijos los cuales ya estan casados, con las ventas de cosmeticos ha logrado hacer muchas cosas en su hogar poco a poco. las ventas en estos momentos estan un poco dificiles ya que la situacion economica que se atravieza en la zona es muy dificil, entonces lo que ella quiere es comprar mercadedia al por mayor para que a ella le salga mas barato el producto y asi tener mejores ganancias, pero necesita capital para poder invertir en dicha mercaderia, por tal razon esta solicitando el credito para poder salir adelante. su meta es poder tener una tienda completa con todos los productos que ella quiera vender y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nely Argentina B. has a cosmetics sales business, which she has had for more than 4 years. She is a widow and the mother of two sons, who are both married. Through her cosmetics sales she has been able to achieve many things, bit by bit. Sales are a little difficult at this time because the economic situation in the area is very difficult. Therefore, what she would like is to purchase merchandise at wholesale prices so that the products will be less expensive for her and she can have better profits. However, she needs capital to invest in the merchandise; for this reason she is requesting a loan so that she can get ahead. Her goal is to have a store full of all the products she wants to sell and thereby have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shampoos, creams, lotions, deodorants, perfumes, and household cleaning products

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni M. is 28 years old and makes a living selling bread. She is applying for this loan to open her own bakery. Her husband is a farmer, and they have four children, three boys and one girl, all of whom are in school. With the profits made possible by this loan, Poni hopes to pay for the cost of her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to open up a bakery

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian sells baby supplies and cosmetics by selling her goods within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. Vivian is 36 years old and married with 3 children. Vivian hopes for a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more cosmetics and baby things to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Chucuito, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 78 años D. edad, estado civil viuda es madre D. 6 hijos todos ya mayores e independientes, no tiene estudios. vive en el Comunidad D. Chinchero Sector Nueva Alianza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que utilizó para la compra D. lanas para la elaboración D. artesanías en miniaturas.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para compra D. lana acrílica para la elaboración D. artesanías.  Ella también tiene un puesto D. venta D. condimentos.
 
Su mayor  deseo es continuar trabajando para solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan las facilidades D.  los préstamos que ofrece Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Cajas Reales” Village Bank located in the Chucuito district in the Puno province. She is a 78-year-old widow and mother of six children who are now grown and independent. For the past year she has worked with field partner Manuela Ramos and her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy wool for her miniature handicrafts. This time she requests a loan for 1500 nuevos soles to buy acrylic wool for her handicrafts. She also has a stand selling seasonings. Her greatest wish is to continue working to pay off family-related expenses. She likes the ease that the Manuela Ramos loans offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase wool

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget A. is 52 years old and is married with six children. She sells sarongs and drinks to make a living.

Bridget hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs and drinks to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia I. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 49-years old and unmarried. Sylvia owns and operates a livestock raising business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising chickens, ducks, and turkeys for sale. Sylvia has been doing this for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Sylvia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sylvia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Sylvia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Kiva partner Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Fish vending is the business activity of Mrs. Julieta C. of Baybay Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She is 42 years of age, married and blessed with five children. Her husband is a motorcycle driver.

With a little display stand for her fish in their barangay (district), Julieta was able to earn a monthly average income of not less than PHP 5,000. She started this fish vending business twenty years ago and her business is still running.

Julieta joined Paglaum MPC (PMPC) in August 2008. Now, she is applying for PHP 14,000 as her 4th loan to add to her capital in her existing business. She is thankful to PMPC because of the savings and education programs it provides to its members. Her only wish is more blessings to her family and business success.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is married with four children. She is 31 years old. She sells provisions and foodstuffs in her shop. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha M. G. de 61 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo en casa propia. Martha, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como cremas, shampoo y otros productos más, tiene 15 años de realizar la misma actividad y es a través de esta como ella ha logrado seguir adelante durante tantos años. Es por esto que ella desea que su negocio mejore, y esta es la razón por la cual ha solicitado un préstamo, ya que a través de este  podrá invertir en su negocio y mejorar su condición económica, ya que espera comprar más productos de mejor calidad para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de cosmétivos

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence sells drinks and groceries to make a living. She is 48 years old and married with ten children.

Florence hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ubaldo Miguel

texts.es: Don Ubaldo A. tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero de oficio Artesano,  “Elaboración de cortes típicos”, habita junto  con su familia, ella y su familia se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un  Taller, llevan 6 años en  Tejer   su residencia que se encuentra en el  Caserío Chotacaj de la  Aldea V., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Don Ubaldo A. is 26 years old and single. He and his family make traditional skirts. He has been weaving for 6 years out of a workshop in his home, located in the village of Chotacaj de la Aldea V. in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. The current demand from his customers has grown, but the economic conditions are not suitable for Don Ubaldo to raise more capital. For this reason, he has approached Asociación ASDIR for a loan. He will purchase raw materials so that he can increase his sales. He also hopes to move his family forward and improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making traditional skirts

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị (10117070012) is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội.  C. is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phúc Lộc 07 (3).


C. is married and has 2 adult children.  To make a living, C. operates a family member's business raising chickens for sale.  C. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.604.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby chicks to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND, which will be used to purchase more baby chicks to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the eighth loan taken out by C. from SEDA.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Bùi Thị L. (10117070016) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 5.886.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10117070013) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Nguyễn Thị Minh T. (10117070015) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 6.322.000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


C. Nguyễn Thị (10117070012) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phúc Lộc 07 (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2003, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.604.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Bùi Thị L. (10117070016) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.886.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10117070013) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị Minh T. (10117070015) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.322.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung T. hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase more baby chickens

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en: Noralyn, 29, enjoys spending her time working with her rice field. She is already married and has a child that is five years old. She helps provide for the needs of her family through rice farming, raising ducks, and a small "sari-sari" store that sells household staples, drinks, and snacks. She didn't have enough enough capital for her businesses so she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to get a loan. She has requested 13,000 Php to buy farm supplies, ducks, and pigs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a 39 year old married woman. Sh is the sole owner of a mini-hotel which deals specifically with food. This is Hellen’s only source of income and she started the business 3 years ago. She requires a loan of Kshs 25,000  to pay rent for her business premise, renovate it to meet her customers preferences, buy more kitchen utensils and restocked the food supplies for the business. According to Everlyne, the business will  pick up during the upcoming Christmas festive season.

loans.use: Pay rent for her business premise and restock food supplies.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel  vive en la zona Los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en anticrítico; tiene tres hijos y su esposa se dedica a la venta de pescado en las ferias.

Fidel es minero cooperativista; extrae oro de concesiones que se le otorga en diferentes zonas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

El crédito lo destinará para la compra una acción minera.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Fidel lives in the Los Andes area in the city of El Alto. He pays for his house with an anticrítico loan; he is married, has three children and sells fish at fair markets. Fidel is a cooperative miner; he extracts gold in several areas of concession he got permit for, around the city of La Paz. He will use the loan to buy mining stocks. This is his second loan with IMPRO; he received a positive evaluation in order to be granted another loan.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mining stocks to become a member of a mine cooperative.

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: Aby S. est âgée de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SIWAL depuis 2 ans. Son objectif est d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne et de participer à la prise en charge familiale à partir de ses bénéfices générés par son activité d'embouche bovine et ovine.
texts.en:
Aby S. is 34 years old. She is married and mother of five children. She has been a member of the ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group of SIWAL for two years. Her objective is to increase her savings and help support her family through income generated by her activity of fattening cattle and sheep.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Angélique

texts.fr: Angélique D. est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 11 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte Anne depuis 5 ans et a eu à bénéficier 10 fois de suite de crédit. Elle mène un petit commerce de jus de citron et de balais traditionnels. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Angélique D., 51, is married and the mother of 11 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sainte Anne for 5 years and has received 10 consecutive loans. She has a little business selling lemon juice and traditional brooms. She wants to contribute to the well-being of her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her personal working capital

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, T. Odile est mariée à AKISSOUHE David, un pêcheur. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis près de 8 ans à Lokokoukoumè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Odile n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Depuis environs 9 ans, Odile mène comme activité, la vente de chaussures, de façon ambulante. Parallèlement à cette activité, Odile vend également de la viande. Odile s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Odile est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de l'institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Odile sollicite un troisième crédit dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, ce qui lui permettra de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Odile T. is married to David AKISSOUHE, a fisherman. The couple has three children, all attending school. Odile has never attended school herself. The family has been living for the past eight years in Lokokoukoumé, in the Sèmè-Podji area. The couple shares family expenses. For the past 9 years, Odile has been an itinerant vendor of shoe wear. She also sells meat as a side business. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Odile is a former client of ALIDé, having already been granted two loans, which were duly repaid in full. She is now requesting a third loan, to bolster her business and increase her stock supply. This in turn will increase customer satisfaction.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Nidia Mariana

texts.es:
La Señora Nidia Mariana Hernández de una pulpería ubicada entrada san Antonio 1km al Norte Ponedora el cual empieza a laborar de 7am a 6pm y al mismo se dedica a preparar el alimento para su familia.  
También se dedica ala actividad de ganadería.
Este crédito que solicito es para ampliar mas su negocio y el plan de inversión es Compra de Producto de la canasta básica,  y golosinas, gaseosas.
Para mejorar el nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Nidia Mariana Hernández has a local store located at the San Antonio entrance 1km from North Ponedora. She works from 7am to 6pm and prepares the food for the family. She also raises livestock. This loan that she is asking for is to expand her business and the investment plan is to purchase basic food products, candy and fizzy drinks. This is to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic food products, candy, fizzy drinks

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean, at the young age of 18, cultivates a rice field to earn a living. She needs more farm materials to run her rice-farming business in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. As a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., she asked for a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos. This will be enough help to provide the supplies for her rice field.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Kimleng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimleng S. (shown in the photo), 48, and her husband, Mr. Thy Thorn, 47, have been married since 1991 and have four children: three sons and one daughter.  One of them is married and lives outside the family home and the other three children are in school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Kimleng has been fishing for fifteen years; while Mr. Thy Thorn has been driving a motor taxi for eight years. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to expand the house where she lives.

loans.use: To expand her house.

loans.name: Kosall's Group

texts.en: This group loan includes fourteen people located in Spean Dek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kosall Y. is 47 years old and is the village bank president of her group. Each member of group will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Kosall Y. and her husband, Mr. Khon Khann, are farmers who own a one-hectare field to cultivate vegetables. They do not have enough money to support their farm. Thus, Mrs. Kosall Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds and gasoline to support her farm. This couple has seven children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a farmer, one is a student in a local school and the others are between 2 and 5 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 61-year-old, married man. He lives with his wife and child. Both he and his child work to support the family. He has been selling vegetables from his truck to customers in his region since 1970. Lebanon is rich in its agricultural products and it is common to find vendors selling fresh fruits and vegetables throughout the country. This borrower is requesting a loan of $700 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to make much needed repairs to his work vehicle so that he can better serve his customers. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please follow this link

loans.use: to make repairs to his work vehicle

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es:
El Hernán R. es de profesión comerciante, está casado con la señora Feliciana Zorrilla con quien tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores y dos menores, todos están domiciliados en el Kilómetro 7 Barrio Ciudad Nueva de Ciudad del Este, los mismos se dedican a la compra y venta de ropas, más específicamente de lencerías y abrigos, lo realizan en la misma zona distribuyendo en su propio rodado y también lo realizan en el vecino país de Argentina.
Se iniciaron en la actividad con créditos que solicitaron a la Fundación Paraguaya demostrando puntualidad en todos sus pagos, se tratan de personas emprendedoras y con visión de crecimiento.
En esta ocasión solicitan el préstamo para la compra de maderas para tirantes que están necesitando para terminar la casa.
texts.en:
Hernán R. is a merchant. He is married to Mrs. Feliciana Zorrilla and they have four children together, two who are adults and two who are minors. They all live at Kilometer 7, Ciudad Nueva neighborhood in Ciudad del Este. They buy and sell clothing, specifically lingerie and coats. They do this in the same area, distributing nearby and in the neighboring country of Argentina. They began this activity with loans they applied for fron the Fundación Paraguaya and they have demonstrated punctuality with all of their payments. They are enterprising people with visions of growth. On this occasion, they are asking for the loan to purchase wood for strips they need to finish their house.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Buramba Twetungure, Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
With hard work and high self-esteem traits, N. Asia, aged 35 years, has tried beyond all means to maintain her general merchandise retail shop that she has been operating for twelve years in Bwegiragye trading centre.

This married mother of four has strained to get where she is today. In a month she earns profits totaling up to 400,000 shillings. Before she got fully operational in this business, she was running a goat-sales business.

At present, Asia is also operating a rentals business. On the basis of that, she is optimistic that her chances of future success are good. With this loan she is looking at purchasing more retail items such as salt, sugar and soap.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Bertrand

texts.fr:
Jeune homme de 29 ans,celibataire avec un enfant, a ouvert une cabine telephonique, apres sa licence d'economie n'ayant pas trouve des debouches sur le marche du travail, en 2006 il a ouvert un cabine telephonique et vend des cartes de recharges et des Sim , et fait des appels en moyenne de 35000 frs par jour.

Si le credit lui est octroye, il pense acheter des cartes de recharges de Zain, MTN, Warid et des Sim pour satisafaire les besoins de ces clients, et renforcer la connexion avec la compagnie Telecom pour utiliser aussi un abonnement fixe.
Sa strategie c'est d'acheter en gros,et vendre plus, ce dont les gens auront besoin et que l'on trouve tout sur place chez lui pour pallier a la concurrence.


Pour l'avenir il pense ouvrir plusieurs cabines dans les differents quartiers et trouver des gens qui vont travailler pour lui, il epargne aussi pour qu'a l'avenir il puisse s'acquerir un terrain pour construire pour sa famille et ameliorer les conditions de vies de sa famille
texts.en:
A young man, age 29, single with one child, opened a call center. After earning his economics degree, not finding opportunities in the job market, he opened a call center in 2006 and sells rechargable and Sim cards and earns an average of 35,000 frs from calls daily. If this loan is granted to him he plans to buy rechargable, Zain, MTN, Warid and Sim cards to satisfy the needs of his clients, and reinforce the connection with Telecom to use a fixed phone subscription. His strategy is to buy in bulk and sell more of what the people will need on location in order to compensate for the competition. For the future he plans to open several centers in different quarters and find people to work for him. He is also saving so that, in the future, he will be able to acquire a small plot of land to construct on in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Meghan Davignon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cards in bulk including rechargeable, Zain, MTN, Warid and SIM

loans.name: Savin's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savin C. is 45 years old and she is the leader of a group loan having been selected by its four members which located in Ampil Teouk village in Kandal province. With the loans, the members of this group will use it’s to support their different purpose. 
Mrs. Savin C. stays at home and taK. care her children while her husband is a mechanician in a garage, which is able to receive a small salary to support his family living. They own two motorbikes which the motorbikes do not have taxation. Thus, Mrs. Savin C. decided to ask for a loan to pay for motorcycle taxation. This couple has five children, one is furniture maker, one is a laborer and one is construction worker, and one is a student in the local school while another one is 4 years old.

loans.use: To pay for motorcycle taxation

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 42 years old and married with three children.  She has been operating a retail shop where she sells tea leaves, sugar, bread, cereals and sweets.  She has been in the business for 10 years.  She also does farming to earn extra income.  She has requested 40,000 KES to buy sugar, soda, bread and salt.  She hopes to improve her business for better income.  She wants to be in a position to educate her children to a higher education level in the future.  She wants to have a wholesale shop in 10 years.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soda, bread and salt

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María de 27 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene un pequeño salón de belleza, es madre soltera con un hijo de 6 años. 

Hace tres años comenzó a trabajar haciendo cortes de cabello, tinturados, a domicilio. Cuando ya obtuvo ingresos para abrir su propio salón de belleza comenzó a comprar de poco a poco las mesas, sillas y los productos de belleza. Ahora tiene un pequeño salón de belleza, trabaja todos los días sola. 

Para poder dar mas comodidad a sus clientes ella quiere comprar con el préstamo mesas, tintes y esmaltes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir el salón de belleza.
texts.en:
María is 27 years old and lives in an urban zone in the Guayaquil suburb. She has a small beauty salon and is a single mother with a 6 year old son. She began working 3 years ago cutting hair and doing dyes in people's homes. When she obtained enough earnings to open her own salon she began little by little to buy tables, chairs and beauty products. She now has a small beauty salon where she works alone every day. To give greater comfort to her customers with this loan María wants to buy tables, hair dyes and nail polish. In the future she wants to finish building her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tables, hair dyes and nail polish

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick A. is 46 years old, single and has three children between 20 and 8 years old. His business is located in a busy market in Kakamega. He has been selling cereals like maize, beans and groundnuts. In the same shop, he sells baskets and fruit. He has been doing this business for 10 years and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are other people in the area doing the same kind of business as his, so customers are not loyal as they are spoiled with choice. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more maize, beans and groundnuts to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and become a wholesaler. He describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, and ground nuts.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo.
Nancy es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Nancy tiene una tienda en local alquilado ubicado cerca del mercado central de la ciudad en donde vende abarrotes al por mayor y menor, negocio que inicio hace 1 año y le esta yendo bien, además Nancy junto a su esposo tienen una tienda de agroquímicos en un local alquilado, también Nancy en su tiempo libre vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Nancy solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de panetones. 
Los sueños de Nancy son terminar sus estudios de contabilidad y tener casa propia porque ahora vive en la casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the communal bank Cielo (sky). Nancy lives with her partner and has two children. She rents a locale for her store near the central market in the city where she sells groceries in bulk and retail, it is a business she started a year ago and it's going good for her. Her and her husband also rent a store where they sell agricultural chemicals and Nancy also sells cosmetics through catalogue on her spare time. Nancy is requesting a loan for 1000 soles to purchase pastries / cakes. Nacy dreams of finishing her schooling in accounting and owning her own home because she currently lives with her in-laws.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase pastries / cakes

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda P. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling daily use products such as noodles, eggs, snack foods and others in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $190 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hilda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. 

Hilda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Doem

texts.en:
Doem S. is 47 years of age and married. In order to meet her family's needs, Doem S. sells a little grocery inventory in Phnom Penh. She has twenty years' experience in this sector and earns approximately $3 per day. To help contribute to her family, her husband works as a chief of construction workers in the city.
The couple have been married for years and have six children– four of whom are single. Doem S. says that one of her children is to get married soon, but her savings are insufficient to prepare for the wedding. To solve this problem, Doem S. has requested a loan of $800 to be used to prepare for her child's wedding.

loans.use: To prepare for her child's wedding

loans.name: Duvon De Fatima

texts.es:
Duvon Jiménez R. es una persona emprendedora quien tiene su negocio en el mercado Israel Lewite de venta de Jugos, gaseosas, golosinas y galletas, ella trabaja junto con uno de sus hijos quien se encarga de vender arriba de los buses. Ella es una persona sencilla y con buenos principios morales.
Es madre de familia de  siete  hijos y solo dos  dependen de ella y estos se encuentran en el colegio.
El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.
Duvon Jiménez ha trabajado 20 préstamos con la institución y estos han sido para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Duvon Jiménez R. is a very enterprising person who has a business in the Israel Lewite market selling juice, soda, sweets and cookies.  She works together with one of her children who is in charge of making sales on buses.  She is a very humble person with good moral principles.

She is mother to seven children.  Only two of her children still depend on her and they are in school.  The loan which she requesting will be used for buying merchandise for her business.  Duvon Jiménez has had 20 loans from our organization which were all for buying merchandise for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of soda, juice, cookies, Kola Shaler and candies

loans.name: Isaac Wamai

texts.en:
Isaac Wamai is 36 years old and married to Irene Wangui. They have 3 children and his wife helps in selling at their retail shop where they sell things like detergents, sweets, cooking fat and bread. He has been in the retail shop business for 9 years and with an income of 16,000 KES a month.

He is taking his first loan with KADET to buy 15 bags of maize from farmers to grind into flour and later resell as flour and this will be his secondary business. 

In future he hopes to settle on his own farm and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: purchase of 15 bags of  maize

loans.name: Josefa Johanna

texts.es:
Josefa Johanna Munoz T. tiene 27 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Susana  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Josefa Johanna M. T. is 27 years old. She has a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province. She has three children.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group are located in the Marañon area, in the Puerto Pechiche parish which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This rural cooperative works in short cycle farming planting corn, rice, and beans.

Susana has worked growing corn, rice and beans especially for the past three years. She buys her products in Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The loan support will help her financially to meet her needs. She faces challenges such as pests, diseases, and the change in climate. Her dream is to buy a car.

She likes to play sports.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Nelly Waithira

texts.en:
For the last year, Nelly has been selling ice cream in the town of Niavasha. She is 42 years old married to Peter Muya. They are blessed with two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a deep freezer and increase her ice cream stock in order to serve the ever-increasing customers.

In the future, Nelly aspires to open a chain of ice cream selling businesses in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer and increase her ice cream stock .

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He cooperates with his parents to gather a good income for the family. He worked as an electrician who specialized in electronics projects for five years and decided to work as a freelance electrician in 2008. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a Rapid car, which will helps him in his transportation and facilitates his work especially since he works in different places and areas. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming year. He feels positive about his future work and looks forward to taking on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a Rapid car

loans.name: Sumbersari Permai Group

texts.en: Sumbersari Permai is located in Melaya, Bali, where most people work as farmers. The group was formed after they got information from a neighboring village who had already formed groups of pig farmers. The group is chaired by Ni Kadek J. and has 10 members. Ni Kadek J. is married and has one child, age 6. To support the family, Ni Kadek runs a pig farming business. Currently, she is raising two pigs. The loan she got was used to buy a pig and feed. She hopes that with the extra pig, she will make more profit.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio  A. es vecino  de  la Trinchera de Pital en Alajuela ,es conocido por ser una persona muy emprendedora.
Desde hace varios años decidió establecer su propio negocio, un taller de mecánico.
 Su negocio ha sido un éxito, sin embargo ya ni sus herramientas ni el espacio de su taller son suficientes para satisfacer la demanda de trabajo que tiene en este momento.
Es por eso que el necesita un préstamo de ₡300 000 (trescientos mil colones) para la compra de mas herramientas para su taller. Con el fin de brindarle un mejor servicio a sus  clientes.
El es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Sergio A. lives in the same neighborhood as Trinchera de Pital in Alajuela. He is known to be a very enterprising person. 

Several years ago he decided to set up his own business - a repair shop.

His business has been a success and even though he doesn't have the tools or the space that he needs, his shop has been enough to satisfy the demand he currently observes.

He requests a loan of 300 000 (three hundred thousand colones) to purchase more tools for his shop, with the goal of providing his clients with better service. He is a member of the communal bank named Mujeres al Exito de la Trinchera de Pital, one of the 100 member organizations of Edesa (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To purchase industrial tools.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a married woman who lives in Mabinay, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  livestock buy and sell and food vending. Her husband Judie, who is 35 years old, works as a baker to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have no children. Jovelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jovelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her business activities to save up for future business expansion and financial security for herself and her husband. Jovelyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Sophia Esi

texts.en:
Sophia Esi M. is from Kokowada, near Elmina.  She sells corn for a living and has been in this trade for four years. She has completed her junior high school education. M. is married to a farmer and they have five children. Her income helps pay for their children’s school fees and some utility bills. 

M. wishes to grow her business and improve her earnings. This loan will allow her to purchase more corn to boost her sales. She plans to reinvest some of the profits back into her business and set aside the rest for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase corn to sell

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Elvis; el tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganado como vacas, corderos entre otros el socio se dedica a esta actividad ya varios años atrás, él trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa con la crianza de estos animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes, el socio es una persona bien alegre y responsable ya que mediante esta actividad el saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de alimentos para la crianza de estos animales.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Elvis is a member of the "“SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA” ("LORD OF THE MIRACLES OF CHIMPAHUAYLLA") communal bank, located in the district of San Jeronimo in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Elvis is 31 years old. He's married with 2 children. As well as his day to daily activities, he runs a livestock trading business, buying and selling cows, sheep and more. He has been working in this field for a number of years. His wife helps him raise the animals, which he then sells to his customers. Elvis is a cheerful and responsible individual and thanks to this business he manages to support his family. 

He is requesting a loan to buy feed to raise his animals with. He is very grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it as agreed.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. She is 20 years old, married to a businessman, and has 5 children; only 2 of them go to school. Charity took a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Karima

texts.en:
Karima is a 53-year-old married woman living in Dahieh with her husband. She doesn't have children, which forces her to work hard and fill her free time with something productive. She started working 31 years ago. She works hard to save as much as she can for her and her husband's old age secure living since, as she mentioned, they have no children to take care of them when they grow older and reach a level where they can't work anymore.

Karima is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to improve her tailoring business by purchasing new thread colors and good quality needles. The loan will also help support her other small businesses, selling foodstuff and detergents. She's willing to increase their capital so that they will increase her income. 

She is a woman with a good reputation, loved by her customers and neighbors. She hopes to expand her business more and to ask for employees to help her.

loans.use: to buy necessary threads and needles for her tailoring business, and to support her foodstuff business and detergents trade

loans.name: Henry Manuel

texts.es:
Henry Manuel S. de 29 años vive en el barrio 7 de Abril de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y su hijo de 7 años; desde que llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla procedente del municipio de Concordia en el departamento del Magdalena, contrajo matrimonio y tuvo un hijo, decidió generar ingresos con lo que él conocía muy bien,  y es que Henry prepara dos deliciosos productos costeños: quesos y suero, producido con la leche que le envían sus padres de  su tierra natal y que  le sirve como materia prima para la fabricación de sus productos estrellas.
Este es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará leche en el municipio de Concordia  y con ella elaborar el queso y el suero que tanto gusta a sus clientes, y que lo tiene como su negocio principal  desde el año 2002, el cual  empezó por distribuirlo de tienda en tienda  y que agregando su buen manejo,  el negocio ha crecido y hoy atiende no solo tiendas sino restaurantes y panaderías donde también se lo compran.  Henry es un gran trabajador  él recibe ingresos adicionales por trabajar en un negocio de comidas rápidas que él mismo  elabora y tiene 5 años de trabajar;  con sus ingresos   ha impulsado en unión de su cónyuge a su familia, porque su sueño es que su hijo se convierta en un profesional exitoso. Su desafío mayor se produce,  cuando hay sequía y la producción se disminuye. Henry trabaja persistentemente y  mientras cosecha sus éxitos,  obtiene en su negocio una rentabilidad  sobre las ventas no menor de un 22% , rota sus cuentas por cobrar cada 5 días, así como también sus inventarios en este mismo tiempo.
texts.en:
Henry Manuel S., age 29, lives in the "7 de Abril" neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla, with his wife and son, age 7.  He arrived in Barranquilla from the town of Concordia in the department of Magdalena, got married and had a son.  He decided to earn an income doing what he knew best which was preparing delicious coastal products such as cheese and whey made from milk that his parents sent him from his home town.  He now uses that milk as raw material for his main products.

This is his first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and he will use it to buy milk from Concordia to make the cheese and whey that his customers like so much.  This has been his main business since 2002 when he began distributing his products to stores.  He did so well that business increased and now he not only sells to stores but also to restaurants and bakeries.

Henry is a hard worker and makes an additional income working in a fast food restaurant where he has been for five years.  With his earnings he has been able to strengthen his family ties because his dream is to help his son become a successful professional.  His biggest challenge is getting through droughts which decreases production.  Henry works constantly even though he is earns a good profit of 22% over sales with a turnover of 5 days in both accounts receivable and inventory.

loans.use: To buy milk for cheese making

loans.name: Salvadora Cristina

texts.es: Salvadora es una madre de familia de 56 años de edad. Vive con su esposo en el barrio Jass. Ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de costura,  hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio. Ella inicio con el objetivo de tener un ingreso propio y mantener a su familia, ya que ella también queria contribuir a su hogar pues su esposo trabaja de albañil. Salvadora desea adquirir este crédito para la compra de hilos, tijeras, zipper, agujas, telas, entre otros productos para la elaboración de sus prendas de vestir. Ella es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Salvadora is a 56-year-old mother. She lives with her husband in the Jass neighborhood. For more than 15 years she has had a business providing sewing services. She began with the objective of having her own income and helping to maintain her family, since she wanted to also contribute to her home. Her husband works as a mason.

Salvadora wants to get this loan to buy thread, scissors, zippers, needles, fabric and other products needed to make her garments. She is a very hard-working woman. Her greatest dream is to continue growing as a businesswoman to be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy threads, scissors, zippers, needles, fabric and other products needed to make garments.

loans.name: Las Crisalias Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LAS CRISALIAS" se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México, las clientas decidieron llevar este nombre ya que a pesar de que ninguna se dedica al cultivo de esta es la principal atracción de la comunidad. Este grupo está integrado por 10 clientas en este grupo se encuentra la señora Alberta quien es integrante del grupo y se dedica a la venta y cultivo de aguacate desde hace más de 25 años, tiene 60 años de edad, soltera, y es el sustento de su familia. Tiene 3 hijos mayores de adad, la señora nos platica que para ella fue un golpe muy duro el abandono de su esposo y el hecho de la gran responsabilidad de sus hijos, ya que dos de ellos aun eran menores de edad, ella decidió contribuir aun mas con la economía de su casa buscando una fuente de trabajo más estable y continuar en la siembra y venta de aguacate con apoyo de su hijo mayor, vende aguacates en diferentes partes de la región y así poder darles una mejor calidad de vida. El prestamo lo invertirá en fertilizantes, abonos y plantas para seguir trabajando al lado de sus hijos, la ilusión que tiene doña Alberta es que sus hijos se formen como hombres de bien y algún día puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, a pesar que la señora solo cuenta con la educación primaria le gustaría que sus hijos sean profesionistas.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Crisalias” (The Asters) and is located in the State of Mexico. These clients decided to take this name even though none of them grow these flowers, but they are a main attraction in the community. The group consists of 10 clients. One of the members is Sra. Alberta, who has been growing and selling avocados for more than 25 years. She is 60 years old, single, and the breadwinner of her family. Alberta has three adult children. She says that it was a very difficult situation when her husband abandoned her and she had to take responsibility for her children, two of whom were minors at the time. Even though she decided to contribute more to the household income, she tried to find a more stable source of work. Alberta continued to grow and sells avocados with the help of her oldest son. She sells her product in different parts of the region and is able to provide her family a better quality of life.

This loan will be invested in fertilizers, compost, and plants so that she can continue working alongside her children. Doña Alberta hopes that her sons will become outstanding men who will someday have a better quality of life. Even though she only has an elementary school education, Alberta would like her sons to become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase avocado plants, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un, a 46-year-old widowed tailor, lives in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has two daughters, one a garment factory worker and the other a teacher.  Un is requesting her first loan of $1,200  to complete the building of her new house.

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique é maê de 1 fillho menor de 3 anos que ainda não vai a Escola. Frequenta 11ª classe e nunca parou de estudar excepto quando ficou gravida. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Boane com os seus pais e mais tarde criou o seu proprio lar. Trabalha no Ministerio da Educação como docente ha mais de 6 anos e tem um salario de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM) porque conta com ajuda do seu marido.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de colegas que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo no valor de 18.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 11.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt e 16.500.00mt aplicados na habitação e bens.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem problemas e vai solicitar novos emprestimos para aplicar na conclusaõ da sua casa e oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia.
texts.en:
Sonia was born in Maputo city, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She has one son who is younger than three years old and does not yet go to school. Sonia attends 11th grade and has never stopped studying except for when she became pregnant. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left Maputo city to come to Boane with her parents, and later she established her own residence. She has worked as a teacher for the Ministry of Education for more than six years and has a salary of 4,500 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM) because she relies on her husband's help.

Sonia has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also customers of this institution. This is her fifth loan, and she is asking for 18,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand and other items) in order to continue construction on her house. The previous loans were for 10,000 meticais, 11,000 meticais, 15,000 meticais and 16,500 meticais, and were used for housing and property.

Sonia is confident that she will pay off the loan without problems, and she will ask for more loans to finish her house and make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 39 years old, is married to Mary, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children, ages 13 and 10 years.  Joel has been a shoe maker for the past 20 years, with the monthly income of KES 11,000 which he uses to support his family members. 

He was introduced to KADET by an existing KADET customer and as applied for his 1st loan.   Joel will use the loan to add stock of shoe making materials to his business.  With the anticipated profit from the business, he will open a retail shop. 

He hopes to open a wholesale shoe shop in future, which will help educate his children and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To add stock of shoe making materials

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Imelda's husband is a tricycle driver.

Imelda is managing a general store. She has invested all of her loans in maintaining her general store and has managed to keep it running with a great deal of commitment on her part. 

With this new loan of 8,000 PHP, Imelda will buy a variety of products that she can display in her store, such as soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, crackers and cookies. This will enable her to have a better store and more products to sell to her customers who come to her store every day to buy from her. 

She is grateful to ASKI for the loans they have given her before and she is hoping her new loan is approved.

loans.use: to buy soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, crackers and cookies to sell

loans.name: Yarendy Lourdes

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Yarendy, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, actualmente está en el sexto mes de embarazo de su primer hijo. El marido trabaja en Manta.

Nuestra amiga se dedica a la cría de pollos para lo cual tiene una pequeña granja en sus casa. Además de esto ella en sociedad con su papá se dedican a la compra y venta de tamarindo, ellos compran este delicioso fruto directo de los arboles, recogen el producto para luego pelarlo, cocinarlo y entregarlo a tiendas de la localidad o venderlo directamente a los clientes. En cuanto a los pollos los alimenta durante un tiempo adecuado y luego los entrega a comerciantes en Rocafuerte.

Este crédito es para comprar tamarindo y alimento para pollos. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un bebé sano.
texts.en:
The members of the La Union Hace Fuerza meet every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton. This place is known for its delicious sweets made by the locals. They are known throughout the country.

Here Yarendy lives. She is 28 years old and is in a common long marriage. She is six months pregnant with her first child. Her husband works in Manta.   

Our friend raises chickens and has a small barn at her house. In addition she has a business with her father buying and selling tamarinds. They buy this delicious fruit directly from the trees, pick up the product and peel it, cook it and deliver it to stores in the area, or sell directly to customers. The chickens she feeds for a long enough time and then delivers to merchants in Rocafuerte.

This loan is to buy tamarind and feed for the chickens. This her second cycle with the community bank and she likes it because of the ease of taking out loans.
 
Her dream is to have a healthy baby.

loans.use: to buy tamarinds and feed for chickens.

loans.name: Nuevo Camino Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Nuevo Camino” lo conforman 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran peluquería, artesanía en greda, venta de ropa, artesanía en lana, venta de verduras, venta de ropa interior, de perfumes, venta de carbón, criadero de chanchos, preparación y venta de comida rápida. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán. 
Carolina integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo del grupo al lado derecho en primer lugar, ella usa anteojos y viste un sweater color plomo, se dedica al comercio específicamente venta de ropa nueva de temporada. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace un año. Comenta que le ha ido muy bien.
Su mercadería la compra en el barrio Patronato en la ciudad de Santiago, lugar conveniente económicamente en la compra de mercadería para comerciantes.
Carolina vende puerta a puerta, cobra y deja mercadería también.
Con el crédito comprará ropa de temporada primavera verano para niños y adultos, además ropa de casa (artículos de cocina).  
Sus metas son seguir trabajando, de manera de generar mayores ganancias, su motivación es ahorrar para postular al subsidio habitacional. 
Carolina vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad. Sus sueños son poder costear los estudios profesionales de sus hijos, especialmente de su hija mayor.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios obtenidos por Fondo Esperanza, ya que la ayuda le ha permitido invertir en su negocio y que éste prospere. Las capacitaciones también le han servido para administrar la contabilidad de su negocio. Con los demás emprendedores tiene una buena relación, ya que se conocen y son comprometidos. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “Nuevo Camino” (New Road) and consists of 17 entrepreneurs. They engage in different business activities such as managing a beauty parlor, making works of clay, selling clothes, making crafts out of wool, selling vegetables, selling undergarments, selling perfumes, selling charcoal, raising pigs, and preparing and selling fast food. All of the members are from the city of Chillán.

Carolina is a member of the Communal Bank. In the photograph, she is seated on the first row, wearing glasses and a dark-colored sweater. Carolina is a merchant who specifically sells new seasonal clothing. She has been in this business for one year and has done very well. Her merchandise is purchased in the neighborhood of Patronato in the city of Santiago, a convenient place where merchants can buy their inventory. Carolina sells door-to-door, delivering merchandise and collecting payments. With this loan, she will buy spring and summer clothing for children and adults, as well as kitchen linens. Her goals include continuing to work so that she can generate higher profits. She is motivated to save so that she can apply for a housing subsidy. Carolina lives with her husband and two children, ages 16 and 10. Her dream is to be able to afford the cost of her children’s professional studies, especially those of her older daughter.

Carolina is very pleased with and grateful for the services offered by Fondo Esperanza. The support has allowed her to invest in her business and prosper. The training seminars have also helped her manage the cash flow of her business. She has a good relationship with the other members because they know one another and are committed.

Chillán is a community in south-central Chile. Its name means “Seat of the Sun” in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuche people. Chillán is also known as “The Cradle of the Nation” and “Land of Artists” because many leading figures in Chilean history were born here, such as the famous pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy spring and summer clothing for children and adults, as well as kitchen linens.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 56 years old and a married woman with two children. She is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Susana plants rice crops and vegetables. She sells her harvest at the market. Susan also sells dried fish to her neighborhood.

Susana is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She is hoping this loan will help to improve her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ulises Edgardo

texts.es:
Ulises, es agricultor, vive con su esposa, son una joven pareja, ella se encuentra embarazada, él realiza los cultivos de siembra de maíz, realizando la milpa en terrenos alquilados, en ocasiones trabaja como jornalero, para poder ganar dinero para la alimentación del hogar.
Él necesita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, abono, pago de mano de obra y pago de transporte, con este apoyo espera solventar las necesidades, ya que su proyección es sembrar una manzana de terreno.
Los sueños de Ulises es en el futuro tener su propia casa, procrear hijos con su esposa y mejorar los cultivos y cosechas de maíz.
texts.en:
Ulises is a farmer, living with his wife.  They are a young couple, and she is pregnant.  He grows corn on land he leases, and at times works as a day laborer, in order to earn money for food for the home.
He needs a loan to purchase farming supplies, fertilizer, pay for labor and transportation.  With this support, he hopes to cover basic needs, as his plan is to have crops on a block of land.
Ulises’s dream for the future is to have his own home, raise children with his wife, and improve corn harvests and crops.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, age 50, runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and it has helped to raise her family's standard of living. Before this, the family suffered the worst possible hardship: the death of Lourdes's husband, who was the breadwinner for the family. Lourdes now shoulders the responsibility to support herself and her children through her business.

Driven primarily by the determination not to restore their past suffering, Lourdes is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 to buy additional grocery items to sell, such as canned goods, candies, instant noodles, and soft drinks. She is confident that this will provide a higher income in order to improve their living conditions.

Even with the head of the household now gone, Lourdes intends to lift her family from poverty through sacrifice and hard work.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell, such as canned goods, candies, instant noodles, and soft drinks

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Pedro José es casado, tiene a su cargo dos persona es luchadora, responsable, con buenos valores y principios  morales,  se desempeña como ayudante fontanero desde hace ocho año. 

A esta oficina de ceprodel se presento  a solicitar crédito que será utilizado para comprar materiales de construcción tales como cemento,  remodelación de su vivienda, en hacer muro,  para darle más seguridad  a su familia y agradece a ceprodel la oportunidad con este desembolso compra materiales de construcción tales como bloque, hierro, cemento, arena.
texts.en:
Pedro Jose is from the city of Managua.  He is married and has 2 dependents.  He is a tenacious and responsible person with good values and moral principles, who has worked as an assistant plumber for 8 years.

He came to CEPRODEL to request a loan that will be used to buy construction materials such as cement to renovate his home by building a wall.  This will provide more security for his family.  He is grateful to CEPRODEL for this opportunity.  With the proceeds of this loan he will buy construction materials such as: cement blocks, iron, cement and sand.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Confianza En Dios 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Mireya es una madre dedicada, tiene 2 hijos que viven con ella y su esposo (también el padre de ambos), ella se ha esforzado realizando diferentes trabajos para ayudar a su esposo con las necesidades de su hogar y poder llevar ingresos extra, quiere lograr unos de sus retos mas difíciles, el cual es tener una casa propia. 

Mireya es una de los miembros del Grupo Confianza en Dios 1, 2 & 3 y está ubicado en la ciudad turística de La Romana, en unas de las comunidades de más escasos recursos, rodeadas por campos de Caña de azúcar también llamados Batey, donde la mayoría de los habitantes son inmigrantes haitianos, que vinieron a la República Dominicana, con la finalidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
