Mireya esta muy emocionada por recibir su primer préstamo con Esperanza Internacional, y lo invertirá en la compra de diferentes tipos de ropas, para hombres y mujeres, también desea invertir en la compra de pescado, el cual vende frito. Ella lleva varios años dedicada a la venta de ropas, y con este préstamo tiene los planes de hacer crecer su negocio y llevarlo a otro nivel, para así utilizar sus ganancias para realizar cambios en su vida, ahorrar, comprar su casa, ayudar mas a su familia.
texts.en:
Mireya is a dedicated mother who has two children who live with her and her husband (the children's father).  She has done different jobs to help her husband with the household necessities and bring in extra income.  She wants to accomplish one of her most difficult goals, to have her own home.  

Mireya is one of the members of the Confianza en Dios 1, 2, & 3 group, which is located in the resort city of La Romana, in one of the communities without many resources.  It is surrounded by sugarcane fields, also called Batey.  A majority of the inhabitants are Haitian immigrants who came to the Dominican Republic to improve their quality of life.

Mireya is very excited to receive her first loan with Esperanza International.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of different types of clothing for women and men.  She also wants to purchase fish, which she will sell fried.  She has worked selling clothing for many years, and with this loan, she plans to grow her business and bring it to another level.  She can then use her earnings to make changes in her life, including saving money, purchasing a house, and helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and fish.

loans.name: Delia Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Delia Filomena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 52 años quien tiene una pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio hace 20 años con un proyecto la cual se la instalo con todo y ella fue pagando poco a poco en un periodo de tres años. Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en granos básicos (azúcar, aceite, arroz, frijoles…etc.)
texts.en: Señora Delia Filomena is a hard-working, enterprising woman.  She is 52 years old and has a small grocery store.  She started this business 20 years ago as a project that she set up all on her own.  She paid slowly over a 3 year period.  She is married and has 3 children who are now adults.  She will use the loan to buy staple foods (sugar, oil, rice, beans....etc.).

loans.use: buy staple foods (sugar, oil, rice, beans....etc.).

loans.name: Peter Maina

texts.en:
Peter is a 43-year-old married father of three children ranging in age from 10 years to 21 years. Describing himself as determined, Peter has operated a  business providing transport services to the people of Nakuru for the past six years.  High fuel prices and harrassment by the traffic police are his biggest business challenges.

Peter has requested a Kes 50,000 loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle. His business goal is to buy a 29-seat mini bus within five years, and he hopes to be able to pay school fees for  his college-going daughters in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: 03 Tây Sơn 3 Phú Sơn 2 Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Quỳnh has a service business cutting hair. She is requesting a loan to maintain her hair cutting shop.

Quỳnh is 29 years old and she is married. She has 2 children.
She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 03 Tây Sơn 3 Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group. 
Quỳnh lives with her 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Quỳnh first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Quỳnh has been involved in this business for 4 years.
The main harship that Quỳnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Quỳnh hopes to build a new house, to buy a motorbike, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to maintain her hair cutting shop.

loans.name: Mbeneka

texts.en:
Mbeneka is a 52-year-old married woman; she has five children and they live in Kaskeu, in the outskirts of Emali.  She sells groceries in the same area and has been doing so for fifteen years now; she earns a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Mbeneka's seventh loan with KADET LTD; she plans to buy vegetables, tomatoes and onions to sell and to also use part of the money to plough her land. In the future, she wants to be financially stable and to be able to feed and clothe her family.

loans.use: to add stocks of vegetables and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 75 years old, married, and has eight children. She lives in Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Remedios has a fish selling business and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. 

Remedios is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fish to sell. Remedios has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, she hopes to have a fishing boat to earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Seyeir

texts.en: Seyeir, 24, is married and resides with her husband, two children and her parents in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are garment workers in Phnom Penh city. Seyeir requests a loan of USD 800 to buy groceries to resell when she stops working at the factory. In the future, she would like to run  a store in the super market, build a new house, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell.

loans.name: Goodman

texts.en:
Goodman is a 53-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been a carpenter for 13 years: he started with capital of 800,000 UGX and now has stock of around 4,000,000 UGX. 

His major hardships are price fluctuations, high fuel and transportation costs, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a vision of expanding his business into new areas and diversifying. The purpose of the loan is to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.use: to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 31 years old and single. He has been buying and selling cows and goats for the three years earning a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

Jonah is requesting his first loan from KADET for 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase goats and cows to sell. With the anticipated profits he will expand his business. His dream is to diversify into farming and grow his livestock sales business.

loans.use: to purchase cows and goats to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi extracts palm oil and palm kernel oil to sell at Asafora near Cape Coast.  She is married.  Esi uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. Esi will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit and palm kernel to extract oil to sell. With the new profit she wishes to buy a machine for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit and palm kernel to extract oil to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Benkadi 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Sirakele, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec Tenin, 2 eme debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants, de petits matériels agricoles et  de semence

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan wants to buy half-bale of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock for his retail business

loans.name: Radil

texts.en: Radil was born in 1988 in Salyan region, Yenikand village, and is single. Three years ago this young man decided to start his own business. He wants to help his parents cover family expenses, and is applying for a loan of $400 to buy 2 calves to improve his cattle-breeding.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa Elena lives in García, Nuevo León. She is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband's salary is insufficient to meet the cost of raising and educating the children so Rosa helps by selling cosmetics, linens, shoes and food. She would like to see her business expand and is asking for a loan of $650 to buy the merchandise she needs to satisfy customer demand. She will repay the loan within 6 months. Rosa appreciates your help in growing this business and improving her family's quality of life.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

En la localidad de García, Nuevo León vive Rosa Elena ella siempre se ha dedicado a las ventas, los productos que comercializa son cosméticos, blancos, zapatos y comidas. Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos que se están estudiando, el salario que recibe su esposo es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia razón por la que Rosa inició su negocio. El gusto por las ventas y el deseo de que sus hijos puedan tener una educación de calidad ha hecho que este negocio prospere.

Rosa tiene el deseo de mejorar su negocio y continuar creciendo, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía con la que podrá surtir los pedidos que tiene, para ofrecer un buen servicio y continuar con la preferencia de sus clientes, ella devolverá esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Amelia Domingos

texts.pt:
Amelia is married, and mother of 2children. She joined the Program for the Development of Women in 2006. She initially borrowed 125$. Since her business benefited from the loan and prospered, she decided to request more loans in order to increase her stock to keep up with growing demand. Amelia sells her merchandize at her stand in the market of the Limpopo city.

She is a reliable borrower since she has repaid her previous loans on time. Since her business has been thriving, Amelia noticed improvements in her life. She is now able to help her husband with the home expenses. In the future she plans on continuing her accounting studies which she had to abandon when she had her first child. In addition she is able to provide a more balanced diet for her family. Amelia hopes that all continues well so she can buy a home and move from her in-laws.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Amelia é casada e tem 2 filhos. Entrou para o Programa do Fundo de Desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2006, tendo tomado um empréstimo no valor de $125. Porque o negócio dela prosperava foi tomando mais empréstimos, para poder responder a demandada. Neste preciso momento ela quer tomar um terceiro emprestimo, para poder aumentar o numero de fardos de roupa dada a crescente demanda, justificada pelo numero de clientes que diariamente visitam a sua banca. Ela desenvolve as suas actividades num dos mercados da cidade chamado Limpopo.

Ela é uma boa cliente, pois que sempre pagou pontualmente a sua dívida, Pelo facto de o seu negócio estar a crescer, notam-se mudanças positivas na sua vida. Ela já consegue apoiar o marido nas despesas caseiras. e no futuro pensa dar continuidade aos seus estudos terminando o curso de Contabilidade, que o interrompera no nível básico por falta de condições financeiras para o fazer. Isto porque estava no começo de sua vida de casada e a chegada repentina do primeiro filho. Por outro lado já consegue assegurar uma dieta equilibrada para a sua família o que contribui para um crescimento harmonioso e saudável para os seus filhos. Se tudo continuar a correr bem como tem sido até então pensa futuramente em ter sua própria casa, pois que de momento vive em casa dos sogros.

loans.use: Amelia precisa do emprestimo para a compra de mais fardos de roupa para a venda, pois que a procura aumentou devido ao numero de clientes que visitam a sua banca.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria E. is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Asaba town in Delta State. She is married and has four children. She has been with LAPO for seven years and has been in business since 1996. She is requesting a loan of $625 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu (her brother is pictured) was born in 1979 and lives in Khaladj village, in the Salyan region.

She is single and has run this business for five years. She requests a loan of $1,200 to buy foodstuffs for increasing the number of her clients.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Mercedes Rocio's Group

texts.es:
Angelica is 36 years old and has 2 children, Mercedes is 24 years old and has a child, whereas Ana is 35 years old and has 4 children. They have belonged to the Communal Bank Alegria Huamanga (Huamanga Joy) for 3, 2, and 1 year respectively. They say that in their communal bank they learned about responsibility, how to prevent illnesses, sharing, how to relate to their partners, and leadership. They mention that in their communal bank they are very united and supportive of each other.

Angelica has had a seamstress' shop for 5 years. She also works on carpentry. On her part, Mercedes, together with her husband, owned a Marisqueria (selling prepared shellfish and fish), business which she started 7 years ago, with lots of troubles. Currently, her business has grown and she wants to open more branches and other businesses. Meanwhile, Ana is a professional nurse working as a nutritional consultant and selling natural products Omnilife.

Angelica, Mercedes and Ana need loans for 600 soles, 400 soles, and 600 soles respectively, which will be invested in buying tablecloths, flatware, natural products, and buying a circular machine.

They will use their savings to build a house and increase their business' capital. The dreams of Angelica, Mercedes and Ana are to keep getting preparation, that their children grow to be professionals, having all comforts, own a house, and to expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Angélica tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Mercedes tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, mientras Ana tiene 35 años y 4 hijos y ellas pertenecen al Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga desde hace 3, 2, y 1 año respectivamente. Ellas dicen que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron la responsabilidad, a prevenir enfermedades, a compartir, cómo relacionarse con su pareja y el liderazgo. Ellas mencionan que en su Banco Comunal son bien unidas y solidarias. Angélica tiene su taller de confección de prendas de vestir, actividad que realiza en su casa desde hace 5 años, y además Angélica junto a su esposo tienen una carpintería. Por otro lado Mercedes junto a su esposo tienen una Marisquería (venta de comida preparada de mariscos y pescado), negocio que inició hace 7 años y tuvieron muchos problemas económicos. En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido y su deseo es tener sucursales y otros negocios más. Mientras que Ana es enfermera de profesión, hace consejería de nutrición y vende productos naturales Omnilife. Angélica, Mercedes y Ana necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles y 600 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra de manteles, cubiertos, vajilla, productos naturales y para la compra de una máquina circular. Sus ahorros los utilizaran en la construcción de su casa, para incrementar el capital de su negocio, Los sueños de Angélica, Mercedes y Ana son seguir capacitándose, que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener todas las comodidades, casa propia y ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: Angelica, Mercedes and Ana need loans for 600 soles, 400 soles, and 600 soles respectively, which will be invested in buying tablecloths, flatware, natural products, and buying a circular machine.

loans.name: Upper Kawuga C(2063) A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is M. Prossy. She is currently has a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy a fridge and more food. M. is 42 years old and is married with 4 children ranging from age 12 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, M. makes approximately UGX 300000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children and buy a plot of land.

M. is joined in her small group by Martha N., Florence S., Teopist M., and Monica M.. Martha N. has a poultry business and is requesting a loan to expand it. Florence S. also has a poultry business and is requesting a loan to complete the poultry house that is under construction. Teopist M. has a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add stock. Monica M. has a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more furniture and buy food warmers.

loans.use: To invest in restaurant business

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
My name is Nazia B. and I am a group leader of four other women. I am also a mother of three boys; two attend school and one, who is too young for school, stays at home. My husband works at a local hospital as support staff and I sell cloth. I travel to the city of Peshawar, which is famous for its inexpensive and good quality clothes, and buy cloth for my clothing sales. I would like to purchase additional cloth with this loan.

The other women in my group are requesting a loan for the following uses: Parween S. will use the loan to buy her son cardboard, Razia B. is borrowing money for her husband who is a construction worker, Kanwal B.’s husband wants this loan to buy cardboard and gum and Balqees B. will invest in her business.

loans.use: Buy cloth for the clothing sales

loans.name: Mujeres Responsables Group

texts.es:
The Committee “Responsible Women” was established by several neighbours from the Villa Bonita suburb of the town of Villa Elisa. Its members are hardworking and enterprising women for despite being mothers, wives and in some cases having a formal job, develop their microbusinesses with the aim of obtaining extra income to help their husbands with the household expenses.

Among the activities they are developing we can name: clothes-sales, fruits and vegetables, kiosks, tailoring, some are recyclers, others sell “chipa” (a traditional Paraguayan food made from a base of starch, milk, cheese and egg), others sell fast food and others sweets and cakes.

In the photograph there are 17 members of the committee. The committee's relationship are harmonious, they are responsible in their payments, among other things in order to improve savings.

They want to continue developing the committee programme which Fundación Paraguaya has devised as this has been a great help for them, both economically and personally, as the training courses which they organize have permitted them to improve their knowledge of sales, marketing, saving, budget-making etc. To begin a new cycle the women need a new credit to invest in their businesses, purchasing merchandise for their sales, ingredients to prepare their foods and some utensils or tools which they need to carry-out these labours.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Comitè “Mujeres Responsables” se formó a partir de la unión de vecinas del barrio Villa Bonita de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, sus integrantes son mujeres emprendedoras que a pesar de ser madres, esposas y en algunos casos posee un trabajo formal, desarrollan sus microempresas con la finalidad de obtener un ingreso extra para ayudar a sus esposos con los gastos de la casa.

Entre las actividades que desarrollan nombramos: venta de ropas, frutas y verduras, kioscos, costureras, algunas son recicladoras, otras venden “chipa” (una comida tradicional de Paraguay hecha a base de almidón, leche, queso y huevo), otras venden comidas rápidas y otras dulces y tortas.

En la fotografía tomada se encuentran las 17 integrantes del comité. El comité lleva una armoniosa relación entre ellas, son responsables en sus pagos y se organizan siempre para realizar actividades juntas como hamburgueseadas, ferias de comidas, entre otras cosas para aumentar el ahorro.

Ellas desean continuar desarrollando el programa del comité que desarrolla la Fundación Paraguaya pues para ellas es un gran apoyo, tanto económico como personal, ya que las capacitaciones que se dictan les permite mejorar sus conocimientos en las ventas, el marketing, el ahorro, elaboración de presupuestos, entre otras cosas. Para empezar un nuevo ciclo ellas necesitan un crédito nuevo para invertirlo en sus negocios comprando mercaderías para sus ventas, ingredientes para preparar sus comidas y algunos utensilios o herramientas que necesitan para desarrollar su labor.

loans.use:
Compra de: carnes, bebidas, aceite, harina, golosinas, productos enlatados, arroz, pastas, huevo, queso,  artículos para la casa, hilos, telas, botellas de plásticos, cartones, latas, etc.
Purchase of : meats, drinks, oil, flour, snacks, canned products, rice, pasta, egg, cheese, household articles, threads, cloths, plastic bottles, cartons, tins etc.

loans.name: Tusekilege

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Tusekelege K.. She is a widow and has 5 children aged between 9 and 19. She has 1 more dependent who lives with her because he is disabled. In 2007, Tusekelege established her crops business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more stock of the crop in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilitation as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock of the crop in bulk.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Viktor is married with two sons ages 11 and 12. He is a businessman who works in the central market in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine selling sportswear and t-shirts. Viktor admits that lending services from Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine have helped his business grow over the past 6 years. He now owns three vending facilities. Viktor and his wife run two of them and his mother works in the third one. Currently, his monthly profit is about $1200.

Viktor would like to purchase 50 sports suits to re-sell in his vending kiosk. He is hoping to generate additional profits and hopefully buy a house for his family one day. Viktor used to work in construction before he started his own business. It taught him perseverance and stamina. We believe these qualities will secure the success of his venture and prompt repayment of this loan.

(Note: this is a short-term “express” loan that will be repaid in two months.)

loans.use: To purchase 50 sports suits

loans.name: Ludev

texts.mn:
Business Description
Ludev is forty eight years old, a widow, and has two children.  Ludev has five years of shop ownership experience.  Before running his own food shop Ludev worked as a shop assistant for fourteen years.  This is his second loan.  Ludev was only late paying once on his previous loan and this was due to the unexpected cost of his wife’s funeral.   would like this loan to expand the choices his customers have when shopping at his store.  

Бизнес тодорхойлолт 
Бадрал нь 48 настай, энхэргүй, 2 хүүхэдтэй. Бадрал нь 5 жил дэлгүүр ажиллуулсан туршлагатай. Тэрээр хүнсний дэлгүүрээ нээхээс өмнө 14 жилийн турш дэлгүүрийн туслахаар ажилласан. Энэхүү зээл нь ХасБанкнаас авч буй 2 дахь зээл нь юм. Тэрээр өмнөх зээлээ төлөхдөө 1 өдөр хугацаа хэтэрсэн бөгөөд энэ нь  эхнэр нь нас барж оршуулгын зардал гарсантай холбоотой. Бадрал энэхүү зээлээ харилцагчийн сонголтод тулгуурлан өөрийн дэлгүүртээ зарцуулах болно.

loans.use:
Loan Description
Ludev requests a micro loan for 1,000,000 MNT to purchase food for his shop.  Ludev would like to expand his inventory and buy 67 new items.

Зээлийн тодорхойлолт 
Лүдэв овогтой Бадрал нь өөрийн хүнсний дэлгүүрийн эргэлтийн хөрөнгөдөө зориулан 1,000,000 төгрөгийн бичил зээл хүссэн. 67 шинэ төрлийн бүтээгдэхүүн худалдан авах хүсэлтэй байгаа.

loans.name: Lucio Herny

texts.es:
Henry is a hard working person. By profession, he is an automotive mechanic. He prepared conscientiously for it, opened his own shop and generates his own resources. He offers repair services for all kinds of cars and has been doing this for six years. Previously, he worked for someone else, but the mechanic of that shop had to retire and he handed over the shop location to Henry. Henry wishes that his shop was busier. Currently, his specialty is to repair cars. In addition, he likes jobs that challenge him. Henry supports his elderly mother and his younger brother. At this time, he is requesting a loan that will be invested in the purchase of necessary parts for the cars he's fixing.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Henry es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo, es mecánico automotriz de profesión, se preparó concientemente para ello, abrió su propio taller y se genera sus propios recursos, ofrece reparación de todo tipo de autos, eso lo viene haciendo desde hace 6 años, antes trabajaba de manera dependiente, pero el mecánico de ese taller tuvo que retirarse y le traspasó ese local donde actualmente esta su taller de mecánica. Henry desea que su taller sea más concurrido, en la actualidad su especialidad es reparar motores, además a él le gustan las carreras donde pone a prueba sus habilidades. Henry es sostén de su anciana madre y de su hermano menor, en esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de repuestos necesarios para los motores que está reparando.

loans.use: Purchase auto parts for his mechanic shop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther T. lives in Isshashi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 37 years old and married with two children. Esther owns a farm where she cultivates pumpkin seeds and bitter leaves. Pumpkin seeds are used in the preparation of Nigerian soups, while bitter leaves are useful herbs.

Esther is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client, and she is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy more pumpkin seeds for planting on her farm She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more pumpkin seeds for planting and culttivation.

loans.name: Esmeralda Janeth

texts.es:
Esmeralda es una mujer emprendedora y ejemplar que siempre ha tratado de salir adelante por iniciativa propia, por la necesidad de apoyar en el gasto del hogar a su esposo y de sus 3 hijos de: 4, 3 y 1 años; por eso se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos, actividad que le ha ayudado a salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $725 que pagara en 6 meses para comparar mercancia y asi poder cumplir con unos pedidos que ya tiene por entregar.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is an entrepreneurial and model woman who always has tried to get ahead with her own initiative through the need to financially support her husband and their three children of 4, 3, and one years. As a result, she is dedicated to the sale of cosmetic products, an activity that has helped her get ahead.

She needs a loan of US $725, which she will repay in six months, in order to purchase merchandise and supply some orders that she already has.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise.

loans.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en:
Rabia baji is the wife of Mr. A. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She resides in this place since last year. She is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. Her daughters do household work. Rabia baji has a bookbinding business and her son helps her with the bookbinding. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She is applying for a loan to buy material (thread, glue, and hard paper) to expand her business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Ishrat baji wants a loan to buy spare parts for vehicles for her spare parts shop. Nosheen baji wants a loan to buy leather to make leather shoes. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for bookbinding business

loans.name: Mirsada

texts.en:
Mirsada was born in 1950. She is a widow and lives alone in Breza, a village in Bosnia. Her husband died recently, so she has not yet begun receiving financial help from the government. Her only income comes from selling milk and milk products from her two cows, so she has been forced to ask her two adult children for financial help.

Mirsada requests a loan of 1,000KM from Women for Women, International to repair the barn for her cows, because it is currently damaged and unsafe.

loans.use: To repair her barn for her cows

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is twenty-eight years of age and is married with three children. Two of the children are in school and the last born is still being breastfed. 

Margaret enjoys trading and has been selling smoked fish for six years. She buys the smoked fish from the surrounding towns where the cost is quite economical. She wants to buy fish in bulk in order to save some transportation costs, and then trek to nearby towns to do business. 

She is, therefore, requesting for a loan to enable her to do this. Margaret is in the “Kristo Tease” (Christ Lives) Trust Bank group in her community where the group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and co-guarantee to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy larger stocks of smoked fish.

loans.name: Carol's Group

texts.en: Carol N. is a very friendly person who owns a beauty salon called Mama Emmanuel's. She is a 34 year old mother and wife of 5 children. In her salon, she does braiding, weaving, shampooing and setting, retouching and all kinds of treatments with a plan to enlarge her salon's offerings to include facials. She works hard to ensure that her children attain the best of education by ensuring that her salon continues to grow. Carol plans to use her loan to buy more braids, weaves, shampoos and chemicals for her business.

loans.use: Buying beauty supplies to expand her business

loans.name: Adela Edith

texts.es: Adela Edith R. O., reside en Cojutepeque en el país de El salvador junto a su esposo y sus dos padres de avanzada edad. Poseen una tienda llamada “Milagro”, la cuál esta ubicada en su misma casa y a través de esta se encarga de vender enseres de primera necesidad, la cuál contribuye a costear los gastos del hogar, tales como alimentación y vivienda, como también necesidades básicas de dos personas adultas mayores. Adela se ha dedicado a su tienda durante 10 años y su mayor deseo es obtener un préstamo para poder obtener el capital necesario para comprar mercadería a precio de mayoreo y poder venderla al por menor y obtener una ganancia merecida, a través de la cuál lograra ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Adela Edith R. O. lives in Cojutepeque in the country of El Salvador, along with her husband and her two parents of advanced age. They have a store called “Milagro” (“Miracle”), which is located in her house and due to this work selling belongings of basic necessity; she contributes to paying the expenses of the home, things like food and livelihood, and also the basic necessities of two grown up people. Adela has worked in her store for 10 years and her greatest desire is to obtain a loan in order to be able to obtain the capital necessary to buy merchandise at a better price and to be able to sell it for less and obtain a better income, through which she would be able to help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obtain the capital to buy products at a better price

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence O. is 39 years old and married with 3 children. He is a photographer. He is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase one digital camera. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one digital camera

loans.name: Aamar

texts.en:
Aamar, 46 years old, lives in Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Aamar has been selling coal for fifteen years. He is requesting his first time loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase coal. 

Aamar is special in his field because he is the only one in his region who sells coal and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors, tourists and others. When Aamar started his business he didn’t face difficulty. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase coal.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena R. V. reside en el municipio de Zacatecoluca, vive en la casa de su madre junto a ella y a su hijo de 23 años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. A sus 48 años de edad María Magdalena trabaja arduamente día con día en el mercado municipal de Zacatecoluca, ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, las cuales logra vender con mucho éxito debido a que posee una clientela fiel y estable. María solicita un préstamo a través de cual pueda comprar más verduras y frutas de estación, en especial desea poder comprar frutas típicas de la semana Santa, ya que son las más demandadas en el mes de abril. Es así como María Magdalena desea aumentar sus ventas, todo con el fin de mejorar su economía familiar, ya que ella es la única personas que aporta a su hogar debido a que su madre es muy anciana y su hijo se dedica a estudiar, y como toda buena madre desea ver a su hijo culminando sus estudios, es por ello que día con día trabaja muy duro para  brindarles todo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
María Magdalena R. V. lives in the city of Zacatecoluca with her mother and her 23 year old son, who is a student. At 48 years old, María Magdalena works very hard day after day in the Zacatecoluca municipal market. She sells fruits and vegetables, which she manages to do successfully due to her stable and loyal clientele. María is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables, particularly the typical fruits of Semana Santa (Holy Week) since those are in high demand in April. María Magdalena hopes to increase her sales and ultimately her family's finances since she is the only person who supports the household. Her mother is very old and her son is focused on studying. Like all good mothers, she wants to see her son complete his studies, so day after day she works very hard to provide everything that her family needs.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Madame Amy M. est une jeune débutante dans le commerce avec un an d’expérience.  Son activité consiste à vendre des habits pour bébé, du cosmétique, et divers.  Avec le financement elle va acheter la marchandise afin de mieux servir ses clients et gagner un profit.  Elle est mariée, âgée de 25 ans, et elle habite a Silmang, un quartier de Thiès.  C’est le premier crédit qu’elle a sollicité auprès de l’IMCEC et Kiva, et elle va utiliser les revenus de son activité pour aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. Amy M. is a young beginner in commerce with one year of experience. Her work involves selling baby clothing, cosmetics and various goods. With financing, she is going to buy merchandise in order to serve her customers better and to earn a profit. She is married, 25 years old, and lives in Silmang, a district of Thiès. This is her first loan she's requesting from IMCEC and Kiva. She'll use the revenues from her business to help her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baby clothing, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Maria Ascencia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Ascencia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, vive en Jr. San Martín Nº 218, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 43 años, 02 hijos, que aun depende de ella.

El haber pasado por momentos muy duros durante su vida, le motivo a emprender su propio negocio, nos cuenta que se inicio desde abajo  vendiendo kilos de arroz, verduras y frutas en una mesita,  ubicada en su misma casa. Luego con su primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, implemento su bodega de venta de abarrotes, hoy e día nos cuenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, además brinda servicio de Internet (cabinas), y ya tiene clientes conocidos en ambos negocios. A diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con su carisma que la caracteriza.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, lo invertirá comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Maria Ascencia, como mujer se siente muy contenta con lo logrado a lo largo de su vida, y con mayor esfuerzo desea ver a sus hijos profesionales. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado  a superararce.
texts.en:
Maria Ascensia belongs to the community bank “Las Margaritas II.” She lives on Jr. San Martín Nº 218, Tarapoto district, San Martín province, department of San Martín. She lives with her partner, is 43 years old, and has 2 children that still depend on her.

She has had very difficult times in her life. These motivated her to begin her own business. She tells us that she started from scratch by selling kilos of rice, vegetables and fruits from a small table located in her own home. Later, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos, she started her grocery shop. Today, she tells us that her business is doing very well. She also offers internet service and booths, and is well-known to her customers in both businesses. They come to her store daily to do their shopping, because she has all the products necessary for the home and personally attends to them with her characteristic charisma.

With this loan of S/. 3,000.00 ($1,000 USD), she will invest in buying rice and sugar in sacks, packets of noodles, milk and a variety of brands of fish preserves in cartons, eggs and personal hygiene products to continue giving her customers the best service.

Maria Ascensia feels very content as a woman with what she has achieved during her lifespan and strongly desires to see her children succeed. Thanks to Manuela Ramos for helping her succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up her grocery store

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion - Group 2

texts.en:
Marcelo S. lives in Batey 18, a very impoverished batey (company-run housing for a sugar cane plantation) outside of La Romana in the southeast Dominican Republic.

Batey 18 is a small community of about 20 houses, all of which are occupied by Haitian immigrants who come to work on the sugar cane fields. It is hard for them to do business in this community. The only time that people have money is during the sugar cane season when they get paid per pound of cut cane. In order to make decent profits, Marcelo has to sell on the streets of La Romana.

Marcelo will purchase house products, such as kitchen-ware, to sell. He hopes to make some good sales with Mother's day coming. Marcelo is married to Antonia Celestino and they have four children. One of his goals is to send his children to a better school so they can improve their education.

On behalf of the members of the Canal de Bendicion group, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy home use items to resell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel A. is a fisherman in Abotoase near Hohoe, who needs financial assistance. He has received schooling through junior high and is married and has six dependents. His wife is a trader whose income cannot support him in taking care of the family. He is solely responsible for all the financial needs of the children and the family as well.

His loan will be used to buy a fishing net to catch fish in large quantity to enable him take care of the needs of his large family. He hopes to save the new profits from his business.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net to catch fish in large quantity

loans.name: Kristhel Margota

texts.es: Kristhel Margota C. M. tiene la edad de 25 años. Es una mujer soltera. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella da inicio a este pequeño negocio por que una amiga le entrego mercadería como calzado y ropa, para que la distribuyera a los diferentes clientes, luego de 2 años decide iniciar por cuenta propia y con mucho esfuerzo logra independizarse con el fin de poseer su propio negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de faldas, camisas, pantalones y vestidos. El sueño de Kristhel es seguir adelante con su negocio, ya que enfrento muchos problemas porque no tenía ayuda de nadie.
texts.en:
Kristhel is a 25-year-old single mother. She has been selling clothing for over seven years. She began this small business because a friend gave her merchandise like shoes and clothing for her to distribute to different customers. After two years she decided to start on her own and with a great deal of effort she achieved self-independence and had her own business. The loan that she requests is for the purchase of skirts, shirts, pants, and dresses. Her dream is to keep moving forward with her business since she already faces a lot of problems because she didn’t have anyone’s help.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is single. She lives and works in the small town of Korolyovo, Western Ukraine. Oksana sells toys in the central market of her home town. Her vending kiosk is located right in the center of the marketplace. There are no other vendors with similar inventory at the market which helps Oksana’s business develop without having to face fierce competition. She has been in the trade for five years. Currently, Oksana has about 30,000 hryven' in inventory. Her monthly income is about 4,000 hryven'.

Oksana is seeking a loan of 10,000 hryven' to restock her merchandise. She is hoping to generate additional income to be reinvested in her business. One of Oksana’s plans for the future is to open a new vending location and expand her trade as a result. .

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Yawa Karim

texts.fr: Cette dame vend depuis 2007 en face de l’église Catholique d’Adidogomé à Lomé des sacs en plastiques pour apporter sa contribution financière à son foyer. Ces sacs sont très utilisés par la poulation dans leurs besoins de tous les jours. Son stock épuisant, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour pouvoir continuer son commerce. Elle est mariée et a un enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
There, opposite the Catholic Church of Adidogomé in Lomé, this lady has been selling plastic bags since 2007 in order to contribute financially to her household.  These bags are much in use by people from day to day.  Her inventory is exhausted.  She is requesting a loan from WAGES to continue her business.  She is married and has one child in her care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying plastic bags

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María Del Carmen R. D. M. resiD. en ciudad Arce del departamento D. La Libertad, María vive con su esposo quien es empleado; y su hijo D. 21 años que curso hasta el bachillerato y por motivos económicos ha tenido que aplazar su deseo D. ingresar a una universidad. María tiene dieciocho años D. dedicarse a la venta D. productos por catalogo, las que realiza D. manera ambulante en otras colonias y vecinos D. la zona, María también posee un pequeño inventario D. productos; los cuales ella los compra en oferta y luego los pueD. vender a precio regular desD. su casa, el crédito que solicita María es para aumentar el inventario que posee en su casa.

loans.use: Surtir su inventario

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Mrs. Letecia L. is a 57-year-old resident of Pader, Barangay Aguisan, which is a part of Himamaylan City in the Negros Occidental region. She is married to Hilario, who is a construction worker, and blessed with three adult children. Letecia is also an active member of her church council, is the chairwoman of the community outreach committee, and teaches catechism in school. Even while she keeps busy with her community work, Letecia still manages her many businesses very well despite her age. She continues working because it makes her happy to earn a daily income.

Letecia aimed to help her husband when she opened a general store using her first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. She noticed that the store provided a steady income if she just stocked it well with goods popular with her customers. To this end she invested in a refrigerator so that she could sell cold food and drinks.

Letecia did not stop looking for other business opportunities. This led her to invest in a food vending business selling fried chicken in her community. She also started a retail business in rice with her most recent loan. Because of her wise investments and her skillful business acumen, she is able to pay her loan installments on time and in full within the period she has promised. With her excellent credit record with NWTF-Project Dungganon, Letecia is being granted higher loans.

Now that two of her children are gainfully employed, the L. family’s quality of life is finally on the rise. With her eighteenth loan, Letecia is proposing to use 29,000 PHP to invest in her general store and rice retailing business. She plans to use her profits to continue to expand her business operations while helping to support her family.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live lives that they can finally call honorable ones. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To invest in her store & her rice business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Constancia G. Belotto is 56 years old and has been living with Mr. Francisco Solano Sanchez for several years in a house that is located in the San Isidro district in the city of Encarnacion.

Mrs. Maria Constancia devoted several years to the selling of containers, such as cans, jars, glasses, and so on. She currently has a sales position in the downtown area. Also, she works in a restaurant and is a cook in the mornings. Through this work, she can meet the cost of the household expenses as well as any unexpected problems that might occur. Her husband, Mr. Francisco, is also dedicated to the sale of merchandise on the street and can contribute to the household income. 

Mrs. Maria Constancia is applying for credit to purchase more merchandise to fill her post and the post of her husband. The amount requested is Gs. 3,000,000.

loans.use: She will buy more products to sell

loans.name: Gerevasio's Group

texts.en:
O. Gerevasio is the leader of his group in Ibanda. He is 34 years old and married with five children. He also takes care of two other dependents.

Gerevasio has a retail shop in Nyarukika Trading Centre that he has been running for ten years and from which he makes 100,000/= in weekly profits. He is successful because of his good customer-care skills and his spirit. In the future, he wants to turn his shop into a wholesale operation at which time he will have to shift to new premises in the main town.

Gerevasio needs a loan to help restock his shop by buying more goods in order to avoid shortages. He is such a hardworking and friendly man.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his store

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: Eulogia es soltera con 28 años de edad, vive en el domicilio de su papa, no tiene hijos. Eulogia se dedica a la comercialización de compra y venta de carne de ovino (carne altiplano), cuenta con una experiencia de 6 años en el rubro. La competencia es alta, ella tiene su propia clientela  trabaja con los restaurantes y es principalmente por la puntualidad en la entrega de la mercadería que es una de las preferidas. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de  carne de ovino. Eulogia cuenta con buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Eulogia is 28 years-old, single with no children, and lives in the home of her father. Eulogia works buying and selling of sheep meat, (high plain meat), and has 6 years of experience in the area. There is a lot of compettion, but she has her own customers and works supplying restaurants. Her punctuality in supplying the meat has made her one of the preferred vendors. The funds from this loan will be used to buy sheep meat. Eulogia has a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep meat (operation capital)

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S. is 30 years of age and a resident of Kampong Chhnang Province.

Mao currently works growing rice on the farm and has been doing this work since 1997. She now has two school-aged children, both of whom also work on the farm when they are not learning.

Mao is applying for a Kiva loan to buy bamboos, which she will weave as nets and traps for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To buy bamboos to weave as nets and traps.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 69 años y es madre de 02 hijos, ya independientes. 

Elsa, mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, por iniciativa propia, decidió acondicionar algunos ambientes de su casa, para el alquiler mensual de habitaciones, la cual el servicio los brinda a estudiantes y conocidos que llegan de otros lugares para quedarse a trabajar en el Distrito de Tarapoto. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y cuenta con 05 habitaciones. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará ladrillos, cementos, triplay, para la construcción de mas habitaciones. Parte del dinero, también lo invertirá en la compra de accesorios, para los baños, para mejorar el servicio e higiene,  de esa mañera sus inquilinos queden   satisfechos y contentos.

Elsita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the El Tiempo es Oros Communal Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 69, single, and has two independent children. Elsa, a hard-working woman, on her own initiative decided to set up some rooms in her house to rent out monthly. She offers this service to students and people she knows who arrive from other places to stay and work in the Tarapoto district. She currently continues with the same business, and she has five rooms. She will use this loan for 2,000 PEN to buy bricks, cement, and three layered plywood to build more rooms. She will use part of the money to buy bathroom accessories to improve the service and hygiene. That way her tenants will feel satisfied and happy. Elsita, as she is affectionately called, feels like a very fulfilled woman. She has more desires to achieve and make her other dreams come true. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business and for helping so many women who want to grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is twenty eight years old. She is single and mother of one child. She operates a clothing shop in the community market. She sells women's clothing such as jeans, trousers, skirts and tops, among others. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of women's clothes to increase her stock and thereby to make more income for her business.  She wants to finance her child’s education. Florence has sold through “hawking” (door-to-door selling) for over four years. She believes your support would enable her improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Maruja tiene 30 años, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos: Cristhian tiene 08 años, Jhon tiene 06 años y Yashira tiene 03 años. La socia Maruja es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia desde muy temprano del día hace sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su esposo y sus hijos, limpiar la casa y cocinar para el almuerzo. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir atender su negocio de venta de pollo y pescado. Nuestra socia nos cuenta que ella compra los productos de los mayoristas de la ciudad del Cusco y después lo vende en el “Mercado Unidos de Urcos”. Ya son 12 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de su carro pues es el medio de transporte para traer sus productos de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra a 45 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a 45 minutos de viaje.
texts.en:
Maruja is 30, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Cristhian is 8, Jhon is 6, and Yashira is 3. Maruja is from the city of Urcos in the Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. She belongs to the Qori Orcco Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. She starts her household activities very early in the day. For example, she makes breakfast for her husband and children, cleans the house, and cooks for lunch. After doing these household chores, she has to go tend to her business of selling chicken and fish. She buys the products wholesale in the city of Cusco. Then, she sells them in the Mercado Unidos of Urcos. She has been in this business for 12 years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to be able to perform maintenance on her car. This is her form of transportation to bring her products from the city of Cusco. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time. The city of Urcos is 45 kilometers from the city of Cusco, which is approximately a 45 minute trip.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perform maintenance on her car

loans.name: Paublo Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Paublo Ramón S. C., ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante  siete años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los once créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.
.
Esta casado con tres hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de ladrillos para su vivienda con el fin de darles un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos que tanto requieren del apoyo de su padre.

Paublo dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel ha venido mejorando su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Paublo Ramón S. C. has worked with Ceprodel for seven years and during this time been able to improve the conditions of his house with the eleven loans he has negotiated.

He is married with three school-age children.

The requested loan is to purchase bricks for his house in order to improve living conditions for his children, who still depend on their father's support.

Paublo says that thanks to the loans offered by Ceprodel he has continued improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and expansion

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
NidA. is a 52-year-old married man with three children. He has owned agriculture land since 2000 where he cultivates agriculture products according to the season. He delivers the vegetables and fruit to the agriculturA. market to be sold. He’s thankful for his business; it allows him to have a better life situation.

NidA. also has an agriculture tent to help him always be able to process his work. Today, NidA. is requesting $1,100 to prepare a new agriculture tent needed to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: To prepare a new agriculture tent

loans.name: Olamide

texts.en:
Olamide has a hairdressing salon where she makes lovely Nigerian and western hairstyles for her customers. She also sells hair products like shampoo, hair extensions and cream. Olamide is 36 years old and married with two children. Her husband is an engineer and he also supports the family. They live in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. 

Olamide hopes to grow her business. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more salon materials. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more salon materials

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. C., se dedica a dar servicio de vulcanización y venta de llanta trabajando las 24 hrs. día en turno de 6:00am a 10:pm el Sr. C. y un segundo turno le ayudan los hijos de 10:00Pm – 6:00am del día siguiente, esto con el objetivo de dar buen servicio al cliente y estar anuente en el momento que lo amerite el caso. Su puesto está ubicado en un punto estratégico Parque posada del Sol 1c, al Sur donde está la mayor afluencia de vehículo.

Este es su primer crédito que solicita a la institución el Sr. C. se siente agradecido por el apoyo que se le ha brindado para lograr incrementar su negocio con el objetivo de obtener mayores ganancia y por ende mejorar el nivel de vida de toda su familia que está compuesto por 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio does vulcanization and sells tires. He does 24 hour shift work from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm and his sons work the 10:00 pm to 6:00 am shift. He wants to be able to give good service to his customers and be available when they need his services. His shop is located in a strategic location in the Parque Posada del Sol 1c, an area where there are many vehicles. This will be his first loan through this institution and he is grateful for the support he has received which has helped him to grow his business and improve his income. This has allowed him to improve his family’s life. He has four children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase, install and operate a new mill

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man T. L. is thirty-six years old. She lives in An Ninh village, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She is married with two children. She is a seamstress and she sells clothes in the market. She has done this job for 10 years. She has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND. She joined SEDA in 2008 and has always repaid punctually. Last time, she borrowed 4.704.000 VND. This time, she would like to borrow 8.288.000 VND more (or 450 USD) to invest in her business, in order to buy new clothing inventory to sell.

loans.use: To buy new clothing inventory to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhom Toch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The nineteen people in this group all live in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province, and they are members of a village bank. They have requested a group loan, which will be used for all different purposes so that it can improve their businesses in the future. 

Mrs. Sokhom T. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her child. Her current problem is that her house is too old to live in, but she did not have enough money to make the necessary repairs. Thus, Mrs. Sokhom T. requested this loan to fix her house. She is widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other is studying in local public school.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Love-Kebbeh Group

texts.en:
Kebbeh S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Kebbeh-Love. She is 48 years old, married, and has six children who range from 15 to 7 years old. She did not attend school due to poverty.

For 25 years, she has been selling rice, palm oil and fish at Crozeiville Market, White Plains, outside Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. 
 
She plans to use her 7,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 35,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more palm oil, rice and fish. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kebbeh is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil, rice and fish.

loans.name: Rufine

texts.fr: A. Rufine est née le 01 Décembre 1959 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Mariée à DANGBENON Gérard, un maçon, Rufine est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Il y a près de vingt ans que Rufine s'est installée au quartier Dodomey à Allada, où elle y vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Rufine n'a jamais été à l'école. Depuis une douzaine d'année, Rufine mène comme activité la vente de tissus à Allada, par le système de distribution, ce qui lui permet de subvenir sans difficulté à ses besoins et de se faire une épargne. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin que Rufine achète ses produits. Rufine a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Dans l'optique d'augmenter davantage le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle, Rufine sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Rufine A. was born December 1, 1959 in Allada, in the department of the Atlantic. Married to Gerard DANGBENON, a mason, Rufine is the mother of two children, one of them attends school. Nearly twenty years ago Rufine moved to the neighborhood of Dodomey Allada, where she lives with her children and husband. The couple provides together for the family expenses. Rufine has never been at school. For a dozen years, Rufine has been selling textiles in Allada, through a distribution system, which allows her to provide for her needs and make savings. Rufine buys her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rufine has received two loans from ALIDé and they have been fully repaid. In order to further increase the stock of her products and better meet the growing demand of her customers, Rufine is requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of textiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase curtains to sew

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, underwear and a sewing machine

loans.name: Davaatseren

texts.en: Davaatseren J. is 39 years old and lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family all live together in a house. Her husband works and lives in South Korea as a contracted worker. Her elder daughter attends a middle school while the youngest daughter goes to a kindergarten. Davaatseren operates a meat retail trading business in her town. She started her business in 2000 as a clothing retailer, but since 2005, she has been operating a food trading business and the business has since grown successfully. Davaatseren has gained considerable business knowledge and skills in her years of operating her business. She works hard to provide for their children and improve the quality of their lives with education. Davaatseren is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more supplies for her food trading business to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Sokheng Vaen Village Bank Group

texts.en: Seventeen people make up a village bank loan, live in Chrouy village, Takeo province. All of the members of this group will use a portion of their loan in various ways to improve their businesses. Mrs. Sokheng V. is a village bank president who was born in 1969, selected by the other members. She is a fish and rice middleman who is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve her current business, Mrs. Sokheng V. is requesting for a loan to buy more fish and rice to resell. Her husband, Mr. Tet Mak, is a crippler and she has five children, two of whom are laborers, while three of whom are attending in local school and they are helping her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish and rice to resell.

loans.name: Herminia Alba

texts.es:
La  Señora Herminia G. D.  tiene 45 años D. edad, está casadacon el Sr Alejandro M. Romero quien tiene cuatro hijos  2 mayores y dos menores  en edad escolar.
 La familia cuenta con casa propia en la ciudad D. Cambyreta  Vivienda Arroyo Pora , ciudad muy cerca D. Encarnación como  a 5 km.
La Sra. Herminia es micro empresaria  es propietaria D. un local propio D. ventas D. ropería, zapatería, ventas D. Bijouteri que es atendida por ella misma y su hija realiza trabajos D. pedicura, esta demás mencionar que también  aporta a la unidad familiar  y su conjugue es maestro D. obras. 
La cliente solicito D. nuestra asistencia para compras D. mercaderías como ser ropas D. invierno, calzados, y otros que trae D. Ciudad del Este y  Asunción,  estas compras  le estarán generando mayor  margen D. ganancia.
texts.en:
Herminia G. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Two of her children are now grown up, and the other two still attend school. The family lives in their own house in the city of Cambyreta Vivienda Arroyo Pora, which is about 5 miles away from Encarnacion. Herminia has a small business selling clothing and shoes. One of her daughters works with her providing pedicures. Herminia's husband also works as a foreman. She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as winter clothing and shoes, and other items which she brings from the city of Cuidad del Este and Asuncion. This investment will help her to grow her business and her income.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her small business, including winter clothing such as pants, jackets and shoes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother of two.  For the past 32 years, she has been selling clothes. She has one employee in her business. She hopes to improve her standard of living and own property in the future. 

As a member of Faulu Kenya, she had taken out a loan of 20,000 KES. She wants to buy clothes for resale. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 40,000 KES.  Rose dreams of owning a boutique in the future.  Currently, she does not have a permanent business premises but she sees herself owning one in five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Alejandrina Emperatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Alejandrina  y nos cuenta un poso de su vida, ella tiene 47 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 28 años de la cual ha procreado 8 hijos, su esposo es obrero que trabaja por temporadas.

Tiene un pequeño comedor en el mercado de la localidad, trabaja desde las 4am en la preparación de los alimentos, y cierra su negocio a las tres de la tarde. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos y nos dice que ya son 14 años en su negocio, que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar tres mesas y sillas ya que las que tiene  están desgastadas y deterioradas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 15 ciclos y le gustan las reuniones ya que se divierte con sus amigas.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Nueva Luz communal bank meet every 15 days in the city of Santa Ana, known for its beautiful landscapes and fresh water spas which are visited by many tourists.

Here we spoke with Alejandrina and she told us a bit about her life. She is 47 years old and has lived in a common-law marriage for the past 28 years, from which she has had 8 children. Her husband is a seasonal worker.

She has a small eatery in the area market. She works beginning at 4am making the food, and she closes her business at 3pm. She works with the help of her children and she tells us that she has had her business for 14 years. It has always gone well for her, since her customers prefer the flavor that she adds to her dishes.

She will use this loan to purchase three tables and chairs, since the ones that she has are worn out and in poor condition. She has been with the bank for 15 loan cycles and she likes the meeting since she enjoys her time with her friends.

Her goals are to continue moving ahead with her business, and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia M. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old and separated from her spouse. She has thirteen adult-aged children. To make a living, she manufactures and sells wood products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $285 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. 

Virginia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be her 7th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena G., from the village of Bayabo East, is 49 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Rowena owns and operates a specialized retail store selling raw and salted eggs in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Rowena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 16000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting her 10th loan of 18000 PHP to be used for the same purpose. Rowena plans to pay the tuition fees of her children with the additional revenue generated from the business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Argelia María

texts.es: La Sra. Argelia María C. S. es trabajadora Activa del Ministerio de Educación desempeñándose como Sud-Directora de un Colegio de Secundaria  tiene diez años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo esta solicitando para la instalación de un inodoro, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Sra. Argelia María C. S. is an active worker in the Ministry of Education, where her position is assistant principal of a secondary school. She has worked for this institution for 10 years. She is married and now has a son of school age. She has had nine loans with CEPRODEL, and each one has been for the purchase of construction materials to expand and improve her home. She is applying for this loan to install a toilet. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly, since in this way she has improved her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: Buy sand, cement, a toilet, and blocks.

loans.name: Elkana

texts.en:
Elkana Cheruitot is a man of 24 years, married to Charity Chepchirchir. Together they have two beautiful children. Elkana sells paraffin retail in Sugoi on the outskirts of Eldoret town.  His wife Charity is a farmer and helps him in providing for the children.  He has been in his business for one year now and he gets a monthly income of 5,000 Kenya shillings.

This will be Elkana's first loan with KADET and he plans to buy more paraffin to sell. With the income he is going to get from the business he plans to pay school fees for his two children and provide them with basic needs like food.

In future Elkana plans to expand his business to have a bigger paraffin sales point and also to provide for his family's basic needs like sending them to good schools, buying good clothes, and raising their standard of living.

loans.use: To add more paraffin for resale in smaller quantities

loans.name: Amalia Rufina

texts.es:
Amalia Rufina Z. T. tiene 58 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 8 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Amalia se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 5 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ponerse un negocio.
Le gusta cocinar y lavar.
texts.en:
Amalia Rufina Z. T. is 58 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children. They live in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. She has 8 children.  

The members of the rural communal bank UNIDOS SOMO MAS [Together we are More] are in the community of El Marañon, in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural work such as planting corn, rice and beans.  

Amalia has worked especially with planting corn, rice and beans for five years. She buys her products at Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in  in the market in Ventanas and in the same community.  

She is asking for the loan to buy agricultural materials and fertilizers for her crops. The support of the loan will help her to meet her needs financially. They face challenges such as pests, diseases, and weather variation. Her dream is to open a business. She likes to cook and clean.

loans.use: Agricultural materials and fertilizers

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma A. is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity bills and school fees.   

She has operated a fresh water selling business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the summer season the water dams get dry and there is not enough water. She hopes to expand and supply water to a larger market.

With the 60000 KES she wants to purchase a water pump. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela Cruz M. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de lácteos desde 1972. Ella inicio este negocio en el populoso mercado oriental, considerado el más grande de Centroamérica, con la indemnización de su trabajo y considera que se enamoró del queso por eso todo este tiempo ha trabajado con este producto. En la actualidad tiene su puestito en mercadito de San Judas.
Ella invertirá el crédito en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela Cruz M. is a hard-working, dedicated entrepeneur who has been selling dairy products since 1972.  She used her work's severance pay to begin business in the populous east market, considered to be one of the largest in Central America.
