She fell in love with cheese products and has been active in this business since then.

She currently has a stall in the San Judas market.  She plans to invest the loan in her business activity.

loans.use: Dairy products

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie H. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old. Josie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing & shoe products in the local community. She also buys and sells gold dust. Josie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 8000, Josie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & to use as working capital. Josie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional gold dust & ready-to-wear clothes like blouses and shirts. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Josie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase gold dust & clothes to resell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvin A. Chávez, esta en unión libre y quiere comprar materiales para la construcción o arreglo de la parte trasera o cocina de su hogar, el es agricultor  y quiere darle a su familia un ambiente familiar más seguro y buenas condiciones de vida por lo cual quiso optar por el arreglo de parte trasera de su humilde hogar. Esto también se debe para brindar a su hogar una mayor seguridad de su casa y de sus bienes en su interior que tanto le han costado.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marvin A. Chávez lives with his common law wife.  He would like to buy materials to build or fix the rear part of his house (the kitchen).  He is a farmer and would like to provide his family with a safer family environment and good living conditions.  For this reason, he decided to fix the rear of his humble home.  This will also provide better security for his home and the possessions inside which he has worked so hard to acquire.

This is Marvin's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't had any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with easier repayment facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy materials to fix his house

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 34 years old and married. Janvier is in the business of transportation, which he has been doing for three years. His business is well-organized and is open from 5am until 12pm every day.

Janvier plans to use this loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes to make enough profit to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Planting tea.

loans.name: Pamela Ivett

texts.es: La señora Pamela R. S. , tiene la edad de 30 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual labora como electricista para apoyar con los gastos del hogar , ellos  tienen dos hijos  que estudian  su primaria y necesitan de su apoyo , los planes hacia un futuro es poder terminar de construir su vivienda , doña Pamela desde hace dos años de dedica a la venta de ropa, zapato , cosméticos entre otros , la mayor  dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de ingresos economicos  para poder realizar sus sueños , ya que lo que va vendiendo lo invierte en el mismo . Doña Pamela quiere el préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que donde actualmente habita es un solo cajón y no tiene divisiones, la sala, cocina, cuarto, baño , todo está junto lo cual no tiene privacidad  . Lo que ella va a invertir es en bloques , arena , hierro , cemento , piedrin , etc .
texts.en:
Pamela R. S. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Ticuantepe, together with her husband who works as an electrician in order to cover their household expenses.  The couple have two children who are in elementary school and need their support.  Pamela's plans for the future are to finish building her home.  For two years, Pamela has been selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc.  The biggest difficulty that she faces is the lack of income to be able to fulfil her dreams as when she makes sales, she invests the money back into her business.

Pamela would like this loan to buy building supplies since the house she is currently living in is like a big box and doesn't have any internal walls.  Her living room, kitchen, bedroom and bathroom are all together and she has no privacy.  She would like to invest her loan in buying blocks, sand, iron, cement, gravel, etc.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lourdes is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 51 years old and has one child who is in school.

Lourdes has a furniture shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase lumber materials for her furniture making business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 18 years.  In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of lumber and other materials forher furniture making business

loans.name: Mutete

texts.en:
Mutete M. is a 39-year-old married lady and the mother of three school-going children. She has been a wheat farmer for the past five years with a monthly income of approximately $170. 

She is a good client who repays her loans without any obstruction. This will be her third loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase wheat seed and fertilizers. 

She hopes to generate profits from the loan which will be used to expand her farming from small scale to large scale commercial farming. She hopes in future she will live a better life and she also hopes to see her children realize their goals through better education.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 67 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Cruce Jaén – Nuevo Olmos, una zona rural que tiene como principal actividad a la agricultura, pertenece al distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado vacuno, los cuales cría en un ambiente cercano a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Esta actividad la realiza hace 8 años, por ello conoce a la perfección este rubro. Adicionalmente cuenta con un terreno de cultivo producto de una herencia. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben de estas actividades se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Pedro desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Pedro is 67 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the Cruce Jaén section of Nuevo Olmos.  This is a rural zone that is primarily agricultural, belonging to the Olmos district in Lambayeque, and more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle near his home and, when they are large enough, he offers them for sale to the merchants that frequent the area.  He has been carrying out this activity for 8 years, which is why he now knows the trade perfectly.  Additionally, he has inherited some farmland.  With the income from both of these endeavors, he works to help his family get ahead.

Pedro would like to expand his business by buying more animals to augment sales.  For this reason, he has turned to Edpyme Alternativa to request a loan of 600 Peruvian soles.

loans.use: buy more animals to expand his business.

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es: Edgar Antonio brinda el servicio de taller de soldadura eléctrica. Tiene más de 4 años en este negocio, por lo que ha logrado aprender de los diferentes pedidos que recibe de parte de sus clientes. Inició dándole curso a su naturaleza independiente, porque necesitaba desarrollar su autonomía y al mismo tiempo generar ingresos para el auto sostenimiento de su familia. Su meta es continuar ampliando su cobertura en lugares donde hasta el momento no ha llegado y para eso se prepara. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de  varias, guantes, lentes entre otras herramientas.
texts.en: Edgar Antonio provides electrical soldering services from his workshop. He has more than 4 years in the business and he has been able to learn from the different orders he receives from his clients. He started out by giving way to his independent nature, needing to develop his autonomy and to generate an income for the support of his family. His goal is to keep increasing his territory, reaching the locales where he has not yet reached. And he is getting ready for that. For this reason he requests a loan. He will purchase welding rods, gloves, glasses, and other tools.

loans.use: to purchase welding rods, gloves, glasses, and other tools.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es: El Sr. Clemente y su esposa  Herminia, son unas personas que se dedican al comercio desde hace mas de cinco años, y a través de este negocio han sabido dar sustento y estudio a sus hijos, y por este motivo ellos se ven muy preocupados por sus clientes,  quienes a diario los buscan para comprar los víveres primordiales del día, tanto para la comida de la casa como para llevarles un jugo o galleta a los niños que pasan a la escuela , ahora ellos como comerciantes  piensan en incrementar los productos para proporcionar  una mejor  servicio a  sus  cliente, así  como también  han decidido ampliar un poco mas la tienda para  proporcionar  mayor espacio y comodidad a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Clemente and his wife Herminia have been in the retail trade for more than five years. Through their business, they have been able to support their children and provide them with an education. For this reason, they look after their customers who are looking to buy the basic necessities for daily living. This includes everything from food for the household meals to juice and cookies for the children who are going to school.

Having the mindset of store owners, Clemente and his wife want to increase their inventory of products so that they can provide better service to their customers. They have also decided to slightly expand their storefront so that there will be more space for all of their customers to be comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en:
Otgon is 65 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. Although she and her husband are retired, Otgon operates a food business. Each day, she prepares food in her home from eight in the morning until noon and then sells it at Mongolia’s largest outdoor firewood market, called Tsaiz, in the afternoon. Otgon started her business in 2008. After years of operation she has established a loyal customer following due to her delicious and quality meals. 

Otgon is requesting a loan of 300,000 MNT to purchase ingredients such as flour, and to hire others to prepare the food. She would like to expand her business and increase her working capital. In the future, Otgon hopes to have her own cafe.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients

loans.name: Azizi Group

texts.en:
Vale, who is in her early 30s, is married with one small child.  She has been running a fruit-and-vegetable business for 3 months now.  She works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to take care of her baby's needs, household expenses and also increased on her fruit-and-vegetable business. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Azizi, which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary has a small food stall. After receiving this money, she will expand her business so that she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to expand her food business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a widowed woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a food-selling business, selling to her neighbors and school-going children. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, utensils, cooking fat oil and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, utensils, cooking fat oil and beans.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita está solicitando un préstamo para empezar la construcción de un cuarte de material ya que actual mente la vivienda que tiene es de madera y esta en muy malas condiciones.
Con el préstamo comprar el material para la construcción que  block, cemento, varilla y arena. Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la nueva construcción de la vivienda. 
Doña Margarita se dedica a la costura y con este ingreso pagara el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor Andrés se encargara de los gastos familiares. 
La señora Margarita y el señor Andrés son ya personas de mayores de edad y viven solos.
texts.en:
Margarita is asking for a loan to start building a room out of better materials because her house is currently made of wood and it’s in very bad condition.  She will use the loan to buy concrete blocks, cement, iron rods and sand because she does not have the necessary funds to do the new construction on the dwelling. 

Margarita is a Seamstress and will use income from this work to repay the loan since her husband, Andrés, will see to family expenses.  Margarita and Andrés are older adults and live alone.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children. One of her children is currently in school. Maria has a small retail shop that sells sugar, salt, etc. She has had this business for six years.         

To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar, salt, and rice for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Maria hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Maria hopes to expand her business. Maria is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 2 children. 
Azucena has a shop that makes & sells snacks like rice, pan & corn cakes.  She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making the snacks.
Azucena has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Azucena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 38 años, es jefe de familia que vive al lado de su esposa y su menor hijo en casa de un familiar. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, él posee un auto que es su esencial  herramienta de trabajo que le permite sostener a su familia. Trabaja todos los días, en distintos horarios, desde la madrugada hasta la noche, de acuerdo a la demanda de sus clientes. Su sentido de prudencia en el manejo hace que evite los accidentes que son un riesgo para su trabajo. Considera que esta actividad es muy rentable en sus ganancias y esto lo anima a proyectarse en grande para el futuro, ya que desea tener más vehículos y con ello tener su propia empresa de transporte. Es su cuarto crédito de trabajo que tiene con MFP, considera que trabajar con préstamo es una forma adecuada y más rápida para mejorar el negocio que una persona tiene, su propia experiencia le ha permitido aprender sobre la importancia del aspecto financiero y de cómo administrarla. En esta ocasión invertirá su crédito en el pago del mantenimiento mecánico de su carro.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 38, is the head of the family.  He lives with his wife and their minor son in the family home.  He has been providing transportation service for five years.  He has a car, which is the essential work tool that allows him to support his family.

He works every day, and he has different schedules.  He works from the early morning until night time, according to his customers’ demand.  The carefulness with which he drives makes him avoid the accidents that are a risk for his work.  He considers this business activity to be very profitable in its earnings.

This encourages him to plan big for the future.  He wishes to have more vehicles, and to form his own transportation business with them. 

This is his fourth loan that he has had working with MFP.  He considers working with the loan a suitable and quicker way to improve the business that one has.  His own experience has allowed him to learn about the importance of the financial aspect and how to manage it.

This time he will use the loan to pay for mechanical maintenance on his car.

loans.use: to pay for mechanical maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Sanny

texts.en:
Sanny is an industrious woman. She just finished high school and didn’t finish her tertiary studies due to financial problems. They were six siblings of their parents. When she was twelve, her mother died due to severe sickness (complication of heart and high blood). Despite what happened, she continued to pursue her studies until she finished her high school.


After high school, she went to Manila to work in factory and earn money for her family. She stayed there for nine years and there she met her husband in the person of William, a farmer in their community. So, she went with her loving husband back to their province and built her small sari-sari (variety) store.


Presently, she is 53 years old, a mother of one child and asking for a loan amount of P5,000 to buy canned goods, candies and instant noodles as additional goods to sell. She hopes this will boost her income in order to provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies and instant noodles as additional goods to sell.

loans.name: José Angel

texts.es:
José Ángel se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos en la zona del manzano, en donde estos suelos se caracterizan por ser suelos aptos para el establecimiento de estos rubros por ser suelos fértiles.

Ha dedicado parte de su vida a la actividad agrícola y por esto es que  solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas con el fin de mejorar los rendimientos y de esta forma obtener mejores cosechas para brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su amada familia.
texts.en:
José Ángel grows basic grains in El Manzano region where the soil is noted as being suitable for farming because it is fertile soil.

José Ángel has dedicated part of his life to farming and he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies with the aim of improving his yield and thereby obtaining better harvests.  This will enable him to provide his much-loved family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay laborers

loans.name: Mapit Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAPIT SARTASIÑANI” iniciará el decimoquinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora  Bertha.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, comercio de frutas, novedades (guantes y ganchos), artesanía en ropa, comercio de fruta, tienda de barrio, venta de coca, aceitería.
 
La señora Bertha indica que hace dos años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su sobrina. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de artículos de ocasión (venta por temporada) que viene trabajando hace cuarenta años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de artículos varios) los que compra de Oruro y posteriormente lo en las ferias de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones y el préstamo.

En la fotografia no se encuentra la señora Isabel, ya que tuvo consulta médica.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Mapit Sartasiñani” is starting its fifteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Community Center. The group has eight members who are led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Bertha. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses in order to get ahead such as selling food, selling fruit, selling novelties (gloves and hair pins), producing handmade clothing, managing a neighborhood store, selling coca leaves, and producing cooking oil.

Sra. Bertha says that she joined a Communal Bank with Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving a invitation from her niece. She currently has a business selling seasonal merchandise. Bertha has been in this business for 40 years and learned the trade from her mother.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying different goods in Oruro that she will eventually sell at the fairs as a traveling merchant (she does not have a fixed location). Working in this manner allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Bertha is in a common-law relationship and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Bertha says she enjoys the meetings and the loans. In the photograph, Sra. Isabel is not present because she had an appointment at the health clinic.

loans.use: to buy seasonal goods for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has five children ranging from 9 years old to 24 years old. She describes herself as joyous. She operates a café where she cakes and soft drinks. She has been involved in this business for one year and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a residential area. She describes her biggest business challenges to be insufficient capital and seasonality. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of soft drinks and cakes. Her business goal is to own a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more cakes and drinks to sell

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luisa tiene 27 años y vive en el Barrio Hilancrek en el municipio de Tela. Vive en unión libre con su pareja Ventura, lo cual vende frutas y verduras. Ellos tienen dos hijos: un bebe de 1 año y una niña de 8 años, la cual está asistiendo a la escuela. 

Maria Luisa dirige una glorieta donde sirve comida rápida como taquitos, baleadas, enchiladas, pastelitos y refrescos, jugos, golosinas, granos básicos, verduras y carnes. Ella trabaja de las 6:10 de la mañana hasta las 7:00 de la noche, sirviendo su clientela. Empezó la glorieta en noviembre del 2010. Antes, Maria Luisa trabajaba por una compañía pero le sacaron. Ella decidió poner su negocio propio para no tener que depender de un trabajo. 

Solicitó un crédito de L8,000, lo cual es su primer crédito. Lo va a invertir en su inventario, comprando refrescos, granos, verduras y carnes. Ella procurará mantener un buen récord de crédito para tener la posibilidad de sacar otros créditos con ODEF. Maria Luisa desea ahorrar sus ganancias para poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa, age 27, lives in the Hilancrek neighborhood in the Tela municipality.  She is in a common-law- marriage with her life partner, Ventura, who sells fruits and vegetables.  They have two children; a one year old baby and an eight year old daughter.  The eight year old goes to school.

Maria Luisa runs a kiosk where she serves fast food like taquitos, “baleadas” [the basic baleada is a thick flour tortilla folded in half containing refried beans and grated queso duro (a hard salty white cheese)], enchiladas, pastries, soft drinks, juice, sweets, basic grains, vegetables and meat.  She works from 6:10 in the morning until 7:00 at night waiting on her customers.  She started the kiosk in November of  2010.

Before that Maria Luisa worked for a company, but they let her go.  She decided to establish her own business so that she would not be dependent upon a job.

She requested her first loan for 8,000 lempiras.  She will use it to invest in her inventory by purchasing soft drinks, grains, vegetables, and meat.  She will try to maintain a good credit record in order to have the possibility of getting other loans with ODEF.  

Maria Luisa wishes to save her earnings in order to be able to give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, grains, vegetables, and meat.

loans.name: 01 Phú Thọ 3 Phú Sơn 2 Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tám operates a food stall, selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Tám is 50 years old. She is married and has 2 children.
She is the leader of an 8-member group, the 01 Phú Thọ 3- Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group. 
Tám lives with in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Tám joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tám has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tám has been involved in this business for 2 years. The main hardship that Tám faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tám hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to buy a motorbike, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Ayed

texts.en:
Ayed is 48 years old, married, and has three children. He is from Iraq. Ayed is a carpenter.  Since 2007, he has owned a workshop and makes bedrooms and kitchens and repairs old furniture. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He is well known in the surrounding areas.

Ayed is requesting a loan for $2,000, which he will use to purchase an electric cutting machine and new tools for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase an electric cutting machine and new tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Joe-An

texts.en: Joe-An is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Joe-An has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & breads. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & breads. Joe-An has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joe-An hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia believes that obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal. Lilia’s goal in life is to provide a better way of living for her children. She works hard and does her best to gain income to sustain her children's needs. Lilia runs a rice-farming business. She is 49 years of age and married to a policeman. She and her husband are blessed with three children, the fruit of their love. Lilia is lucky because her children are kind and loving. Even though there are obstacles encountered by her family, she is strong enough to face them and strives to move on. Lilia wishes to avail of a loan of 40,000 pesos to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farm. She hopes to maintain the business and gain higher income.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farm

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres  se juntaron  con el objetivo de interiorizarse sobre  los beneficios ofrecido por la Fundación Paraguaya a través de su programa Comité de Mujeres Rurales,  el cual les resultó una excelente oportunidad,  motivo por la cual decidieron conformar el comité.  El comité lleva por nombre Kuña Guapa, debido a que se consideran personas muy trabajadoras, quienes se comprometen a mantener unido el grupo, actualmente se encuentran en el  tercer ciclo.
Una de esas mujeres es la señora Josefina, quien nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas, ella dice que su trabajo le gusta mucho ya que es digno y honesto. Gracias a esto ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella desea poder seguir creciendo, para que de esa forma siga ayudando a su familia.
Rlla solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Twelve women got together with the object of learning more about the benefits offered by Fundación Paraguaya through the Rural Women's Committee program. It seemed to them an excellent opportunity, and so they decided to form the committee. The committee has as its name Kuña Guapa given that they considere themselves to be very hardworking people who are committed to keeping the group close. Currently they are in their third loan cycle. 

One of the women is Ms. Josefina, who comments to us that she devotes herself to the sale of all kinds of clothing. She says she likes the work very much since it is dignified and honest. Thanks to this she has been able to get ahead and help her family. She wishes to continue growing in order to be able to continue helping her family. 

She requests the loan for the purchase of summer clothing with which to stock up and provide greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing for later sale.

loans.name: Tchekpemi Victorine

texts.fr: Âgée de 28 ans, Tchekpemi Victorine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Tchekpemi Victorine est mariée à un matelassier du nom de Augustin. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Tchekpemi Victorine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Tchekpemi Victorine vend du charbon de bois à son domicile depuis six ans ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Tchekpemi Victorine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Tchekpemi Victorine sollicite une première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du charbon de bois.

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es: Jessica tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene un hijo David de 5 años de edad estudia en una escuela gratuita del sector, vive con su mamá y sus dos hermanos, hace 5 años empezó a trabajar vendiendo ropa ha transformado a sus vecinos, amigos, conocidos, en potenciales clientes, Jesssica necesita el dinero para comprar mercadería obtener ganancias para poder pagar sus estudios aspira ser una estilista y sacar a su pequeño hijo adelante.
texts.en:
Jesica is 23 years old and a single mother to a five year old son, David, who attends a free school in the area. She lives with her mother and her two brothers.

Five years ago, she started to sell clothing and her neighbors, friends, and acquaintances became potential customers. Jesica needs money to purchase merchandise so she can earn income to be able to pay for her studies. She hopes to become a stylist and provide a successful future for her young son.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: C. is married with three children.He lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam.The area is well known for residents engaging themselves in animal keeping.C. sells animal feeds to these animal keepers.He buys by-products of maize,cotton,palm carnels,sunflowers and other cereals and packs them in bags of 5kgs and 10 kgs ready for resale.C. is planning to expand his business by adding to stock some other types of animal feeds.He also need a bicycle of which he will use to ferry  products purchased by his customers to their premises as an after sale service.C. also keeps layers of which his wife is in-charge.He is planning to add the flock of these layers to subsidize his income in order to meet family requirements as well as school fees for his children. To meet his expectation C. is in need of USD 550.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Wenih

texts.en:
Wenih, 40 years old, has four children, age 20, 17, 9 and 6. She is smart enough, because beside being a farmer, with her husband, she also runs her business selling scraps and raise ducks. She would spend some of the $ 50 loan to buy 9 (nine) ducks. She expects to elevate her earnings since she could only afford to send all of her children to primary school.

Translated from Bahasa by Chairuddin, Kiva Volunteer.

Wenih 40 tahun mempunyai 4 orang anak, berusia 20, 17, 9 dan 6. Dia sangat pintar, karena selain menjadi petani, dia juga mempunyai usaha lainnya yaitu menjual barang-barang bekas yang dikelola oleh suaminya Mulyadi dan juga berternak bebek. Dari pinjaman yang diterimanya sebesar $50 sebagian digunakan untuk membeli 9 ekor bebek. Dia berharap dapat memperoleh pendapatan yang lebih besar lagi karena semua anaknya hanya bersekolah sampai tingkat sekolah dasar saja.

loans.use:
Selling scraps and Herbal Medicine

Jual Rongsokan dan Obat-obatan

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Daniel will use the loan to expand and diversify his business

loans.name: Carla Deyanira

texts.es:
Responsibility and enthusiasm are traits that Carla possess. She is married and is the mother of three children ages: 3, 5, and 8 years old. Her husband works in construction and with his salary they were unable to cover all the family needs.

Aftr the birth of their third child, the household expenses increased considerably. Since Carla is an entrepreneurial woman, she started her own business selling cheeses and "chorizos"(sausages) to help her husband with the debts. She started buying and re-selling these products but now she is able to buy them directly from the wholesaler. It has help her to increase her profits.

Carla wishes that her business grows and she is asking now for a $1,100 dollars loan. She will use it for buying merchandise to cover her customers' demands and continue offering the preferred products. She offers to return the amount back in 6 months. Be part of this business! Help by improving the life of this family. They thank you very much for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Responsabilidad y entusiasmo son características que posee Carla. Ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 3, 5 y 8 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en la construcción y con su salario no se podían cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia.

Después del nacimiento de su tercer hijo los gastos de su hogar se incrementaron considerablemente, y como Carla es una mujer emprendedora inició su propio negocio con la venta de quesos y chorizos para poder ayudar a su esposo con las deudas. Inició comprando y revendiendo estos productos pero ahora se surte directo del proveedor lo que le ha ayudado a mejorar sus ganancias.

Carla desea que su negocio crezca y ahora está solicitando un préstamo por $1,100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia. Ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de este negocio, ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her cheese and sausage shop.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 44 and has seven children. Like other women in her village, she specializes in embroidery. Her work is held in much esteem. She sells her embroidery to neighbors who travel to tourist areas in Chiapas to sell it. Juana belongs to the Espina 2 cooperative along with Basilia Montejo Gómez. They will use this loan to buy materials for embroidery.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

JUANA, tiene 44 años, siete hijos, ella trabaja la artesanía al igual que todas las mujeres de su comunidad ya que sus productos bordados son muy apetecidos por los turistas que visitan la zona .Ella vende sus artesanías a personas de su comunidad las cuales posteriormente viajan a las zonas turísticas del Estado y ahí ofrecen sus prendas a los extranjeros que visitan la localidad. Pertenece al grupo Espina 2 junto con doña Basilia Montejo Gómez (artesana) Invertirán sus prestamos en materiales para la confección de sus productos.

loans.use: To buy thread and cloth for embroidery.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Born on 31 December 1972 in Lomé, Mr. Kossi ATSU abandoned his secondary studies very early and began as an apprentice tailor for men's and women's clothing, due to his parents' lack of means. A widower with 6 people in his care, he has become a master tailor as a result of his efforts over the past 15 years. He supports his household alone with a small income. He has problems with his sewing and haberdashery equipment and would like to enlarge his workshop. Thus, he is asking for a loan of $800 to realize this project. Providing him this financial support will contribute to the improvement of Mr. Kossi ATSU's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 31 décembre 1972 à Lomé, Mr ATSU Kossi a vite abandonné les bancs aux cours secondaires et s’est lancé dans l’apprentissage de couture homme dame à cause de manque de moyens des parents. Veuf et ayant 06 personnes à sa charge, il est devenu aujourd’hui maître tailleur résultats de ses efforts depuis 15 ans. Il est seul a supporté les charges avec un revenu très peu. Il a des problèmes de machines à coudre, de mercerie et veut élargir son atelier. Pour cela il désire un crédit de 800 dollars pour réaliser son projet. Lui accorder des concours financiers, c’est contribuer à améliorer les conditions de vie de Mr ATSU Kossi.

loans.use: To buy sewing equipment

loans.name: Nuraddin

texts.en: Nuraddin is a father of three children. He and his family live in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He has a farming business, where he grows vines. 8 years ago he started this business to meet the demands of his family. Nuraddin needs a loan of $1200 to buy  vine props for getting a rich yield.

loans.use: to buy vine props

loans.name: Eridania

texts.en:
When Eridania start selling fried vegetables and sandwiches a few years ago, she didn’t really think that it was a viable business.  In fact, she didn’t have money to buy raw materials to prepare the goods.  As a result, she sadly ceased that activity three months later.
The entrepreneur, nonetheless, didn’t give up and kept looking for funds until she met our organization and took a loan which allowed her to reestablish her business.  Eridania used her loan wisely and her small open-air cafeteria has been successful.  She is repaying the initial loan and is serving meals to a lot of people in her community.
Eridania explains that her ultiumate dream is to have a big, spacious and comfortable cafeteria where she can attend to many people daily and greatly increase her income.  With this loan, she will purchase raw materials for her sandwiches.  She will also buy disposable plastic dishes to serve the food on.  Given the loan, Eridania will be one step closer to realizing her dream.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to continue producing food for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Slyvia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbozi, Tanzania! This is 27 year old Slyvia T.. In 2006, Slyvia established a pharmacy business, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of medicine. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed ‘un-creditworthy’ by financial institutions due to a lack of tangible collateral assets. Poor financial support results in poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a ‘sale and leaseback arrangement’.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of medicine in bulk.

loans.name: Esther Tanzanite Group

texts.en:
Esther A. , age 30, has got a child of ten. She has a beauty salon which she began 4 years ago. She works from 7:30am to 10pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around US$ 258.

In the past, Esther has taken out two loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy salon equipment. She hopes for a new loan to start a secretarial service. Esther will share this loan with her subgroup members who have shops, sell coconuts and have a butchery.

In the picture Esther is in the middle back row.

loans.use: to buy a printer and start a secretarial service

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
In her home Marcelina manages as mother and father to her 4 children, but this task isn't difficult for her since she has always shown herself to be a very dedicated and hard-working, and above all, responsible person. For several years she performed various jobs with the aim that her kids not have economic limitations and receive a good education. Now that her children are adolescents and very entrepreneurial they decided to open a restaurant in which they all work to provide good service to their clients. At first the investment they had made in the restaurant didn't seem to be worthwhile due to the inadequate location of the place but little by little, with patience, much dedication and diligence it became more popular. Currently, thanks to the economic benefits she is obtaining, she is managing to pay for the studies of her children and above all recovering the economic security that her family sometimes lacked.

In this occasion Marcelina asks you to open your heart to receive her request of a loan that she will use to buy the ingredients for her delicious stews at wholesale prices.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelina dentro de su hogar se desenvuelve como padre y madre para sus 4 hijos, esta labor no es difícil para ella, debido a que siempre demostró ser una persona muy dedicada, trabajadora y sobre todo responsable. Durante varios años desempeñó diversas actividades con el fin de que sus retoños no pasen limitaciones económicas y puedan recibir una buena educación.Ahora que sus hijos son adolescentes y muy emprendedores decidieron abrir un restaurante en el que todos trabajan para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes; a principio la inversión que habían hecho en este restaurante no parecía ser muy rentable por la inadecuada ubicación de su local pero poco a poco con paciencia, mucho empeño y diligencia fue haciéndose muy popular.Actualmente gracias a los beneficios económicos que obtiene está logrando pagar los estudios de sus hijos y sobre todo recobrando la tranquilidad económica que en alguna oportunidad padeció su familia.En esta oportunidad doña Marcelina desea tocar la puerta de vuestro buen corazón para hacerte la petición de un préstamo que invertirá para adquirir insumos al por mayor para la preparación de sus deliciosos potajes.

loans.use: Buying a larger quantity of non-perishible items for her stews

loans.name: Hadiya's Nia Moja Group

texts.en:
Hadiya is a 45 year old widow with a 20 year old child. She sells fish from 7 A.M. to 10 P.M. daily. From this business, she makes a monthly profit of about $90.

Hadiya hopes for a loan to purchase more fish to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members belong to group Nia Moja. These members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Melvin Antonio

texts.es:
Melvin, a youthful man, is requesting a loan in order to invest in the improvement of his home, specifically, the construction of a bedroom. He has worked for the Rafaela Herrera School in the La Fonseca neighborhood for 7 years. This young man has a 6-year old son who is currently in pre-school. Every day Melvin rides his horse for two hours to another region in order to impart the bread of knowledge to peasant children of the area. His dream is to have a stable job and a dignified home with all the basic conditions any person would want. He is recognized in the La Fonseca de Nueva Guinea neighborhood as a responsible and friendly person.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El joven Melvin esta solicitando financiamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como lo es la construccion de una habitacion. Labora para la Escuela Rafaela Herrera en la colonia La Fonseca desde hace 7 años; este joven tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, el que está estudiando su pre-escolar. Melvin todos los dias viaja 2 horas montado a caballo a una comarca a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos del lugar. Su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral y una vivienda digna con todas las condiciones básicas como todo ciudadano aspira; él es una persona reconocida en la Colonia La Fonseca de Nueva Guinea por ser responsable y sociable.

loans.use: Build a bedroom for his home

loans.name: Thi Minh's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. D. Thi Minh (ID number: 13050028) is 24 years old. Though young, she is very active and diligent. She lives with her husband, her parents-in-law and her three young children. Her husband works as a plumber. Apart from managing the general store at home, Mrs. Minh also performs agricultural tasks. Her family's income is quite stable at 200,000VND per day (about 13USD). She has never borrowed from anywhere else, but because she likes the fact that she can repay on an installment basis through this Fund, she would like to borrow 2,006,000VND to expand her store. Her group also consists of:

Mrs. D. Thi Duyen (ID number: 13050027), borrows 2,006,000VND to invest in her souvenir shop.

Mrs. N. Thi Quynh (ID number: 13050029), borrows 2,006,000VND for her husband to purchase more woods to make furniture.

Mrs. D. Thi Hien (ID number: 13050030), borrows 2,006,000VND for her husband to expand his construction business.

Mrs. N. Thi Hanh (ID number: 13050031), borrows 2,006,000VND to purchase more stocks for her grocery store.

The total amount requested is 600USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đinh Thị Minh (MS: 13050028), năm nay 24 tuổi. Là người còn trẻ nhưng chị rất năng động và chăm chỉ. Vợ chồng chị sống cùng bố mẹ chồng và ba con nhỏ. Chồng chị là thợ lắp điện nước. Chị ngoài việc bán hàng tạp hóa tại nhà, chị còn làm ruộng. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khá ổn định khoảng 200.000 VND/ ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu nhưng vì thích hình thức tiết kiệm để hoàn trả của chương trình nên đã tham gia vay 2.006.000 VND để mở rộng của hàng. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm là: Chị Đinh Thị Duyên (MS: 13050027), vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn mở rộng của hàng bán hàng lưu niệm. Chị Nguyễn Thị Quỳnh (MS: 13050029), vay 2.006.000 VND để chồng chị mua gỗ đóng bàn ghế bán. Chị Đinh Thị Hiền (MS: 13050030), vay 2.006.000 VND để chồng chị phát triển nghề xây dựng. Chị Nghiêm Thị Thanh (MS: 13050031), vay 2.006.000 VND để buôn bán mỳ, giá, đỗ.

loans.use: Retail

loans.name: Liliana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Liliana started her business because she couldn’t count on anyone’s support financially, and she had to make sure her children could get ahead. So, she decided to start a business that would allow her to still care for them. She started a little over a year ago selling clothing outside of her house. Currently, she sells her merchandise in the markets near her house as well as from her home.

She needs a loan of $525 USD, to be repaid over six months, to stock her store with merchandise so that her enterprise will continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana inició el negocio debido a que no cuenta con la ayuda económica de nadie y ella tenia que sacar adelante a sus hijos decidió iniciar un negocio que le permitiera a la vez cuidar de ellos. Comenzó hace poco más de 1 año vendiendo ropa afuera de su casa y actualmente vende en los mercaditos cercanos a su casa y en su domicilio también.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $525 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir mercancía para que su negocio siga creciendo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana M. is hoping to take out her first loan, a small one, with NGO GHAPE in the town of Bamenda. She lives in Cameroon's North West province and has five children, four of whom are still at home. Susana would like to use the money to expand the output of her farm. Specifically, she plans to till the land and buy seedlings to plant; she also intends to buy five chicks to raise for meat. She says that with the increased income this will generate, she would like to help her children to start out in work. Eventually, she would also like to build a house and save some money to fall back on should she ever get sick.

loans.use: Purchase of seedlings and chicks.

loans.name: Reyna Gloria

texts.es:
Reyna inicio el negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo por que lo que gana es muy poco y no les alcanza. Además de tener la preocupación de su esposo que trabaja mucho y esta enfermo de diabetes, por eso emprendió su negocio de venta de regalos, con las ganancias de este, los gastos son menos y puede solventar los pagos de los estudios de sus hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses el cual la va a ayudar en comprar más mercancía para tener un mejor surtido en el negocio y así incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Reyna started her business so she could help her husband out as he earns very little and it is not enough for them. Moreover she worries about her husband who works a lot and has diabetes, and this is why she started her business selling gifts and souvenirs, and with her earnings from this they spend less and they can afford to pay for their kids' education.

She needs a loan of $550 which she will repay over a period of 6 months which will help her buy more merchandise to have a better stocked business and thereby increase her sales.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise/comprar mercania

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima has been cooking food and selling miscellaneous food items in Zanzibar for ten years. She works daily from 7:00am to 7:00pm and earns a profit of approximately $50 each month. She is taking out her first loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to expand her inventory and increase sales.

Halima is 31 years old, married, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients and food items to sell.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Якубова Мухайе жительница города Курган-тюбе. Разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Живут вдвоем. Занимается бизнесом. торгует детской одеждой. Стаж работы  уже 5 лет. Решила получить кредит для того, чтобы завезти сезонный товар. Привозит товар из города Душанбе. Скупает товар на оптовом рынке. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhayo Y. lives in the city of Kurgan-Tube. She is divorced and lives with her one child. She has a business selling children's clothing, and already has five years of experience. She decided to request a loan to purchase the new season's goods, which are brought from the city Dushanbe. She buys the goods wholesale. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of the season's clothing

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is fifty-nine year old Martha M. from Mwanza. She is widowed with four children, between the ages of twenty and thirty. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants who are orphans.

Martha has been running a shop selling different commodities since 2005. This client’s business is in selling maize flour, Kilimanjaro beer, Konyagi beer, cooking oil, wheat flour, margarine, soaps, and sugar. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week. Martha currently earns about 200 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to buy more stock of beer for resale. In the future, she plans to increase the range and amount of stock. Martha thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of beer for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane K. is currently in the business of selling carcoals and is requesting a loan to expand the business.  Jane is 45 years old and is Widowed. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. BRAC encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Pili

texts.en: Pili M. runs a beautiful salon at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She has the most clients over the weekend, from Thursday to Sunday, when most of the women are cerebrating the weekend. Dar es Salaam is hot, so  the salon is a very good business because there is a great demand for this service. Pili M. purchases the supplies for the salon from the big shops in Kariakoo. She is requesting a loan of $775 (1,000,000 TZS) to buy hair dryers.

loans.use: Buy hair dryers for the salon

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Акобирова Насиба проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Имеет два вида деятельности. Занимается торговлей тканями и одеждой, а так же занимается пошивом национальной одежды. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы использовать его в торговли и увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nasiba A. lives in the Jalollidini Rumi region of Tajikistan. She is involved in two types of activity. She sells fabric and clothing and she also makes traditional clothing. Nasiba plans to get a loan for increasing cash flow. She would repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara tiene 37 años, vive con su hija de 8 años en casa de sus padres. Tiene un restaurante que abrió hace 3 años en un local que arrendó en una zona comercial de su localidad, y con la ayuda de su madre frece todos los días la atención en desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Por las mañanas trabaja como profesora en una escuela cercana a su casa y por las tardes se dedica a tender su establecimiento, para Clara, tener este negocio le ha permitido tener más ingresos de los que tiene como profesora y esto le permite solventar la educación de su hija, que es lo que le satisface de haber emprendido este negocio, además, le es rentable porque un restaurante siempre tiene demanda y sobre todo en horas del almuerzo. Ahora Clara desea ampliar su negocio y mejorarlo para vender mayor cantidad de platos de comidas. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada de trabajar en su banco comunal y le agrada más porque están formando lazos de amistad muy estrechos. El dinero que está solicitando es para invertirlo en la compra de espejos que decorarán su establecimiento, manteles de mesa y víveres no perecibles para la preparación de sus comidas; como sacos de arroz, menestras, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
Clara is 37 years old and she lives with her 8 year old daughter in her parents’ home. She has a restaurant that opened 3 years ago in a location that she rented in a commercial zone of her area. With the help of her mother she offers breakfasts, lunches and dinners at her restaurant everyday. In the mornings she works as a teacher in a school that is close to her home and in the afternoons she tends to her establishment.

For Clara, having this business has allowed her to make more income than she would make as a teacher alone. This extra income permits her to fund her daughter’s education, which is what satisfies her most about running her business. Additionally, her business is profitable because a restaurant is always in demand, especially during the lunchtime hours.

Now Clara desires to increase and better her business to sell a larger quantity of meals. This is the first time that she has a loan with MFP, and she is very enthusiastic to work with her communal bank and is even more pleased because they are forming strong friendship bonds. The money that she is soliciting is for investing in the purchase of mirrors that will decorate her establishment, tablecloths and non-perishable supplies for the preparation of food; such as sacks of rice, vegetable stews and sugar among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve decor of her restaurant and to buy non-perishable foods for the preparation of foods.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
la Sra. Blanca se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser pastelitos, tacos, tajaditas de platano fritas, pollo, refrescos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años, ella comienza a vender desde las 4 de la tarde todos los dias, ella tiene muchos clientes ya que a la mayoria de ellos les gusta mucho el sabor de sus comidas, por la mañana ella quiere dedicarse a vender ropa en la cual ya compro un fardo pero necesita comprar mas para tener mayor variedad y asi poder tener dos negocios de los cuales ella pueda sacar muchas ganancias para tener una vida descente.
ella ha logrado salir sola con sus hijos ya que su esposo fallecio.
ella solicita el apoyo economico para poder invertir y poder comprar los fardos de ropa usada, tambien necesita comprar ingredientes para la fabricacion de sus golosinas
texts.en:
Blanca sells sweets like cakes, tacos, plantain chips, chicken, and beverages, and has been in this business for 15 years. She begins selling each day at 4:00 in the afternoon. She has many customers because the majority of them like the taste of her meals. In the morning she would like to sell clothing, and she has already purchased one bundle of clothes, but needs to purchase more in order to have a wider selection. It is thus possible to have two businesses from which she can earn a good profit in order to have a decent life. Blanca has managed as a single parent due to the death of her husband. She is requesting economic assistance in order to invest in the purchase of used clothing. She also needs to buy ingredients for making her treats.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages, cups, plates, napkins, meat, potatoes, cabbage, salsa, salt, oil, butter, flour, and tortillas

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en: This is Abdul Rahman K.. Abdul was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. He is thirty-five years old and married to a businesswoman. They have four children. Abdul has been selling cosmetics for over ten years. This will be his fourth loan from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a lot of improvements in the business and the personal life of this entrepreneur. Having repaid his last loan successfully, he is requesting a new loan of $325 to help him strengthen his business.

loans.use: Invest in his cosmetics business

loans.name: Gladys Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Gladys A. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante y por encargo, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, es casada  tien un hijo el que esta bien pequeño, tambien trabaja como docente en el Centro Educativo Rafael Pineda Ponce en su tiempo libre se dedica a distribuir su mercaderia.
ya que la situacion en esta zona es muy critica y el dinero no ajusta para cubrir con todos los gastos necesarios para mantener a su hijo que esta pequeño.
Actualmente ella esta solicitando un credito para comprar mas ropa,  ya que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda existente. Ella siempre a querido tener su propio local y esta luchando por  montarlo y que los clientes pueden llegar a efectuar sus compras. ha podido mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Gladys A. works in retail. She has her own clothing and shoe business. She has been working both as a street vendor and by order for several years. She is married and has a young son. She also works as a teacher at the Rafael Pineda Ponce Educational Center. During her free time, she distributes her merchandise because the situation in her area is very difficult and she does not have enough money to cover all of her son’s expenses. She is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase more clothing because she does not have enough capital to meet customer demand. She has always wanted to have her own business space, and she is struggling to set it up so that her customers can come and make purchases. She has been able to improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulk clothing and shoes

loans.name: Ramon Ismael

texts.es: Ramón Ismael J. tiene 49 años de edad, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Ramón es ofrecer los servicios de soldadura. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es conocer a nuevas personas y brindar el mejor servicio. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar herramientas soldador de gas, delantal, manoplas y tenazas torno. El humilde sueño de Ramón es poseer un taller con todas las herramientas necesarias ya que es por medio de ellas que logra realizar las construcciones.
texts.en:
Ramón Ismael J. is a married 49-year-old father of 2 children who are currently in school. Ramón offers welding services for a living. He has been in this business for over 5 years. What he most likes about his job is meeting new people and offering the best service. The loan that he is requesting will be used as business capital to purchase tools, gas soldering iron, apron, gloves, tongs, and a lathe. Ramón’s humble dream is to own a workshop with all the necessary welding tools because he needs them to get his projects done.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Abdelhady

texts.en: AbdelHady is a 40-year-old married man living with his two children who are still in school. In 2001, AbdelHady decided to open his own roastery, currently named "A. Esaily Roastery," which was a good addition to the surrounding villages. Today, AbdelHady is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 7 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de comida típica de su zona, la cual está hecha a base de carne de cerdo y de oveja que ella misma cría en su establo desde hace 10 años. Pero Carmen se inició vendiendo estos platillos hace 26 años con muy poco capital, comprando apenas unos kilos de carne y con el tiempo y sus ahorros pudo adquirir sus propios animales. Diariamente por las mañanas cuida y limpia a sus animales, ya que por las tardes y los fines de semana se ocupa de preparar la comida y de venderla en las principales calles, festividades o cualquier evento social de su localidad. Con el paso del tiempo ha notado el resultado de su esfuerzo en las ganancias  satisfactorias que obtiene, por lo que desea seguir trabajando en este tipo de negocio y adquirir más animales que le permitan mayores ganancias. Esta es la octava vez que Carmen tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es muy solidaria y emprendedora en el banco comunal que integra y desea seguir adelante en el trabajo con su grupo. El dinero que ahora está solicitando será invertido en la compra de cerdos y ovejas en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Carmen is 47 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her 7 children. She sells food typical to the region which she makes using pork and sheep meat that she has been raising herself in her stable for 10 years. Carmen began selling these dishes 26 years ago with very little money, buying only a few kilos of meat and over time, with her savings, she was able to buy her own animals. Each morning, she cleans and takes care of her animals because she spends the afternoons and weekends preparing the food and selling it on the main streets, at festivities, or at any social event in her area. Over time, she has noticed the results of her efforts in the satisfactory earnings that she has obtained. As a result, she wants to continue working in this type of business and purchase more animals that will provide her with larger earnings. This is Carmen’s eighth loan with MFP. She is very supportive and enterprising at the communal bank and she hopes to continue moving forward with her group. The money that she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of wholesale pigs and sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more animals

loans.name: Progressive Youths Group

texts.en: Sunnyboy is a high-school dropout due to financial constraints. He doesn’t have any children but has one extended family member as a sibling. He’s involved in the sale of rice at retail prices, a business which he has been in for the past four years within the waterside market area. He’s successful due to good manners when approaching his customers and because he also offers a lower cost sometimes if there is a need. He dreams of a bigger business to help continue his education.

loans.use: Buy goods wholesale and sell retail

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu C. sells green vegetables and bananas and is requesting a loan in order to purchase more bananas to sell. Dudu is a mother of two children, 40 years old, and married to a soldier. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, edu

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Pricela

texts.en:
Pricela O. is from the village of Eastern Looc. She is 47 years old. Pricela is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Pricela sells specialty food products in the local community. Pricela has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Pricela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pricela successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC that she used to purchase raw ingredients.

Pricela is requesting her 6th loan from PMPC, for 8000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory and generate working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Odimafo Nti Group

texts.en: Veronica is forty-five years old and married with seven children, who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Veronica is a food vendor. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Odimafo nti’, meaning "because of the redeemer". The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes travel to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: La Suerte Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Suerte esta conformados por mujeres que trabajan por embellecer a sus clientes. Hoy en día la imagen de una persona es de mucha importancia y el cuidado de esta es prioridad tanto para hombres como para mujeres.

Esto lo tienen presente las integrantes de este grupo que trabajan en rubro de la belleza empezando por la coordinadora Sonia Claribel B. quien vende cosméticos por catalogo, seguida por Meyvi María R. S. vende productos Avon y Lissette del Socorro N. que hace manicure, pedicura,  tintes, alisados y peinados de todo tipo.

loans.use: comprar cosmeticos como lapiz labial, delineador, cremas etc

loans.name: Tomas Facitela

texts.pt:
Tomas Facitela M. nasceu em Inhambane tem 35 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de três filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 1 aos 7 anos, o mais velho é que vai a escola. Para além não responsabiliza se por ninguém e consegue poupar 1.500.00MT ao mês, conta com ajuda do de um empregado dando lhe um valor de 1.000.00MT mensalmente.


Tomas sai Inhambane quando tinha 10 anos com seu tio para Suazilândia onde estudou ate a 8ª classe teve que interromper os estudos após a morte do seu tio. Sendo assim ele arranja um emprego nas Minas da África do Sul onde trabalhou num contrato de 5 anos, findo o contracto é indemnizado um valor de 80.000.00MT consecutivamente regressa a Moçambique e instala a sua residência em Namaacha na Fronteira de Suazilândia, e adquire uma carrinha que lhe facilita nos seus trabalhos diários. Hoje é vendedor ambulante (vende no carro) a mais de cinco anos tem vendido no mercado informal duas vazes por semana (quarta e sábado) das 7h às 17h tendo como melhor produto (farinha de milho, fruit, Omo e óleo vegetal) adquirido na vizinha Suazilândia comprando uma mercadoria de 20.000.00MT por viagem e tendo de lucro 5.500.00MT por mês. Aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00MT para aumentar o volume dos seus produtos para satisfazer a necessidade dos clientes.


Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Tomas na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 15.000.00MT serão usados para aumentar o volume dos seus produtos, esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para construção do seu próprio estabelecimento e deixar de ser ambulante.
texts.en:
Tomas Facitela M. was born in Inhambane. He is 35 years old, married, and the father of 3 children with ages between 1 and 7 years old. The oldest is in school. Besides them he is not responsible for anyone else and is able to save 1,500MT each month. He counts on the help of an employee and pays him 1,000MT monthly. Tomas left Inhambane when he was 10 years old with his uncle to Swaziland where he went to school through the 8th grade. He had to interrupt his schooling after the death of his uncle. As such he was able to arrange a job in the mines of South Africa where he worked on a contract for 5 years. At the end of the contract he was compensated 80,000MT and consecutively he returned to Mozambique to set up his residence in Namaacha on the border of Swaziland. He acquired a wagon to help him with his daily work. Today he is a traveling vendor (sells from his car). For more than 5 years he has sold at the informal market two times week (Wednesday and Saturday) from 7:00am until 5:00pm. His best products are (corn flour, fruit, Omo, and vegetable oil) which he acquires in neighboring Swaziland. He purchases his goods for 20,000MT per visit, and he earns 5,500MT per month. He approached Hluvuku and solicited a loan for 15,000MT to purchase more products and satisfy the demand of his customers. This is Tomas' first loan through Hluvuku and Kiva for 15,000MT which will be used to purchase more products. He is confident that he will pay the loan off before the due date so he can request a new loan to construct his own establishment and cease being mobile.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sell grocery store products

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es: Oswaldo es casado, tiene una bebe, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido del bebe,  esta solicitando  su 2do credito para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es comprar zinc para cambiar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado, se desempeña como docente de primaria, ama su trabajo ya que ha ayudado a niños campesinos de la comarca San Pablo, a pesar que el profesor Oswaldo ya no vive con su  ancianita mamá siempre sigue al pendiente de ella ya son una familia  muy unida, es un Joven con mucha responsabilidad, honesto, trabajador y muy querido por los pobladores de su  comunidad,el se siente agradecido con AFODENIC ya que con el credito anterior logro terminar su casa, aspira para el proximo año seguir estudiando  su sueño es tener trabajo para sacar a su hijo adelante  para que a su familia no le falte nada y salud.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is married, has a baby, and his wife takes care of the household chores and caring for the baby. He is soliciting his second loan to invest in home improvements, like buying zinc for a new roof, since his current one is in poor repair. He works as a primary school teacher and he loves his work because he has helped rural children from the San Pablo region. Also, despite the fact that Oswaldo no longer lives with his elderly mother, he continues to devote himself to her – they are a very tight family. He is very responsible, honest, hard-working, and well-liked by the inhabitants of his community. He feels grateful to AFODENIC, because with the previous loan he was able to finish his house. He hopes to continue studying next year, and his dream is have a job that can allow his child to prosper, his family to be healthy and for them to never go without.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc

loans.name: Myraflor

texts.en:
Myraflor T. is from the village of Zone 4, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 22 years old. Myraflor is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Myraflor owns and operates a business venture running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling alacarte (grilled meat) pork products in the local community. Myraflor has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Myraflor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myraflor is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Myraflor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
