Rice farming is the source of living of Rosie from Surallah, South Cotabato. She is 39 years old and has three children, her eldest being 19 years old. She wants her children to finish their studies to enable them to have a better life.

Rosie joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan for her business. She would like to request 15,000 Php to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.en: For forty years Juan has made saddles and accessories for horses. He learned the trade from his father when he was fourteen years old. Juan and his wife have three children ages 7, 10 and 15.  They are all in school. Juan has a long credit history with Fundación León 2000.  This is his ninth loan. All of his loans have gone towards improving his workshop and tools. He dreams that his children will be able to grow up and have professional careers. Juan reports that at the moment the family is dealing with the illness of his eldest daughter.

loans.use: improve workshop and purchase tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase supplies and to build a chicken coop

loans.name: Mr. Den Mao Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. D. M. is 61 years old. He is the president of a 20-member village bank group located in Anlong Romeit Choeng village in Kandal province. He is a village chief and his wife, Mrs. Soat Saiy, is a housewife.  Mr. D. M.'s salary is too low to support his family, so he decided to ask for 800,000 KHR to buy rice for eating. Mrs. Soat Saiy is the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other does housework.

loans.use: To buy rice for eating

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married to Peter Ng'ang'a who is a businessman. She is a mother of three: two sons and a daughter. She stays in Kikuyu which is a semi-urban town on the outskirts of Nairobi.

She operates a beauty shop in Westland’s where she sells beauty products. She has been in this business for the last nine years and she has gained a lot of experience. Her clients are mainly people celebrating weddings and other occasions.

Alice was introduced to KADET by her friend and has not borrowed from other sources. This is her first loan with KADET.  She plans to use the amount of money she has borrowed to expand the beauty shop into a salon.

She intends to operate a bigger business and even a school of beauty.

loans.use: Alice wants to expand her beauty shop into a salon.

loans.name: Américo

texts.en: Américo is 37 years old and married to Silvia, a teacher, who is 34 years old.  The couple has an eight-year-old daughter together.  Previously, Américo made and sold flowerpots, but as business was not good, he abandoned this trade and began to sell milk.  Little by little, he acquired more animals and more clients, and now has sustained a business.  Américo is a repeat client at Fundación Paraguaya.  Through loans, he has been able to purchase animals, support his family and get ahead in life.  He is now seeking a loan to purchase a machine to aid him in milking his cows, as at the moment he milks them all by hand.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to aid in milking cows

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Cristian es un joven muy noble y responsable, tiene 27 años y es cuarto de 9 hermanos, vive en la casa de sus padres y está al pendiente de las necesidades de sus progenitores, ya que es un hijo muy amoroso.

Desde pequeño ha trabajado con mucha responsabilidad en los cultivos, sembrando higos, manzanas y mangos en su pueblo natal. Con el correr de los años sus padres migraron con él y sus hermanos a la ciudad de Lima, por lo que dejó de dedicarse íntegramente a la agricultura y se compró un motocarro. Desde entonces, hace dos años, trabaja brindando servicio de transporte de pasajeros; su labor inicia a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 10 de la noche, de lunes a viernes. En estos dos años se ha acostumbrado a este trabajo, además las buenas ganancias que obtiene lo mantienen con el ánimo de prosperar; por ello, para más adelante va a comprar otro motocarro y lo dará en alquiler para aumentar sus ingresos. 

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y cabe recalcar que es él único varón dentro de su banco comunal, por lo que todas sus compañeras lo engríen y bromean con él. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su motocarro, ya que desde hace un año no le realiza ningún mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Cristian, 27, is a good-hearted, responsible young man; he is the fourth of nine siblings. He lives with his parents and is watchful of their needs, since he is a very loving son. From a very early age, he worked very diligently farming figs, apples and magoes in his native town. As years went by, his parents moved to the city of Lima with him and his siblings. This led him to completely stop farming and he bought a vehicle. Since then, for two years now, he has provided passenger transportation services. His workday begins at 6am and ends at 10pm from Monday through Friday. In these two years he has become accustomed to this work. Besides, the good profits he earns keep him motivated to succeed. He plans to buy another vehicle in the future to lease out to increase his income. This is his 6th loan with MFP. It is important to stress that he is the only male member of his communal bank which leads to his being teased and joked with by the other members. He will use the funds requested to buy spare parts for his car because it's been a year since its last service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Adeola

texts.en:
Adeola owns a restaurant; she sells drinks and cooked food to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in the trade for over 19 years. With the profit from the business she could assist her husband in running the home. Her husband is a civil-servant who works very hard to improve on the welfare of his family. Adeola hopes to expand her business in future, she is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.

Adeola is 42 years old, married with 3 children and live in Lagos Nigeria. She is hard working, she supports her husband in taking good care of his children, like paying of school fees, feeding, clothing and more. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en: Terbish is 50 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Terbish's two daughters, Narantsetseg and Davaadorj, ages 21 and 19 respectively, are university students. During the day, Terbish operates consumer goods and clothing trading and iron products manufacturing businesses in his town. He sells his products at a local market and his business is well known. Terbish has been operating the consumer goods and clothing trading business since 1998, and has been operating his transportation business with his own truck since 1995. During the winter, Terbish transports coal, and during that time his wife sells their products at a local market. Terbish's whole family supports his business, and the general family atmosphere is very good. Furthermore, Terbish is a talented person who manufactures iron household goods and sells them to his customers from his shipping container at a local market.  His business and family are  very important to him and he and his family work hard for a better quality of life. But the most important thing for him is being able to provide a good education for his children. He is requesting a 2,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase more inventory for his consumer and clothing trading business and to purchase necessary materials to manufacture iron products to sell to his many customers.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David L. is 42 years old and married with four children between the ages of 8 and 19 years old. Three of the children are still attending school. He has been a dairy farmer near Litein town in the South Rift Valley of Kenya for ten years and employs two people in the community. He sells his milk at the local market but he says transport to the market is difficult due to the poor roads. He also earns some income from small-scale farming of tea, which he sells through the local Magogosiek Tea Factory.

David completed a previous loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kshs. 40,000 and has now requested this loan for Kshs. 80,000 to purchase a motorbike, primarily to transport his daily milk production to the market. He says that this will ease the transport problem for both his milk and tea and he'll be able to save extra money now spent on transport costs to help his family. 

In the future, David would like to improve his dairy farming so that he can increase production to 50 liters of milk each day.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for milk transport

loans.name: Villa Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA QUIQUIJANA”; Nuestros socios vives en el distrito de Quiquijana perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Honorata; la socia tiene 44 años de edad es natural de Acopata, situado a 10 minutos del distrito de Quiquijana, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 pequeños hijos, Nuestra socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella vende lanas y tintes vegetales; desde hace 6 años atrás, en el distrito de Quiquijana todos los domingos y en las fiestas patronales, Nuestra socia también pertenece al programa juntos, ella participa de este programa de desarrollo con su comunidad campesina, para buscar oportunidades de desarrollo personal, la socia también cría pollos, cuyes y chanchos, ella y su conyugue tienen terrenos de cultivos en los cuales siembran variedades de papa, maíz y habas, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lana de oveja y tintes para teñir las lanas.  

Nuestros socios en su mayoría son agricultores y ganaderos, otros venden granos secos y compra y venta de animales menores y vacunos.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partners belong to the Villa Quiquijana village bank and live in the Quiquijana distsrict in the Quispicanchis province of Cusco, Peru. One of the members is Honorata who is 44 years old and a native of Acopata, a city 10 minutes from Quiquijana. She lives with her partner with whom she has 2 small children. For the past 6 years, she has worked as a retail saleswoman selling wool and vegetable dyes in Quiquijana on Sundays and on the holidays of various patron saints. She also belongs to the "Together" program, a program designed to help rural women find opportunities for personal development. She also raises chicken, guinea pigs, and pigs. She and her partner have land where they grow potatoes, corn and beans. She is seeking this loan to buy wool and dye for the wool. The other group members work primarily in agriculture and raising cattle; others sell dried grain and buy and sell small animals. They are grateful for the support they will receive through these loans and commit to pay their debts on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool and dye for the wools

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna J. is from the village of Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Myrna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to pay the laborers for assisting her in harvesting her crops. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her young crops. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her young crops

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio tiene 50 años es casado y tiene dos hijos. 

Porfirio y su esposa Guillermina tienen un negocio familiar que consiste en traer ropa de la ciudad de Lima. El tipo de ropa que trae son pantalones y casacas. Porfirio nos cuenta que ya son más de 4 años que tiene su negocio y le va muy bien, él pertenece al banco comunal Chaska Ñahui y ya son cinco años que pertenece a este grupo de  emprendedores, se podría decir  que  él es fundador del banco comunal. 

El manifiesta que quiere seguir trabajando con el banco comunal pues le dan un crédito rápido y por ese motivo requiere el préstamo, él va ir a comprar mercadería a la ciudad de Lima y va comprar  casacas y pantalones.
texts.en:
Porfirio is 50, married and has two children. Porfirio and his wife, Guillermina, have a small family business bringing clothing from Lima. The type of clothing he brings is pants and jackets. Porfirio says that they have had this business for more than 4 years and it has gone well. He belongs to the Chaska Ñahui communal bank and has belonged to this group of entrepreneurs for five years. It could be said that he is the founder of the communal bank. He says that he wants to continue working with his communal bank because they give him access to quick credit, which he now requires. He is going to Lima to buy merchandise and to buy jackets and pants.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, such as jackets and pants.

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA LIZBETH G. H. ES ORIGINARIA DE LA  RIBERA ÁNGEL CORZO MUNICIPIO DE COPÍNALA MESCALAPA ESTADO DE CHIAPAS, MÉXICO. CONOCIDO TAMBIÉN  COMO GUADALUPE. TIENE 28 AÑOS DE EDAD ESTUDIO HASTA EL TERCERO DE SECUNDARIA, VIVE EN UNION  LIBRE CON EL SEÑOR JULIO REYES HERENANDEZ  Y  TIENE UNA HIJA PEQUEÑA DE 7 AÑOS DE EDAD.
LIZBET DESDE PEQUEÑA CONOCIO ÉSTA ACTIVIDAD, YA QUE ÉSTE ES UN NEGOCIO FAMILIAR Y SUS PADRES SE DEDICABAN A ÉSTO, ASÍ ELLA Y SU HERMANA FORMARON UNA SOCIEDAD Y TABAJABAN JUNTAS EL NEGOCIO. HACE POCOS AÑOS PASO A SU PROPIEDAD, LA CUAL COMENTA QUE LE HA AYUDADO MUCHO EN SUS INGRESO DE SU HOGAR Y FAMILIA.
SU INSPIRACION POR ESTE TRABAJO ES QUE GRACIAS A ELLO HA  PODIDO SALIR ADELANTE DIA A DIA SIN DAR UN PASO ATRÁS, POR ESO SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO CON FUNDACION REALIDAD A.C. PARA TRABAJARLO Y CON LAS GANACIAS QUE OBTENGA A HORRAR  Y CONSTRUIR UN LOCAL PARA ATENDER MEJOR SUS CLIENTES Y SE SIENTAN CONTENTOS Y SATISFECHOS CON LA ATENCION.
DOÑA LIZBETH PASO A FORMAR PARTE DEL GRUPO POR SU PRIMA LIMNI QUIEN LA INVITO A UNIRSE CON LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES Y DIERON  POR NOMBRE “MARIPOSAS”, LA RAZON  DEL NOMBRE ES POR QUE EN SUS CASA AY CHARQUITOS DE AGUA Y SE JUNTAN MARIPOSAS.

LAS PERSONAS QUE INTEGRAN EL GRUPO MARIPOSAS SON:
*MIRNA A.  H.: EN LA FABRICACION DE BLOCK.
*LIMNI G. P.: VENDE TAMALES  Y ANTOJITOS.
*DELLANIRA VAQUEZ G.: VANTA DE FRUTAS Y LEGUNBRES.
*DOÑA LIZZBETH, LA CUAL SE LETOMO LA HISTORIA AL NEGOCIO DE CARNE.
*EZPERANZA G. H.: TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES.
*MIRENA G. S. QUIEN TIENE UN DEPOSITO DE REFRESCOS.
ES ASI COMO SE CONFORMA ESTE CRUPO Y POR CIERTO ESTA MUY UNIDO.
NOTA: EN LA FOTO APARESE LA AYUDANTE DE LA SEÑORA LIZBETH (ES LA SEÑORA QUE ESTA PESANDO Y CORTANDO LA CARNE),LA AYUDANTE NO ESTA INTEGRADA AL GRUPO, PERO COMO HABÍA CLIENTES NO PODÍAN DEJARLOS ESPERANDO, POR QUE COMO DICE LA SEÑORA LIZBETH, "LOS CLIENTES SON LO MAS IMPORTANTE EN UN NEGOCIO"
texts.en:
Lizbeth G. H. is from the Ángel Corzo shore of the Copínala Mescalapa municipality in the state of Chiapas, México. She is also known as Guadalupe. She is 28 years old, and she went to school until the third year of high school. She lives in a common-law-marriage with Julio Reyes Herenandez, and they have a small seven year old daughter. She has been butchering beef since she was young. She was in a partnership with her sister, and they worked together in the business. After a few years it came into her ownership. She comments that it has really helped her with the home and family income. She is inspired to work because, thanks to the work, she has been able to get ahead day to day without taking a step backwards. That is why she requested a loan with the Fundación Realidad A.C. She will use the loan for work, and with the earnings she gets she will save and build a place. At the place she builds she will be able to better take care of her customers, and they will be happy and satisfied with the service. Lizbeth became part of the group because her cousin, Limni, invited her to join the other members. They named the group “Mariposas” (Butterflies) because in their houses there are pools of water where butterflies gather. The following people are members of the Mariposas Group: Mirna A. H.: Makes blocks Limni G. P.: Sells tamales and snacks Dellanira Vaquez G.: Sells fruits and vegetables Lizbeth, she told her story about her meat business Ezperanza G. H.: Has a grocery store Mirena G. S.: Has a soft drink store That is who makes up the group, and they are assuredly very united. Note: Lizbeth’s helper appears in the photo (she is the woman weighing and cutting the meat). Her helper is not in the group. Because there were customers, they could not let them wait. As Lizbeth says, “The customers are the most important thing in a business”.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for butchering meat an ingredients for pastries

loans.name: Sajida Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Sajida perveen has spent all of her life in a small city called Borewala in Pakistan. She is the mother of two children but neither of them could get an education due to poor financial circumstances. Her husband is a motor mechanic and she supports her husband by doing domestic-sewing work. 

Sajida is applying for a loan from Asasah for her father who is involved in an animal-selling business. With the help of loan assistance, she is hopeful that her father will be able to increase his income by purchasing more animals and selling them for a profit.

This is Sajida’s fourth year with Asasah. In the last three years, Sajida has never given any complaints regarding repayments and has maintained a good credit behavior with Asasah. She is hopeful that this will also be a profitable experience for her family as always.

loans.use: To enable her father to purchase more animals to sell

loans.name: Lovisa

texts.en:
N. Lovisa is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala East region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Lovisa has a business selling fish, which she has had for 5 years.    

To help expand her business, Lovisa is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more fish.  Lovisa plans to use the loan in order to expand her business and generate profit in order to change her style of living.  In the future, Lovisa hopes to own a big hotel.



Note to lenders: 

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Milagro del Socorro C. L. vende frutas en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Masaya, ella compra al por mayor distinta variedad de frutas en dependencia de la temporada (mango, limón, naranja, naranja agria, melocotón, etc.) y las vende al menudeo; tiene ya 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad económica y utilizará el crédito para la compra de aguacates y otras frutas.
texts.en:
Doña Milagro del Socorro C. L. sells fruit at the municipal market in the city of Masaya. She buys different varieties of fruit in bulk depending on the season (mangoes, lemons, oranges, bitter oranges, peaches, etc.) and sells them at retail.

Milagro has been in this business for ten years and will use this loan to buy avocados and other fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase avocados & other fruits

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. José Francisco C. es originario del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como conserje en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene años de laborar. Tiene dos años de trabajar con Cepordel donde se le han otorgado tres créditos para gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de medicina para la buena salud de su esposa.
texts.en:
Mr. José Francisco C. is from the town of El Sauce. He is currently employed by the city as a caretaker; he’s been thus employed for years. He has collaborated with Ceprodel for two years and has had three loans for personal expenses. This loan was requested to buy medicine for his wife’s good health.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For medical expenses.

loans.name: Juicy

texts.en:
Juicy P. is a married woman who lives in Sitio. Canonoy, Brgy. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures, a tricycle transport business and a general store. Her husband Jerry P., who is 39 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are between the ages of 18 and 27. 

Juicy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Juicy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $140, thus raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP which she intends to use for the maintenance of their tricycles and to purchase more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the education of her children. Juicy P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Tricycle maintenance and more stock for the store

loans.name: Delia Marina

texts.es: La señora P. C. es profesora y labora en una escuela que se llama Camilo Zapata en una comarca que se llama Campuzano del Municipio de Nindirí desde hace 23 años, con el salario que devenga mantiene a dos hijas menores que tiene y las cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, esta señora se acerca a CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para gastos personales, y así no endeudarse para seguir sufragando la manutención a su hija.
texts.en: Mrs. P. C. is a teacher, and she has worked in a school called Camilo Zapata in the district of Campuzano in the municipality of Nindirí for 23 years. With her salary, she takes care of her two young daughters, who are in school. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL for personal expenses, so that she doesn’t become indebted in taking care of her daughters.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Quang

texts.en: Quang T. N. is 51 years old and has 2 children who work. She has opened a shop that sells construction materials such as brick, cement, steel and soil. Her shop is very crowded with customers, especially in the construction season. Every month, she makes 4,000,000 VND profit from this business. Since becoming a client of our credit program in 2006, she has been a good cluster leader. Currently, she wants a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy more material to meet increasing demand.

loans.use: to buy more material to meet increasing demand.

loans.name: Julia Justina

texts.es:
JULIA JUSTINA M. O.,Trabaja como Conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez.
el prestamo solicitado es para  utilizarlo en la compra de Materiales Construcción de su vivienda va a remodelar  un cuarto de habitación.
texts.en:
Julia Justina M. O. works as a caretaker at the Manuel Olivares Rodrígez Institute.

The loan requested is for the purchase of construction materials to remodel a bedroom of her house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel a bedroom of her house.

loans.name: Peter Ng'ang'a

texts.en:
Peter is a 46-year-old farmer. He is married to Florence, who is also a farmer. They have three children. Peter has owned his farming business for the past three years. He has a dairy operation and grows crops. His monthly income is 13,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.  

Peter has never borrowed from a MFI (microfinance institution) before. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a Kadet credit officer. He has applied for his first loan from KADET, which he plans to use to purchase animal feeds (i.e., dairy meal, maize jam, and Macklin salt), fertilizers, and seedlings. With the anticipated profit from the business he intends to expand the dairy operation and begin greenhouse farming. 

He hopes to own a greenhouse in the near future, which will enable him to grow produce during all the seasons. With the profits, he will pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds, fertilizer, and seedlings

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerard is 26 years old and is single. He is commonly known in the business of selling a variety of products for the home. Gerard has been in this business for about one year and works from 6 am until 8 pm. He employs one person to help him run the business.

Gerard has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business by adding more products.  He would like to reinvest any new profits that he makes back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell in his store

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en: Hezron is a 37-year-old father of four. To support his family, he runs a retail shop. Since he opened the shop, he has seen a lot of growth. He thanks Faulu Kenya for supporting him financially and for the financial training that they provide in their seminars. He also rents out houses to boost his income. He needs a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to expand into a wholesale business.

loans.use: To expand into a wholesale business

loans.name: Alpacoma Ii Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal  “ALPACOMA II” está solicitando su décimo crédito en el centro focal de Villa Exaltación, un total de  9  socias integran este grupo.

Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, como por ejemplo: venta de ladrillos, fabrica de ladrillos, venta de artefactos electrodomésticos, venta de sullus, compra y venta de ladrillo.  Los integrantes de esta banca comunal están ubicados en una zona en la que el negocio principal es la elaboración y venta de ladrillos.

La Banca Comunal Alpacoma II está dirigida por una mesa directiva, a la cabeza se encuentra la presidenta, la señora  Maria Dolores.

La señora María Dolores tiene un hogar conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos.   El negocio de la señora María Dolores es la venta de “Sullus” (fetos de llama, resecados, utilizados en las ofrendas a la Pachamama).  Aprendió este negocio de su mamá hace varios años, compra la mercadería de la  población de Desaguadero y vende de manera ambulante en la ciudad de La Paz.

Cuando le consultamos a la señora Eugenia sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella responde que le gusta todo, el crédito, la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The “ALPACOMA II” community bank is requesting its tenth loan from the Villa Exaltación regional office.  This group has 9 members.  

The ladies' businesses are all different and include: selling bricks, making bricks, selling electrical appliances, selling 'sullu' (animal fetuses) and buying and selling bricks.  The members of this community bank are located in an area where the main business activity is making and selling bricks.

The Alpacoma II community bank has an executive committee.  The head of this committee is María Dolores, the president. 

María Dolores lives with her husband and three children.  Her business is selling 'sullus' (llama fetuses which are dried and then used in offerings to the goddess Pachamama).  She learned this business from her mother several years ago.  She buys her goods from the town of Desaguadero and sells them as an itinerant street vendor in the city of La Paz.

When we asked Eugenia what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes everything: the loans and the health service.

loans.use: To buy 'sullus' (animal fetuses)

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina C. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Josefina is single and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, snack foods and  toothpaste in the local community. She also buys and sells bananas. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Josefina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as biscuits and canned goods. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Josefina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Lester Antonio

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Masaya del Departamento de Masaya se encuentra ubicada una empresa que se llama ENACAL en la que labora el señor Lester Antonio C. M., como  Inspector de Campo desde hace 3 años.

Este señor es casado, con un núcleo familiar de 2 personas (su esposa y un hijo menor de edad), actualmente quiere realizar ampliación y construcción de una habitación y un baño, esto para brindarle una mejor condición  de vida ya que quiere que su familia esté cómoda en su hogar.

Cabe mencionar que los sueños de este señor para con su familia prácticamente es ir mejorando las condiciones de su casa para darle un hogar digno.
texts.en:
In the Municipality of Masaya within the Department of Masaya, there is a company named ENACAL, and this is where Lestor Antonio C. M. has worked as a field inspector for the past three years.

He is married and has a 2-person nuclear family (his wife and a young son). He currently wants to expand and build a bedroom and a bathroom in order to provide better living conditions, as he wants his family to be comfortable in their home.

It is worth mentioning that his dream for his family is to improve the condition of their house to give them a decent home.

loans.use: Construction and expansion of a bedroom and a bathroom

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es: Patricio, de 60 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Francisco, de estado civil casado con la señora Rosa de 56 años, juntos tienen 02 hijos Edwin de 28 años y Noely de 15 años de edad y viven en su propia casa en la comunidad de las Palmas anexo del Distrito de Ayna San Francisco. Para Patricio su edad no es impedimento para seguir surgiendo y obteniendo buenos provechos; ya que de muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, es campesino cuenta 06 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de barbasco, cacao, hojas de coca y plátano; que son oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Hace más de 35 años que trabaja en esta actividad, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta  con el apoyo de su familia y de los jornaleros para avanzar con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar de esa manera ve que su arduo trabajo tiene recompensa al ver la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos y hojas de coca. En adelante desea renovar las plantaciones de barbasco por hojas de coca; puesto que le generan más ingreso. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Agradece a la institución por concederle dicho crédito. Con los  1,500 nuevos soles solicitados,  contratará peones para realizar el desmonte de malezas que se encuentra en su parcela.
texts.en:
Patricio is 60 years old. He is from the district of San Francisco. He is married to Rosa, who is 50 years old. They have two children together, Edwin, who is 28 years old, and Noely, who is 15 years old. They live in their own house in the community of Las Palmas, which is annexed to the district of Ayna San Francisco. 

For Patricio, his age is not an impediment to continuing to work and make a good living. From the time he was very young, his parents taught him to work in the fields. He is a farmer and has 6 hectares of land planted with barbasco root, cocoa beans, coca leaves, and plantains, all of which originate in the jungle area of the Aprurimac River Valley. 

He has been farming for 35 years. During harvest times he has the help of his family and day laborers to bring the harvest in. What he likes most about his work is harvesting. When he sees the quality of his crops, then he sees the return on his hard work. The most difficult aspect for him is transporting his products from the fields to the city of San Francisco, which is where he is offered the best prices for his products and coca leaves. In the future, he would like to replace his plantings of barbasco root with coca leaves, because they generate more income. 

This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He feels that this support will be of much help to him in his work. He is grateful to the institution for granting him this loan. With the PEN 1,500.00 that he requested, he will hire laborers to clean out the weeds in his fields.

loans.use: To hire laborers to clean out the weeds in his fields

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
O. Muhammad is a 53-year-old farmer who lives with his three children and wife. He has two milk cows and sells dairy products to local and capital traders. He is also engaged in a farming business. Muhammad has six years of experience in raising cattle and growing potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers. His milk products are in very high demand in his village. Muhammad’s orders for these products are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for traders so he has decided to apply for a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase an additional cow and fertilizer for his land. Muhammad is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his standard of living with this loan.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle and fertilizer

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry B. is 43 and single. She turns scrap into something useful and makes money out of it. She is certain that what she does benefits not only her, but also the people around her. She is a community partner in CCT*, where she spends a great deal of time learning how to improve her business and live a fulfilled life by getting to know more about the Creator. She presently resides in GMA, Cavite.

Cherry's main business is rug making, using scraps of cloth. Her working space is an extension of her house. She has been making rugs for ten years and is able to earn PHP 10,000 every month.

Cherry is requesting a  loan of PHP 50,000 to help develop her business. She will use this loan to buy cloth scraps in bulk, thereby freeing her to focus on the craft of rug making itself. Cherry also mentions being able to purchase other daily needs with this loan.

Purchasing cloth scraps with a small budget is really difficult and selling the rugs also requires extra effort at times. But Cherry is determined to make her business grow and eventually stabilize. She channels most of her energy and time on her business because she believes that, through this business, she can attain a life that is worth living.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase cloth scraps for rug making

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly Iga, who lives in the Sebina Zone neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda, is married and has eight children, one of whom is in school. Milly has had a tailoring business for six years, and she works seven days a week. She also sells paper as an additional source of income. Milly has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to purchase materials for sewing.

Milly's main business challenge is seasonality. Her goal is to expand her business and earn more profits to save money. Milly lives in a home that she rents; she does not have access to electricity or piped water.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials for sewing

loans.name: Dounya

texts.ar: دنيا تعمل في بيع الهواتف النقالة والاكسسوارات لها في عملها سنتين عزباء تحب عملها وتريد ان تصبح صاحبة محل خاص بها لها طموح كبير في تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي لها ولعائلتها تسعى الى التجدد في العمل والتطور تعاني من منافسة في محيطها العملي فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء اكسسوارات للهواتف وتقوية المصلحة وخطوط تعبئة للهواتف النقالة تتلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة وتسعى الى تحقيق ذاتها ومساعدة اهلها على تطوير نفسهم
texts.en: Dounya is unmarried. She works in a shop selling mobile phones and mobile phone accessories and has been doing this for 2 years. She loves her work and would like to own her own shop. She has a lot of ambition in wanting to improve her financial and social situation as well as her family's. She aspires to modernise and improve her business as she suffers from a lot of competition in her local area. With this loan she wants to purchase new accessories and mobile phone top-ups. She has the full support of her family and hopes to be independent and help them develop and improve.

loans.use: to purchase new mobile phone accessories and top-ups.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin E., from the village of P-1, Danlugan, Lopez Jaena, Mis. Occ., is 47 years old and single. To make a living, Franklin has just started a business providing transportation in the local community.

In 2011, Franklin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting his first loan of 50000 PHP to purchase motor side car to expand transportation services, Franklin plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase motor side car to expand transportation services

loans.name: Denis Jose

texts.es: El señor Denis José se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 8 años en este negocio.  su negocio consiste en ofrecer una gran variedad de productos a sus clientes, sus compras las realiza en Chinandega en donde obtiene sus productos mucho más favorables,  es un hombre muy trabajador y que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia, sobresale por ser un esposo y un padre muy ejemplar, sin vicios y dedicado a su negocio. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería como pantalones, bolsos, toallas, sandalias, sabanas, cosméticos y ropa en general. Las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Denis José sells general merchandise.  He has been in this business for more than eight years.  His business consists of offering a large variety of products to his customers.  He buys his products in Chinandega where he obtains them at much more favorable prices.  He is a very hard-working man who cares for his family's well-being.  He stands out as an exemplary husband and father who is without vices and is committed to his business.  He will use his loan to buy merchandise such as pants, bags, towels, sandals, sheets, cosmetics and clothes.  He needs the profits to cover his household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, bags, towels, sandals, sheets, cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria D.  56 años D. edad, resiD. en su casa con su esposo y su hijo.  Como toda mujer emprendedora tiene su propio taller D. costura en su lugar D. residencia. Tiene muchos años D. experiencia en la costura y diseña cualquier tipo D. prenda D. vestir que los clientes soliciten tales como. Faldas, pantalones vestidos, cubrecamas, edredones, etc. Este negocio ha sido para Ana su principal fuente D. ingreso y sigue confiando que así seguirá siendo. En este negocio lo  más importante es dejar satisfecho al cliente D. esta manera Doña Ana se ha ganado la confianza D. los habitantes D. la zona que cada día la prefieren mas. Esta señora llena D. sueños solicita este crédito para poder invertir en material para la elaboración D. edredones y cubrecamas que es lo que más le solicitan los clientes y que por el momento no hace ya que no cuenta con los materiales necesarios. Espera que su situación económica mejore y pueda brindarle mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria is 56 years old and lives in her home together with her husband and son.  Like any entrepreneurial woman, she has her own sewing workshop located in her home.  Ana has many years experience in the sewing business and designs all kinds of items that her customers request such as skirts, pants, dresses, bedspreads, comforters, etc.  This business has been Ana's main source of income and she believes that it will continue to be.

In this business, the most important thing is satisfying the customers.  Ana has gained the trust of the people in her area who prefer using her business more and more each day.  This lady is full of dreams and is requesting a loan to invest in materials for making comforters and bedspreads which is what her customers request most often but which, at the moment, she does not make because she doesn't have the necessary materials.  She hopes that her financial situation will improve and that she will be able to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy material for making comforters and bedspreads such as thread, fabric, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents. After getting his university degree in pharmacy, he opened his own pharmacy in 2008, seeing a need for such services in the region. He's very happy with his business because he's able to help customers improve their health situation. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. 

He obtained his first Kiva loan and has been an excellent client with punctual repayments. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to redecorate his pharmacy and add more space into it. In the future, he expects additional growth in his business.

loans.use: to redecorate his pharmacy.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 44 years old and married to David, a farmer.  The couple supports a family of five.  Christine buys and sell milk in Kipture trading centre.  She has been in the business for  two years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

She has taken a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD.  This is her first loan term.  Christine wishes to use the money to purchase more gallons of milk for resale.  

The anticipated profits will be used to improve the quantity of milk she buys from farmers for resale.  Her hope is to prosper in her business.

loans.use: To buy milk and pay the suppliers

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham, who is photographed with her husband in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Hebron, is a 48-year-old mother of five daughters and four sons. Two of her sons are construction workers and the rest are young school students. Siham and her husband run a goat farm in the village of Bani Nuiem in Hebron. They raise and sell goats, Siham came to FATEN to take a $900 loan to purchase more goats and increase their dairy products, which will increase the farm's sales and improve the family's income. Bani Nuiem is famous for raising cattle and dairy products.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Marcus

texts.en: Marcus is 30 years old and lives in Congo Town. He is married to a businesswoman and they have one child. For the past year, Marcus has been selling rice and drinks (soda, beer, etc.) wholesale. One of his major problems is the continuous rise in the price of rice. Marcus is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and drinks for his business. He hopes to become an international businessman.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and drinks

loans.name: Ananias

texts.en:
Ananias is 48 years old and single. He works in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Ananias has requested a loan of 19,500 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy livestock such as pigs, goats, and chickens.
Ananias has been raising livestock for eight years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain his business. He would like to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock such as pigs, goats, and chickens.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: La Sra. Basilia es una mujer bastante trabajadora y responsable vive en la zona D. alto Ovejuyo que se encuentra cerca D. nuestra institución, ella vive con sus tres hijas y un hijo,  su hija mayor trabaja D. seguridad en una institución, y la Sra. Basilia es quien se encarga D. los gastos que implica el estudio D. sus hijos menores ya que el esposo se encuentra en el interior del país (Yacuiba) y no les envía con frecuencia para la alimentación, pero la Sra. Basilia desD. hace tiempo se dedica a la venta D. api y pasteles hace mas D. seis meses esta también con la actividad D. la venta D. comida en una parada D.  minibuses  D. la zona D. Ovejuyo donD. atienD. almuerzo, cena, api y jugos, con la ayuda D. sus hijas juntas tienen un buen ingreso todos los días. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. insumos por mayor  y muebles para ampliar el negocio razón por el cual se solicita el financiamiento crédito.
texts.en:
Basilia is quite a hardworking, responsible woman.  She lives in the Alto Ovejuyo zone which is near our institution.  She lives with her three daughters and one son.  Her eldest daughter works as a security guard at an institution.  Basilia is responsible for the costs related to her younger children’s schooling because her husband is in the interior of the country (Yacuiba) and he doesn’t often send money for food.  

However, Basilia has been selling api (a thick purple corn drink, traditionally served at breakfast, and flavored with sugar and cinnamon) and cakes for some time now and for the last six months has also been selling food at a minibus stop in the Ovejuyo zone where she sells lunch and dinner and api and juices.  With help from her daughters they earn good daily income. She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients at wholesale and furniture to expand the business, the reason why she’s asking for the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at wholesale and to buy furniture.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years.  He is 24 years old, married to Wanjiku, and they have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He has been loaned KES 5,000, which he plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Isaac hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dove Group

texts.en:
Josephat, who is in his early 30's, is the married father of three children, one of whom attends school. He has had a sausage-selling business for four years now, delivering his product to hotels and bars. Working from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily, he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Josephat's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania; his previous one, since repaid, was used to buy more sausages and pay for his land. He will use this loan to buy additional sausages and to start building his house. His dream is to one day be able to finish his house.

Josephat will share this loan with his loan group "Dove", which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sausages to sell and to start building his house.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita, age 36, has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Avon and Natasha. She has had this business for three years. 

Lucita and her husband have eight children.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 4,000 in order to buy clothing and beauty products to offer for sale in her shop. In the future, Lucita hopes to improve her business.

Lucita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.

loans.use: to buy clothing and beauty products to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.  Carmelita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.
Carmelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Carmelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for re-sale.

loans.name: María Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una belleza que encanta a sus visitantes, es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde 1999, la cultura de su gente y las tradiciones de sus pueblos la hacen aun mas encantadora, su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Doña María tiene 45 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 23, 14 y 12 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos en el colegio. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad. 

La Señora. María es comerciante, ella se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal y Avon, esta actividad la desempeña hace 6 meses sin horario ni día fijo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 14 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de cosméticos para tener un mayor surtido.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio más grande como un bazar.
texts.en:
María is a member of María Reina de la Paz Communal Bank.  She lives in Cuenca, a beautiful city that visitors love and that has been a World Heritage Site since 1999.  The culture of the people of Cuenca and the traditions of its communities make it even more charming.  Its gastronomic variety captivates the palate of locals and visitors.

María, 45, is divorced and has three children from her marriage, ages 23, 14, and 12.  Her oldest child is studying in the university and the other two are in high school.  The house in which she lives is her own.

María is a businesswoman.  She sells Yanbal and Avon cosmetics.  She has been doing this work for six months without a set schedule.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 14 years, and she's going to invest her current loan in buying cosmetics to have a bigger supply.
 
Her goal is to have a larger business, like a store.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: La socia actualmente tiene 58 años y ella se dedica aún a la elaboración D. comidas caceras y a la compra y venta D. animales, a la agricultura; la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra D. gallinas, cuyes, chanchos, conejitos, la socia comprara estos animales tiernos para criarlos, engordarlos y venderlos, la socia tiene pensado comprar 10 pares D. gallinas, pollos, cuyes 20, para criarlos engordarlos y venderlos, la socia también desea invertir parte del credito en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboracion D. sus comiditas caseras. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. gallinas, cuyes, pollos y D. ingredientes para elaborar las comidas  caceras.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 58, and still works making homemaD. meals, buying and selling animals, and farming. On this occasion, she wants to use the loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and baby rabbits. 

She will buy these animals young, in order to raise them, fatten them, and sell them. She is thinking of buying 10 pairs of hens, other chickens and 20 guinea pigs, in order to raise them, fatten them, and sell them.

She also wishes to use part of the loan to buy ingredients for making her homemaD. meals. She is applying for the loan to buy hens, other chickens, guinea pigs, and ingredients for making homemaD. meals.

loans.use: To buy hens, other chickens, guinea pigs, and ingredients for making her homemade meals.

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 38 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos (12 y 9 años), reside en la comunidad  rural de La Cosmul en San Pedro Sula, Cortés.
Doña Maria se dedica a la venta de tortillas de maíz, y venta de verduras en menor escala. Su esposo es motorista, sus dos hijos  están  estudiando la educación primaria y le ayudan a su madre en los espacios de tiempo libre.
Hace 4 años que inicio con su negocio, antes ella se dedicaba a trabajo asalariado, por lo que decidió independizarse económicamente y aportar recursos económicos a su hogar.
Ella ha solicitado su primer préstamo el que piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas (maíz, cal y leña). Espera en un corto plazo utilizar sus ganancias para dedicarse al negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
María, 38, lives in a common law relationship with her husband; they have two children (12 and 9 years old) and live in the rural community of La Cosmul in San Pedro Sula, Cortés.

María is a corn tortilla merchant and also sells vegetables in small scale.  Her husband’s a driver.  Her two children are in elementary school and they help their mother in their free time.

She started the business four years ago; she used to have a salaried job but decided to become economically independent to provide income for her home.

She has requested her first loan that she plans to use to buy raw materials to make the tortillas (corn, lime powder and firewood).  She hopes in the short run to use her profits to go into food sales business

loans.use: to buy raw materials (corn, lime powder and firewood) and vegetables.

loans.name: Saream

texts.en: Saream, 44, is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Saream produces traditional baskets to sell. She is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Gaioz

texts.en:
Gaioz is 29 years old and lives in the village of Pkhvenisi in eastern Georgia. He lives with his wife Nina, a 10-year-old son and a 9-year-old daughter. Both children go to school. All family members are internally displaced persons from a nearby region, as a result of a military conflict. They receive a relevant pension from the state. 

The main source of income for the family is agriculture. They own 1.2 hectares of land, where maize, cabbage, tomatoes and wheat are grown, harvested and sold locally. In addition, the family owns three calves, which will produce milk in the spring. The family's total average monthly income is 900 GEL.

Gaioz requested a loan of 2,000 GEL to purchase an additional cow. By spring, the family will have four cows that produce milk and will begin making cheese.  The sale of cheese will significantly increase the family's income. Gaioz and Nina will use the increased income to renovate their house, which is newly constructed.  At present, only two rooms are used as the rest are not unsuitable for living.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to produce milk.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has two children. 

Nita has a shop that sells viands and snacks like homemade sausage. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands and snacks.

Nita has been a member of HSPFI since 2001. In the future, Nita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands and snacks.

loans.name: Phoan

texts.en: Phoan, 27, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia, a business area of Thai and Cambodian people. She is a farmer and raises pigs. Her husband is a gardener. Phoan requests a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. By doing so, she will be able to generate more income for her family. In the future, she would like to use additional income to expand her pig raising business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, soft drinks and chips to sell in her shop.

loans.name: 040106-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh operates a business selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase a fishing net. 

Minh is 40 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 040106-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She has two dependents

In 2003, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Minh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Minh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 34 years old, married to Aggrey, who is also a businessman and she supports seven members of her family.  They are blessed with five children aged between 10 and 16 years.  She runs a cereal shop business where she mainly sells maize.  She has been in this business for five years and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 20,000 that she intends to use to purchase more maize for resale. She plans to use the anticipated profits to support her family.

Her hopes for the future are to open big store for her business and to educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of maize.

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en:
Muhamad, 30, works as a motorcycle taxi or “boda boda” driver in Kampala, Uganda. Motorcycle taxis are extremely popular in Uganda because they allow passengers to avoid being stuck in traffic and to navigate the country's rough roads. 

Muhamad currently rents his motorcycle, but indefinite renting schemes make it difficult for drivers to build up savings. He is therefore excited to take a loan from Tugende because after paying off the loan, his profits will double as he will no longer have to pay rent or make loan payments. 

Outside of motorcycles, Muhamad cheers for Manchester United football club and enjoys spending his free time at home with his family, including kids ages eight and one. He plans on using the extra profits from owning his motorcycle to put his kids in better schools.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle over 18 months instead of renting, doubling his profits

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 47 years old; he lives with his wife and his four children in Gaza.

He has a poultry farm, he just started his business in February this year, He applied for  this Startup Loan to buy poultry feeds , Cage for Producing Eggs and build Drinking System for the chickens, which will help him to improve the financial conditions and will lead to support the needs of his family, and reinvest in his business.
His dream is to educate his children and give them the best in their life. Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.
Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the startup enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds , Cage for Producing Eggs and build Drinking System for the chickens, which will help him to improve the financial conditions and will lead to support the needs of his family, and reinvest in his business.

loans.name: Alain Yétondé

texts.fr: Marié à une revendeuse du nom de Michelle et père de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge, Alain Yétondé est âgé de 41 ans. Alain Yétondé vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. En plus de ses enfants, Alain Yétondé a quatre autre enfants à sa charge. Alain Yétondé vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Alain Yétondé subvient ensemble avec sa femme aux divers besoins du ménage. Alain Yétondé a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour assurer ses diverses charges, Alain Yétondé vend de l'eau communément appelé "Pure Water" depuis six ans et de la glace de façon secondaire, ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Alain Yétondé s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Alain Yétondé  sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter des sachets.

loans.name: Laura Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Gomez has been selling flowers and gifts for four years. This is the only source of income for her, her daughter and elderly father. I like my business because I work with people who want to express friendship to others and recipients have a nice smile. During the Christmas season, lots of people give gifts. I want more merchandise to cover flower and gift orders. For this reason, I want a loan of $1,500 to buy merchandise for this Christmas season. This will help me expand my business and generate income my family needs. This is very important because my father can no longer work.

Loan Use: To buy merchandise to sell for Christmas gifts

La Sra. G. tiene 4 años dedicándose a la venta de flores y regalos. Esta es su única fuente de ingresos para ella, su hija y su padre, quien es una persona de mayor edad. “Me gusta mi negocio porque acuden a el personas que desean expresar su amistad a otros llevándoles flores o regalos, por eso recibo a mis clientes con una sonrisa amable. En esta época Navideña en la que muchas personas acostumbran dar regalos, quisiera tener más mercancías a fin de cubrir los pedidos de flores y de regalos. Por ello quisiera un crédito de 1,500 dólares para comprar mercancías para esta temporada Navideña. Esto me permitirá aumentar mi negocio y generar los ingresos que mi familia necesita, en especial mi padre, que ya no puede trabajar.”

loans.use: Comprar mercancias de temporada Navideña para regalos.

loans.name: Marpi

texts.en:
Marpi is 38 years old and has 5 kids. With $50 loan that she requested from MBK, Marpi will be able to sell vegetable and food every morning by walking around her village. In one day she expects to receive income of $20 with a profit of $5. She hopes to get the loan from MBK because to get the loan she doesn't need a guarantee and she can make loan payment on a long-term basis (one year).

Translated by C. Patriawan, Kiva volunteer

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her food sales

loans.name: Devota

texts.en: Devota lives in Lumo, Temeke District in Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children and her eldest daughter is in secondary school. Devota runs a tailoring business from the verandah of her home. The business has not been good recently due to insufficient sewing materials and competition she faces from her neighbors. She wants to improve her business by having enough sewing material supplies and renting a business premise. Devota is currently working on the verandah of her house which does not attract customers and does not provide her enough space. She also needs to add two sewing machines and one assistant. Her strategy requires a capital injection of $550.

loans.use: Devota would like an assistant, two sewing machines and to add sewing material supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Lili

texts.pt:
Lili R. was born September 1, 1950 in Catembe, Maputo. Her parents split when she was young and she lived with her mother, but her mother didn't have the money to pay for schooling, so she only studied through 4th grade. Life was hard, and she had to get a job at age 15 in a shoe factory where she worked for 5 years. Her family moved, and because the new house was far from the factory, Lili had to look for work closer to home.

She became pregnant at age 18 and stopped working. Life became more difficult all the time since the father of her child was older and had a wife. Lili had to look for another job in a tailor shop where she worked as a seamstress for a few years. Later, she got together with a Portuguese man who wanted her to go to Portugal with him. Out of fear, she refused to go. After that, she met another man with whom she had 4 children and they still live together to this day.

The tailor shop closed and she decided to open her own business by going to South Africa to buy clothes and selling in Mozambique. After facing some difficulties, LIli decided to move the business and she traveled northern Mozambique buying cows, goats, and cereals to resell in Maputo. Since this business was so demanding and risky, she quit and traveled to Inhambane where she bought fish and chickens to resell in the capital city. Some time later, one of her daughters taught her to raise broiler chickens, which she continues to do.

With the loan, she will buy chicks and feed which will improve her business. In the future, she hopes to build a large aviary where she will raise a other birds such as turkeys, swans, ducks. She hopes to employ 3 men to help her carry out this activity once she buys land for it in the Marracuene district of Maputo.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Lilí R. , nascido em 1 de Setembro de 1950 na Catembe em Maputo. ainda muito nova os pais separaram –se tendo ficado a viver com a mãe e porque esta não tinha condições para custear os seus estudos , estudou apenas até 4ª classe . Porque a vida estava difícil , teve que procurar emprego aos 15 anos numa Fábrica de sapatos onde trabalhou durante 5 anos .A família muda de residência e , porque onde foram morar era longe do serviço e o que ganhava não dava para cobrir despesas de transporte e outras , teve que procurar emprego próximo de casa.

Aos 18 anos fica grávida e deixa de trabalhar , porque a vida tornava-se cada vez mais difícil uma vez que o homem que lhe engravidara era mais velho e tinha outra Mulher teve que procurar outro emprego numa Alfaiataria onde trabalhou como Custureira alguns anos. Depois juntas com um português e este dicide ir com ela á Portugal e por medo recusou-se a ir com ele , pouco tempo depois junta-se com outro homem com qual tem 4 filhos e com ele vive até hoje.

Porque a Alfaiataria fechou , decide iniciar o seu negócio indo á RSA comprar roupas e vender em moçambique tendo encarado algumas dificuldades .Assim sendo , decide mudar de negócio onde passou a viajar ao norte de Moçambique comprando gado bovino e caprino , Cereais para revender em Maputo e por ser um negócio que exijia muito esforço e certos riscos, abandona este negócio passando a viajar á Inhambane onde comprava peixe e galinhas para revender na capital. Algum tempo depois uma das filhas ensina lhe a criar frangos de corte actividade que desenvolve até então.

Com o crédito de 17.000,00 mt comprou pintos e ração o que dum certo mudo melhorou o seu negócio. Futuramente pretende construir um grande Aviário onde deseja criar uma série de Aves como perús , Gansos, patos , poedeiras e empregar três Homens para lhe ajudar nesta actividade uma vêz que já possui um terreno para tal no distrito de Marracuene na provincia do Maputo.

loans.use: Chicken production

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
For a living Flor produces milk cow and sells potatoes and chuño. In that way her combined incomes allow her to provide for her two children.

Se lives in the Caluyo de Batallas Community (two hours away from the city of La Paz ).

The credit will be used to purchase a milk cow of medium breed and increase the production of milk.

This is her second credit with Impro; the first credit was given to her in December 2006 and to date it's completely repaid. Her evaluation qualifies her for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Flora se dedica a la producción de leche de vaca y comercialización de papa y chuño, de tal manera que sus ingresos combinados le permiten cubrir la manutención de sus dos hijos. Vive en la Comunidad Caluyo de Batallas (A dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el segundo crédito con Impro; el primer crédito fue concedido en Diciembre de 2006 y esta completamente pagado a la fecha. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Purchasing a milk cow

loans.name: Yao Messan

texts.fr:
Mr. Yao Messan G. was born on 14 December 1989 in Tchékpo. He is unmarried with two (02) people in his care. A painter by profession, he manages a store selling paints. He is very ambitious and wants to open his own store, given that this is a flourishing trade. He manages his business well. He is asking for a loan of $1000. This will increase his income and give him financial autonomy.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur G. Yao Messan est né le 14 Décembre 1989 à Tchékpo, il est célibataire avec deux (02) personnes à sa charge. Il est peintre de formation, et gère une boutique de vente de peinture. Très ambitieux, il veut ouvrir sa propre boutique car c’est un commerce florissant. Il a une bonne gestion de son activité. Il sollicite un crédit de $1000. Ceci augmentera ses revenus et lui donnera une autonomie financière.

loans.use: To open a shop selling paints

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo B. is a 41 year old widow with four children and hails from Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food. She has been in business for the past three years and needs the loan to buy more foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking

loans.name: Cenaida

texts.es:
Mrs. Cenaida C. has built a family over many years with children who value hard work and honor above all. She is very happy with how her family has turned out. When the economic crisis was very urgent in her house Cenaida’s dear children had to interrupt their college studies in order to work. For this reason Cenaida began a small transportation business of motorcycle rickshaws which she currently runs. Cenaida covers short routes with great success, and the dream of this hard-working mother is to repair her motorcycle rickshaws in order to begin covering longer routes with greater earning potential and more security. She is asking for your help in order to make this dream a reality soon.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Cenaida, ha construido durante muchos años una familia, cuyos hijos tienen como valor principal el trabajo esforzado y honrado y está muy feliz por los resultados que ha obtenido. Cuando la crisis económica era muy apremiante en casa sus queridos hijos tuvieron que interrumpir sus estudios en los centros superiores de su ciudad para trabajar, fue así como se inició su pequeña empresa de transportes de mototaxis que administra actualmente Cenaida con mucho éxito, cubren rutas cortas y el anhelo de esta trabajadora madre es reparar los daños de sus motos para iniciar la cobertura de rutas más largas con mayores ganancias y más seguridad.Solicita vuestra ayuda a fin de cristalizar este sueño en poco tiempo.

loans.use: Repair motorcycle rickshaws

loans.name: Mohammad Sudi

texts.id:
Mohammad Sudi is a chicken sate seller, everyday he has to walk at least 3 kilometers from his house. He does this to support his family. He stays with his wife and his 4 months old child at a 3x3 meter room which he rents for 100.000 a month. The fluctuation price of the raw material affects his sate business. He usually is able to sell about 100 sticks. However he will need to sell at least 80 sticks to break even. Mohammad Sudi makes around 40.000 – 50.000 a day. This is just enough to pay the rent and daily expenses. With the help from Dinari he can now expand his sate business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Mohammad Sudi adalah seorang pedagang sate ayam yang setiapharinya harus menempu perjalanana sekitar 3 kilometer dari tempat tinggalnya. Usaha ini dia lakukan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Tinggal bersama istri dan anak yang berumur empat tahun ini mengontrak sebuah kamar yang berukuran 3x3 meter dengan membayar uang sewa sebesar 100.000/bulannya. Menurutnya naiknya harga bahan pokok makanan mempengaruhi usahanya berjualan sate, kalau dulu dia bisa menjual sampai 100 tusuk sate sekarang harus dibatasi 80 tusuk untuk menhindari kerugian yang besar.
