Keuntungan yang didapat Mohammad Sudi perharinya berkisar antara 40.000 – 50.000/harinya. Cukup untuk ditabung membayar uang sewa kamar dan kebutuhan setiaphari. “Sekarang kan saya mendapatkan bantuan modal dari DINARI kiranya ini dapat meningkatkan usaha saya dalam berjualan sate”. ungkapnya.

loans.use: untuk membeli bahan makanan

loans.name: Maria Louisa

texts.en:
Maria Louisa is 32 years old. She has been a member of Juanito, a community bank, for three years. The community bank gives her confidence; since joining she has learned responsibility and punctuality.

Maria originally joined the bank to get a loan to be able to finish university; she has a teaching degree. She was unable to get a loan from other banks because they needed collateral. Now Maria has a business making curtains. She also sells a variety of home goods. Maria is planning to expand her business and start doing tailoring within the next year. For this, she plans to buy an industrial sewing machine.

Maria also enjoys working with children. She volunteers at the Santa Teresa Church working with orphans. She teaches classes and works to get them presents or treats on holidays. Her dream is to build an orphanage.

Maria needs a loan of $1,200, which she will use to buy an industrial sewing machine and other equipment to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine and other equipment

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena R. D. R. owns on beautiful restaurant in the city of Pucallpa, department of Ucayali.  She started the business three years ago and now has many loyal customers.  Customers come to enjoy lunch, drink a beer, or eat dinner.  They enjoy the warm and contemporary environment.

Milena is a 49 years old widow with two children.  She decided to open the restaurant because she loves to cook food and proviD. a service she can be proud of.  She is creative and smart.  She used the internet to find and good design for her bar and came up for the theme of the atmosphere herself.  She works hard so she can send her youngest son to university and she has no one else to rely on.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Milena is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 4 months.  She will use the loan to buy rice, beer, oil, sugar, and condiments

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy rice, beer, oil, sugar, and condiments

loans.name: Kahkinted

texts.en:
Kahkinted E. is a 50-year-old widow with six children. The challenges she has faced include the ill health of some of her children and her inability to single-handedly sponsor them in school. Her former loans from GHAPE were invested in pig farming and food crop cultivation, and the profit was used to educate her children.

Given a loan, she plans to continue in the same line of business and use the profit to pay school fees for her children in institutions of higher education.

She plans to repay the loan in 24 months. The first installment is due on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of seedlings and farm equipment

loans.name: Davlatmo

texts.en: B. Davlatmo is 37-years old. She is married and the loving mother of seven children. Her husband is tractor operator at a local farm. For more than 6 years, Davlatmo has been selling vegetables and fruits (tomatos, cucumbers, apricots, strawberries, cherries, etc.). Her elder sons help her with the business. Her business begins early morning at 5:00 a.m. She buys vegetables and fruits from the local farmers and sells them in the market.  She trades in the market that is loved among her people for its attractive prices. Davlatmo’s business generates a stable income for her family, and helps to ensure her children with a good future and education. Now that her business is really progressing, Davlatmo is requesting a loan of $600 for the term of 9 months. This will enable her to provide more choices for her customers. Davlatmo and her hopeful family are counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Davlatmo’s business.

loans.use: To purchase a wider range of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Saly

texts.fr:
Saly M., age 53, is married and has four children in her care. She has been an energetic member of the village bank of Bignona Bassène for three and a half years. Her business consists of buying and reselling honey, lemons, and brooms. The income derived from her commerce enables her to help cover family expenses and medical care. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Saly M., 53 ans, mariée avec 04 enfants en charge est une membre dynamique du banc villageois de Bignona Bassène depuis 3 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre du miel, du citron et des balaies. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer à la dépense familiale et aux soins médicaux. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and resell honey, lemons, brooms, and nététou (a spicy seasoning)

loans.name: Zena's Malaika Group

texts.en:
Zena is a 21-year-old, married woman with one 2-year-old child. In addition, she takes care of two other people who are 13 and 18 years old. For a living, she sells food and clothing. Every day, she works extremely hard from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and, in doing so, she can earn a monthly profit of approximately $90 from her sales.

Zena now seeks a loan in order to buy more rice, maize, flour, meat, vegetables, bananas, and clothes for her business. Notably, she will share the loan proceeds with her subgroup members, Halima, Zainabu, Shamila, and Sauda, who have their own sales businesses dealing with food, charcoal, soap, and clothing.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by increasing inventory (i.e., by purchasing additional food and clothes)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose V. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. Rose sells foods like tubers of yam, Garri, palm oil, and corn. She has been in this business since 2000. Rose is a LAPO client.

She needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more food for sale. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.es:
La señora Nilsa Ramona es una persona sacrificada y muy trabajadora, viene de una cuidad llamada Caaguazu que queda como a 250 km de la capital. Ella prácticamente ella vive en su lugar de trabajo con sus 2 hijos pequeños desde hace 3 años, el salón donde tiene sus mercaderías es bastante amplio lo divide y ahi tiene, sus comodidades familiares que le facilita quedarse a dormir entre semana ahí y los fines de semana ir a su casa en su ciudad.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en general en el mercado general de abastos y dice que a pesar de su trabajo tan sacrificado, ella desea seguir luchando para que sus hijos puedan estudiar y acceder a mejores posibilidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nilsa Ramona is a selfless and hard-working person. She is from a city called Caaguazu, about 250 kilometers outside of the capital. Nilsa has practically lived in her store for the past three years, with her two children. She divided the large room into a section for merchandise and a section where her family can sleep during the week. On the weekends, they go to her house in her hometown. Nilsa sells vegetables in the general supplies market. She says that in spite of her selfless work she wants to keep fighting so that her children can go to school and have better opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise: tomatoes, peppers, carrots, onions and others

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu, 45 years old and married with three grown children, has been selling cassava, potatoes, and other local foods since 2005, earning a profit of about $25 each month. Tatu is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more of these products to increase her sales and profit.

Cassava is eaten throughout the day in Tanzania, either as breakfast or a snack. The cassava is peeled and fried in oil, then topped off with salt. Potatoes are also a staple food as they are inexpensive and filling.

loans.use: To buy more foods to prepare and sell.

loans.name: Mary Jeane

texts.en:
“The most challenging part of being a wife and mother is: how are you going to raise all of your 5 children well with your husband earning only P 7,000.00 per month--not enough to cover your whole family's basic needs," says Mary Jeane S., 33 years old, from Loon, Bohol who sincerely shares her experiences as a married person.

Mary Jeane went into a small sing-along business situated beside her nipa hut to increase her family's income and earn an additional P1, 000 per month. However, she cannot maximize her income due to a lack of facilities. Her chairs and tables are made of coconut lumber and slightly rotten, making the customers feel discomfort every time they visit the place.

She is requesting a loan of P 5,000.00 to purchase these items. In addition, she wants to invest in some other business such as a small grocery store, so 40% of the loan money will be used to purchase grocery items for her store. She hopes that if she manages to do all this, raising her children may not be as difficult as she previously said.

loans.use: To purchase new chairs and tables for her sing-along business

loans.name: Gabriel Eduardo

texts.es:
EL señor Gabriel Eduardo es originario de Monterrey, Nuevo León; pero tiene 4 años viviendo en Nuevo Laredo y ha decidido establecerse en esta cuidad. Actualmente está alojado en casa de sus familiares y él agradece a ellos su aceptación durante todo este tiempo, sin embargo menciona que ya es hora de tener su propio techo.
En este momento ha iniciado los trámites para poder adquirir una vivienda por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental), pero el valor de la casa es superior al crédito que puede recibir. Solicita su colaboración para realizar uno de sus más grandes sueños.
Él trabaja con ejecutivo de ventas en la central de autobuses en está ciudad; su sueldo es moderado y le es imposible pagar el saldo restante con ello.
texts.en:
Gabriel Eduardo is orginally from Monterrey in Nuevo Leon, but he's been living in Nuevo Laredo for 4 years now and has established himself in this city. He is living in the house of some friends, and he appreciates their help during all this time, but it's now time for him to find his own place. At the moment, he has started the process to buy his own home through an organization called Infonavit, (government credit), but the value of the property is more than the credit he can receive. He is requesting a loan to be able to realize one of his greatest dreams. Gabriel works in sales at the central bus station. His salary is moderate, and he won't be able to cover the difference with only that.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make a sufficient payment for government assisted housing

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha A. is a micro-businesswoman; she runs a business selling both fresh and fried fish at Vituka ward. Fish is highly consumed in Dar es Salaam. She purchases from Dar es Salaam fish market at FERRY FISH MARKET and sells to customers in Vituka. So many women in Dar es Salaam are engaged in this business. A lot of income is derived from this business. She has been in the business for seven years. She pays the school fees for her children and meets their daily demands. She is in need of T.shs 800,000 to boost her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Silvio Tomas

texts.es: Don Silvio tiene 39 años de edad, reside en el barrio 380 en la cuidad de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos que cursan la primaria, ella es ama de casa, el sr. Silvio se desempeña como cadete de taxi, desde hace seis años, el inicio trabajando de cadete y ganaba por día , con sus ahorro compro un taxi propio que le genera mas ganancias para su familia y para dar mantenimiento a su vehiculo, con la solicitud de préstamo la quiere para comprar repuestos de su carro para dar mejor servicios  a sus clientes, sus planes es poder mejorar su casa como cambiar su unidad de taxi.
texts.en:
Silvio is 39 years old and lives in the 380 neighborhood of Managua. He and his wife have two children, who are in primary school. His wife is a homemaker and Silvio is a taxi driver. He started in the taxi business six years ago, earning his salary by the day. With his savings he bought his own taxi and now he earns more, covering his family's expenses and maintenance on the vehicle. Silvio would like a loan to buy replacement parts for his car in order to provide better service to his customers. He plans to improve his house and to upgrade his taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for maintenance work on his taxi

loans.name: Afiwo

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de kégué elokopé qui est un quartier au centre de la ville de lomé, elle a pour activité la vente de pagnes et de chaussures. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2004, elle a tous les jours de nouvelles demandes et  parfois elle n’arrive pas les satisfaire toutes, elle a donc besoin d’agrandir son stock, elle demande donc à wages un prêt pour acheter 50 pièces de pagnes. Elle est mariée et a un enfant.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Kégué Elokopé district, which is a district in central Lomé. Her work involves selling pagne cloth and shoes. She has been in this business since 2004. Each day, she receives new orders, and sometimes she isn’t able to fill them all. She therefore needs to expand her inventory. So she is asking WAGES for a loan for buying 50 lengths of pagnes. She is married and has a child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 50 lengths of cloth

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Jehová Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Las tres Señoras del grupo solidario Jehová es mi Fortaleza, ambos son muy buenos en sus negocios por lo que en estos momentos no cuentan con el suficiente capital de trabajo es por eso que solicitan financiamiento. La Señora Josefa Eufemia M. J. su actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos y la venta de tortillas tiene mas de 5 años ya que su negocio ha sido un medio de supervivencia para ella y su familia y por medio de los financiamientos es que ha podido salir adelante. La otra Señora que constituye el grupo es Doña María Auxiliadora M. J. tiene la edad 44 años ella se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y refrescos naturales hace mas de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, los propósitos de Doña María Auxiliadora son de seguir manteniendo su negocio y obtener mas recurso para la compra de mas productos variados y ofertar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Y su última integrante Doña Thelma J. R. tiene la edad de 62 años, ella se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de granos básicos y refrescos naturales hace mas de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio pero es importante resaltar que su negocio nació por la necesidad de generar una fuente de ingresos para su familia la Señora Thelma es madre soltera por lo que su aspiración es seguir manteniendo su negocio ya que es el único medio de manutención para ella y su familia. La cantidad solicitada por Doña Josefa es de C$3.000 córdobas, a Doña María Auxiliadora es de C$3.000 córdobas y a Doña Thelma es de C$3.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
The three women in the solidarity group Jehová es mi Fortaleza, although all are very good at business, at this time are lacking sufficient funds and so are requesting financing. Josefa Eufemia M. J. works selling staple grains and tortillas. This economic activity has supported her and her family for more than five years, and she has been able to keep her business going thanks to financing. The other woman in the group is Doña María Auxiliadora M. J., who is 44 years old. She has been selling staple grains and natural drinks for more than three years. Doña María Auxiliadora's goals are to keep her business going and obtain more resources in order to purchase more varied products and offer her customers better service. The last member is Doña Thelma J. R., who is 62 years old. She has worked selling staple grains and natural drinks for more than 9 years, but it's important to note that her business came about because she needed a source of income for her family. Señora Thelma is a single mother, so her goal is to keep her business going, since it's the only means she has to support herself and her family. Doña Josefa is requesting C$3.000 córdobas, Doña María Auxiliadora is requesting C$3.000 córdobas, and Doña Thelma is requesting C$3.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
La señora Marivel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Victorias”, vive en el Jr. La Merced Nº 931 – La Merced, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los dos que aun dependen de ella.

Con su primer préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 decidió emprender su negocio propio y empezó confeccionando vestidos, en su propia casa.

En la actualidad se dedica a la compra y venta de repuestos de electrodomésticos, su negocio se ubica en un ambiente acondicionado en su propia casa, siendo sus principales clientes sus amigos y vecinos; también trabaja con algunas instituciones. 

Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que cancelara a un plazo de 06  meses, comprara más repuestos de televisores, radios, dvs, computadoras, insumos que le van a permitir atender con calidad y eficiencia a sus clientes. 

Ella y su esposo, toman las decisiones en las compras y  ganancias de su negocio, se siente más segura al ofrecer sus productos, se considera una mujer luchadora, constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Marivel, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Marivel belongs to the “Las Victorias” Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. La Merced Nº 931 – La Merced, Juanjui district, San Martín department. She is married, 36 years old, and mother of 2 children who are still dependent upon her. With her first loan for S/.1,300.00 she decided to start her own business and she began to make clothing in her own home. Today she buys and sells parts for small electrical domestic appliances. Her business is located in an air conditioned room in her home. Her main clients are her friends and neighbors. She also works with some institutions. With the loan for S/2,000.00, which will be repaid for 6 months, she will buy more television parts, radios, dvs, computers, and supplies that will allow her to service her customers with quality and efficiency. She and her husband make the purchasing and earnings decisions together. She feels more assured in offering her products; she considers herself a hardworking woman, steady and responsible with her loan payments. Marival expresses her thanks to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a business entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts for televisions, radios and computers.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиер не имеет постоянной работы и занимается бизнесом. По выходным базарным дням он выходит на базар и занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов. Ему 32 года, женат, трое детей. Жена нигде не работает так как в регионе их проживания нет нормальных рабочих мест. Бахтиер кроме бизнеса еще работает в качестве такси. Бахтиер хочет получить займ на КИВА для расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor does not have a steady job and is a businessman. On weekend market days he goes to the market and purchases and sells dried fruits. He is 32 years old, is married and has three children. His wife does not have a job since in their region there are no normal work places. Bahtiyor in addition to his business works as a taxi driver. Bahtiyor would like to get a loan on KIVA in order to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Suraiya Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of A. S. who lives in Vehari, Pakistan. Vehari city is their birthplace. Suraiya baji is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. Both of her sons work in a factory on a monthly wage. Her daughter is enrolled in a local school and is getting an education. Suraiya baji operates a sewing business by taking orders from her neighbors. She charges $2 per dress. She uses her income to pay the school fees of her daughter. Her husband has a business selling bed sheets. He buys the bed sheets from a market in Lahore named “Ichra” and sells to the native city. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more bed sheets to increase her husband's profit.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Pathani baji, Naziran baji and Irshad baji each want a loan to buy bed sheets to sell. Hafizan baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Noelali

texts.es:
NOELALI G. B., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS DIVINAS” su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry Nº 638 , tiene 44 años, tiene 02 hijos mayores e independientes.

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en su fuente de soda, compró gaseosas, preparo gelatina, Flan, etc.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará una exhibidora para mostrar sus gaseosas  y postres que ella misma prepara. 

Agradece a Manuela Ramos en el tiempo que viene trabajando le ha permitido implementar su negocio,  es una gran ayuda que me ha permitido seguir adelante...... remarcó.
texts.en:
Noelali Gonzalez B. is 44 years old and has 2 children who are independent. She is a client of "LAS DIVINAS" community bank. Her home is located in the Jr. Salaverry N º 638. The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was for 300 Nuevos Soles, which she invested in the purchase of a soda fountain, drinks, gelatins, caramel flans, etc. She is asking for a loan of, $400 to buy a display /refrigerator for the soft drinks and desserts that she prepares. She thanks Manuela Ramos. Because of her great help she has been able to implement her business and keep it growing, she remarked

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a display/refrigerator  for desserts

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Angel cuenta con 49 años de edad, vive en su propia casa ubicada en la zona oeste de la localidad, sus padres viven con él. Sus hijos mayores lo visitan cada fin de semana. Angel se dedica al arreglo de todo tipo de artículos eléctricos, ya que el tiene su propio taller de radio técnica por el mercado central de la localidad, actividad que realiza por muchos años. La verdad que la competencia es baja, ya que el es el único radio técnico por la zona. Por tales motivos; experiencia y ubicación tiene muchos clientes. Angel invirtió todo su crédito en lo que tenia previsto, es decir; repuestos y accesorios para su radio técnica. Este es el primer préstamo de Angel . Tiene un crédito en otra entidad financiera que esta pagando puntualmente.
texts.en:
Angel is 49. He lives in his own house, which is located in the zone to the west of the town. His parents live with him. His grown children visit every week end. Angel fixes all types of electrical items. He has his own radio electronics shop in the town’s central market. He has been doing this for many years. He does not have much competition because he is the only radio electronics technician in the zone. Because of his experience and location, he has a lot of customers. Angel invested all of his loan in what he said he would, replacement parts and accessories for his radio technology. This is Angel’s first loan. He has a loan, which he is repaying punctually, in another financial entity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy radio technology

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 43 años, 03 hijos, que aun están a su cargo y es la razón por la cual, trabaja muy duro día a día.

Su espíritu  alegre y su anhelo de sacar adelante  a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias ayudaría al ingreso económico de su familia, desde sus  inicios a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella encuentran todo los productos que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Marina, muy tranquila y segura para continuar trabajando y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Ms. Marina L. is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” Microfinance Institute in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 43-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 3 children—her reason for working so hard day by day—under her care.

Her cheerful spirit and her desire to help her children get ahead motivated her to start her own general store so that she could contribute to the household income. She has been gaining customers ever since she started out. She currently has a fixed clientele that comes to her store everyday to shop because there, they can find all the products that a homemaker needs. She personally attends to her customers with the charm that she is noted for.

With this 2,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, crates of milk, boxes of assorted brands of canned fish, eggs, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue giving the best customer service. Marina calmly and confidently continues to work and persevere everyday. She gives thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her get the opportunity to develop their entrepreneurial skills.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac G. sells firewood and palm kernel oil in Ayisa. Isaac has received a primary school education. He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader. Isaac has been selling firewood and palm kernel oil since 1993. He is responsible for paying bills and other expenses. His loan will be used to buy more firewood to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to build a house.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: İslam

texts.en:
İslam K. is 40 years old and is married with three children. He has operated a car-washing facility for the last seven years. He has come up the very hard way to become successful in his business. Now he is the owner and at the same time he is the operator.

İslam would like to expand his business by purchasing another pressure-washer and hiring a person to help him. For this reason he has applied for a 2,000 USD loan. We wish him good luck!

loans.use: To purchase a new pressure-washer

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 24 year old entrepreneur who runs a food kiosk in Muthurwa market of Nairobi. He has requested for his first loan of Ksh. 30,000 to enable him start a new business of selling second hand shoes. He hopes to educate his wife, start a business for her, build a home for his family in Nairobi and become an importer of shoes. He describes himself as trustworthy and social.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Start a new business

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, tiene 43 años de edad y  es madre de cinco hijos, de los cuales 3 son mayores de edad y 2 menores aún. Ella  tiene una vulcanizadora (parche de llantas), lo apoya uno de sus hijos en este trabajo. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Águilas” desde hace  diez años, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él maneja su motokar. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, este dinero lo invirtió en la compra de golosinas, negocio que tenía y que piensa retomar.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 soles, ella comprará productos de primera necesidad (arroz,azúcar,fideos,leche ), ya que piensa poner una bodega en su casa. La meta de Guadalupe es tener una tienda de repuestos para motos y motocarros.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She is 43 years old and the mother of 5 children, of whom 3 are adults and 2 are still dependents. She offers vulcanization services (patching tires), which provides employment for one of her children.

Guadalupe has been a member of the Communal Bank "Las Águilas" (The Eagles) for 10 years. She has the support of her husband, who is a motorcar driver. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy candy for a business she managed and is thinking about restarting.

With this loan of 1500 soles, Guadalupe will buy basic necessity products (rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.) so that she can open a grocery store in her house. Her goal is to have another store selling parts for motorcycles and motorcars.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities in order to open a grocery store in her home

loans.name: La Casa Del Ahorro Group

texts.en:
L. Figueroa (second from right in photo) is an entrepreneur who lives in Guerra, Dominican Republic. Guerra is a small town in the interior of the DR, about 30 miles northeast of Santo Domingo. L. is a coordinator for her solidarity group called La Casa del Ahorro (The Savings House), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

L. is 27 years old and has five young children, ages 9, 7, 5, 3, and 2. She has a small business selling new clothing to her neighbors and friends. Fashion is very important to Dominicans, and L. has tried to capitalize on the latest trends. With this loan, she is going to buy the newest jeans and blouses which she will then sell to her customers. This is L.’s second loan with Esperanza, and she hopes to have more in the future.

Since Guerra is small and located in the interior of the country, it is difficult to access and lacks most utilities. Electricity is unreliable at best, there is no potable water, and sanitation is questionable. Despite these difficulties, L. hopes to raise healthy children with opportunities for a good education. She also hopes that with an expanding business, one day she will be able to have her own shop. Thank you for your loan to L. and to La Casa del Ahorro group!

loans.use: New pants and blouses
